This campaign is still active.  And we continue to welcome new "backers"!! 

BUT,... PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT NONE OF THE PERKS OFFERED DURING THE FIRST PHASE OF THIS CAMPAIGN ARE NOW AVAILABLE. 
However, we appreciate every contribution, no matter how small, and for a donation of fifty dollars or more you will receive a copy of CLANDESTINE: The Times and Secret Life of Mariah Otey Reddick when published. 
For those of you who wish to purchase one or more of the CLANDESTINE perks, you can do so at the CafePress website: https://www.cafepress.com/cp/customize/saved_products.aspx?fpg=%201&ufpg=%202. We DO NOT receive any income from purchases at CafePress.
THANKS TO ALL "BACKERS" FOR YOUR SUPPORT!! NO amount is too small!
WE THANK EACH OF YOU who has graciously given your support and/or donation to help bring YOUR and our project closer to fruition.  Thanks to you, we reached and surpassed our "goal!"   However, we are still accepting contributions because our pre- and post-publication expenses far exceed the funds raised.  So YOU can still be a part of this project and the journey of Linking Generations.
 ANY AND ALL DONATIONS - OF ANY AMOUNT - AND SUPPORT ARE MOST WELCOME.  THANKS SO MUCH!!
*******************************
CLANDESTINE – LINKING GENERATIONS: A story for all generations.  Help us encourage your child, grandchild, another child or young adult to learn more about their history.  If you are the young adult, do likewise for your parents, cousins, aunts, uncles, classmates, etc.
The writing of CLANDESTINE became a mission for Ife and Damani because it tells the story of a People’s resilience and the struggle to retain their dignity and their African customs and family connections, as well as a story of unconditional love, passion, and commitment - a story they felt obligated to share. 
Damani and Ife lift up and honor the ancestors' implacable resistance despite a century’s long effort to obliterate those cultural essentials.
So,..
...you discovered that YOUR enslaved Ancestor was a human wedding gift?  After the lump in your throat, the sadness in your soul and the anger in your heart subside, would YOU forget about it?  We could not!
GREETINGS FAMILY, FRIENDS, SUPPORTERS AND BOOK LOVERS,
WE INTRODUCE YOU TO:
CLANDESTINE: THE TIMES AND SECRET LIFE OF MARIAH OTEY REDDICK, a book inspired by the life of William “Damani” Keene's great-grandmother Mariah. He and Carole “Ife” Keene, as Contributing Author, decided on historical fiction as the best genre to tell their story.  CLANDESTINE is the book that each one of us would be compelled to write to ensure the preservation of the history and legacy of our Ancestors. We seek your help to tell our story, YOUR story, the untold story of a People marginalized in history.
                
                           Ife & Damani - Freshman Year at HU (1962)
Damani’s research has confirmed some truly fascinating oral family lore - but not all.  He verified that Mariah worked in the Montgomery, Alabama household of Confederate President Jefferson Davis. 
Family lore has it that she was a spy for the Union!
CLANDESTINE is the story of YOUR and OUR Ancestors!!  We felt our Ancestors pushing us at critical junctures in the writing.  Not only was this a husband-wife collaboration, but it has also been a Village project!!!  So many people have assisted us with research, with documents, with encouragement, and above all, with love.  #ClandestineBook
An impetus for writing CLANDESTINE is to promote LINKING GENERATIONS - the older with the younger.  It is important that we as a people, both young and old, learn as much as we can about our own ancestry to gain and internalize as much knowledge as we can about the arduous journey of African/Black people and others of good will.  We then must commit to passing this information on from one generation to the next.  It is essential that we push our youth to do likewise by stressing the significance of them becoming positively engaged in our communities. What a difference that will make!  Our youth must be an integral part of preserving the rich history of African/Black people.  In this context and in CLANDESTINE, people of African descent are referenced as African, regardless of their place of birth or nationality.
HOW MANY GENERATIONS OF FAMILY CAN YOU LINK?WE CAN LINK SEVEN!  THIS IS IFE'S SIDE...
          
   1st  Generation                    2nd Generation          3rd Generation


4th Generation. Carole "Ife" Kilgore Keene is a retired Information Systems professional. She is a twice-published author who now spends her time enjoying life in the Republic of Panama with her wonderful husband William “Damani” Keene. Ife is Contributing Author of the historical novel: CLANDESTINE: The Times and Secret Life of Mariah Otey Reddick, which Damani began writing several years ago. They expect to publish in the September timeframe

5th Generation. Khalid Valentine Keene is William “Damani” and Ife Keene’s oldest child. Khalid’s two awesome siblings are Dr. Kweli Keene Carson, wife of Dr. Reginald Carson, and Malik Imari Keene. Khalid is a well-established songwriter, producer, recording artist, drummer, performer, two-time Grammy nominee, columnist and General Manager extraordinaire.

6th Generation. Grandson Khalid Valentine Keene, II, also known as K, is the son of Mignon Green and Khalid Keene. Both K and granddaughter Nandi A. Carson (now a Spelman College sophomore) maintained a straight-A average during this past school year. K is now a high school senior. An abundance of shout-outs and kudos to them!

6th Generation. Granddaughter Brittany Jackson is the daughter of LaTisha Skinner and Khalid Keene. Brit has an amazingly wonderful story to tell of her search for and VERY recent union with her father, Ife and Damani’s son Khalid.  The families’ hearts are filled with much joy and happiness. What a blessing! Also, congrats to Brit on her recent promotion at the Navy Federal Credit Union and her upcoming wedding to Anthony Mills in August.

7th Generation. Great-grandson Jachai Jackson-Hughes is the son of Brittany Jackson and Carlton Hughes.  He is quite an athlete and is destined for greatness both academically and athletically.
Together as a village, we can have a huge impact on preserving our heritage.  We can do this powerfully by sharing with many others the resistance, resilience, beauty, glory, and splendor of African people and by participating in LINKING GENERATIONS.  We believe this is an influential and positive way to have a monumental effect on future generations.  Give a youngster a copy of CLANDESTINE and then dialogue with him or her.  
Again, We Humbly Ask For YOUR Support - NO DONATION IS TOO SMALL! 
We humbly ask for your support and cannot express our appreciation and gratitude enough!  Without you and your kind and generous donation and support, our project would be delayed.  Your willing participation in this effort validates our sense of urgency to tell Mariah’s story.  This is one of the many reasons we say that  CLANDESTINE is OUR story and YOUR story, too.
CLANDESTINE uniquely includes a wealth of true, but lesser known historical facts about the trials and tribulations, and strength and resilience of African/Black people.  We are committed to telling an honest, uplifting and inspiring story about how African/Black people have overcome and survived the challenges and injustices that we have faced and continue to face. 
We are confident you will willingly endorse this project if you are:  

a lover of people;
enthusiastic about future generations acquiring accurate knowledge about the  history of African/Black people;
a history buff;
a reader of historical fiction;
all about family and friends; or
all of the above.

We have expended substantial funds to get the project to this point.  However, there are additional expenditures, which require supplemental funds to complete the project.  They include funds:

to pay an editor – as a supplement to our monies;
for enhancements to website functionality; and
for the book jacket art and design.

We thank you in advance for your endorsement and support.  ANY AND ALL DONATIONS AND SUPPORT ARE WELCOME AND APPRECIATED - NO MATTER HOW LARGE OR SMALL!
Just So You Know...
Our personal expenditures to date include:

four trips to Franklin, Tennessee to conduct research and get a feel for the ambiance that existed during Mariah’s life at Carnation Plantation versus how the city exists today;
payment to two potential editors - one to review and edit the book’s Prologue and the other to conduct a detailed assessment of the entire manuscript;
payment to a crowdfunding expert to learn how to launch a successful campaign;
payment for marketing  and other software;

payment for the design and printing of promotional items for marketing CLANDESTINE; and
initial payment for development of the CLANDESTINE-Life.com website.


Contemplating her resilience and courage, Damani stands in The Quarters at Carnton Plantation, where his great-grandmother Mariah may have lived while she was held in bondage.
HOW TO DONATE 
You can receive your perk and make an online payment using your credit or debit card here at IndieGoGo.  American Express is not accepted by IndieGoGo.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU
In appreciation of your generous support and donations, we guarantee you a fascinating, honest, fact-based, intriguing, and yes, love story, primarily through the eyes of enslaved and free Africans/Blacks on three continents and the Caribbean. 
Additionally, as a SMALL token of our eternal thanks for your donation, we will send you a perk associated with your donation.  Click the "Get This Perk" button at the right of your computer screen to make your donation and to receive the perk associated with it.
The actual color, size, and image of the perk may be somewhat different from what is shown.  Due to extremely high overseas shipping costs, perks will be shipped to US addresses only.  Remember if you don’t provide a name and shipping address at the time of donation, we cannot ship your perk.  
For anyone who donates $350 and above, as an unwavering expression of our thanks, we offer an additional unique and exciting perk:
A complimentary 30-minute phone consultation with Gen2Gen Media, a company which creates videos that capture and preserve your family's history. 
In Gen2Gen Media's own words:  "Passing down verbal, family stories from generation to generation defines who we are.  Gen2Gen Media helps families by creating video memoirs that can preserve the story of a family, in their own words. The Gen2Gen Media team is experienced in the art of storytelling by providing intimate interviews and detailed editing to produce a quality documentary.  We believe that all family stories should be documented and recorded so let us create a unique personal memoir on video for your family today."
Gen2Gen Media:  Passing down stories that strengthen and celebrate your family.  Please visit them at www.gen2genmedia.com.
Donors outside the US will be acknowledged via our Facebook posts, Tweets and recognition on our CLANDESTINE-Life Blog.  And if requested, an electronic version of the CLANDESTINE mini poster will be emailed to you. 
Also, our plan is to release CLANDESTINE as a printed book and/or an ebook.  For those whose perk includes more than one ebook, please email us directly with the email address(es) for the person(s) whom you want to receive an ebook.
NOTE:  PLEASE SEE "UPDATES" FOR SPECIAL PROMOTIONS,BONUSES, DONOR RECOGNITION AND NOTIFICATIONS. 
JUST CLICK ON "UPDATES" SHOWN AT THEBEGINNING OF THIS STORY SECTION.  THANKS!!
OUR TRACK RECORD
Although we have contributed to crowdfunding campaigns in the past, we have never launched one ourselves.  We do, however, have a successful track record of sponsoring trips to Panama for almost a decade.  The largest group was an International Women's Retreat in 2004, with more than 100 Special Guests, including 80 who traveled from the USA.  Other groups attended the Panama Jazz Festival and/or vacationed at beach resorts and visited educational sites and, of course, the amazing Panama Canal – a wonder of the world.  We always received rave reviews from our Special Guests and had several requests to sponsor future trips, which we did.  And Ife has authored and published two books.
ABOUT THE AUTHORSFollowing is much more than you probably would EVER want to know about us.  However, IndieGoGo suggests that you get to know us. :-)Bill “Damani” Keene, educator, researcher and new Author, is a native New Yorker.  His early years were spent in Harlem, living in a small studio apartment in a five-story walk-up tenement building around the corner from his dad’s jewelry shop on 7th Avenue.  When he was eight, his family moved to St. Albans in Queens.  After P.S. 118 and J.H.S. 59, he graduated from Andrew Jackson High School, and in the Fall of 1962, was off to Howard University (HU), at the strong suggestion of his parents.  He was active in numerous campus activities and service projects and was chapter President of his fraternity, Alpha Phi Omega, the National Service Fraternity.Upon graduating from Howard, Damani entered the US Air Force as an officer in 1966.  He facilitated a Black History class at McNeil Island Federal Penitentiary.  He was honorably discharged, despite his outspoken opposition to the Vietnam War, as a Captain in 1970.  He then worked as a community organizer in Brooklyn, NY, and entered graduate school at Cornell University to prepare for a career in student services in higher education.  He led protests demanding that Cornell divest its investments in Southern Africa and led a memorial for the men slaughtered by the State of New York at Attica State Prison.Damani considered himself very fortunate to return to Howard in 1972 as Associate Director of Student Activities.  By this time, all three of his and Ife’s children had been born and he was enjoying fatherhood.  After returning to the DC area in ‘72, Damani and Ife had continued their activism on behalf of African liberation struggles and were honored to work closely with Kwame Ture (Stokely Carmichael) for many years.  In recognition of the importance of Africentric                                                      Ife & Damani at Africana Center     Ife Greeting Hero Kwame Ture                                      Cornell University - 1971              Howard University - 1998education, he and Ife volunteered in support of Ujamaa Shule and Watoto Shule, both in DC.  During his 32 years at Howard, he served in several positions, including 10 years as Executive Assistant to the Vice President for Student Affairs and for 14 years was in charge of student housing as Dean for Residence Life. He had shorter stints in International Student Services, Blackburn Center (Acting Director at its opening in 1979) and Acting Associate Director Athletics.  At the time of his retirement in 2004, he was the Special Assistant to the Vice Provost for Student Affairs.  Damani enjoyed all of the jobs he had while at Howard and his daily interaction with the students was quite fulfilling.Following a 2003 trip to South Africa, Damani and Ife decided to depart the US.  They conducted their research, looked at their options and chose Panamá as the best location.  They purchased a home in the mountains, sold their home in Maryland and, in October 2004, moved to Sunset Dreams, to enjoy their little slice of paradise in the mountains of Panamá.  This allowed Damani the time to begin his Family Heritage research in earnest.Damani continues to explore his interests in history and politics and shares his perspectives with others online (probably, too much!).Ife and Damani are the proud parents of three wonderful children, Khalid V. Keene, Dr. Kweli K. Carson, and Malik I. Keene. They are also the loving parents-in-law of Dr. Reggie Carson and the delighted and proud grandparents of Nandi Anika Carson, Khalid Valentine Keene, II, Brittany Jackson, and great grandparents of Jachai Jackson.Carole “Ife” Keene was born in Knoxville, Tennessee, obtained her formative education in Brevard, North Carolina, where she attended kindergarten and 1st grade, and then in Camden, New Jersey, where she graduated from Woodrow Wilson High School before attending and graduating from Howard University.  On her second day at Howard, she met William “Damani” Keene.  Together, they enjoyed many memorable times during their four-year courtship at Howard. Ife's most fulfilling pursuit at Howard was becoming a member of Gamma Sigma Sigma National Service Sorority, the Sister sorority to Alpha Phi Omega.  She especially enjoyed working on projects that focused on interacting with the youth in Howard's surrounding communities.  In addition to participating in several other campus activities, Ife was Dean of Pledgees during one semester. Damani and Ife were married at the end of their senior year.  Enjoying 52 years of a happy marriage, their motto is "Never stop  honeymooning!"           Upon receiving a Bachelors of Arts degree in Sociology from Howard, Ife decided to make a drastic career change to the information systems field – a profession dominated by men in the seventies.  She attended a ten-month computer programming training program, where she graduated #2 in her class.  As a result, she was offered a position as a Computer Programmer with the Space Division of General Electric (GE), where she worked for almost two years.  After leaving GE, Ife’s achievements were recognized by repeated promotions to progressively responsible positions during her 20+ years in the information systems arena, including Director of Business Development and Senior Vice President.  Her ultimate accomplishment in the information technology arena was to become a co-owner of a woman-owned and operated management consulting firm, Quality Solutions, Inc. (QSI). One of Ife’s most rewarding undertakings was to spearhead a successful one-of-its-kind international women’s retreat in the Republic of Panama in November of 2006.  The concept of Soothe Our Souls (SOS) and the retreat were an outgrowth of a book she wrote and published, Cancer of the Spirit, another of her notable accomplishments.  Over 100 attendees, predominately African-American women, some accompanied by their sweethearts (husbands and boyfriends), from many parts of the U.S., enjoyed a week-long substance- and spiritually-packed agenda, including dynamic speakers, workshops, book signings, excursions, tours, exhibits, massages and facials, salsa dance lessons, and unforgettable entertainment from Panamanian and U.S. entertainers. For many years, Ife also graced the motivational speaking scene and conducted workshops that focused on self-improvement, an underlying theme of Cancer of the Spirit.Visit http://www.sootheoursouls.com/sosretreat.html for a summary of retreat activities and testimonials, and http://www.sootheoursouls.com/gallery/ for photos.  Also visit http://www.smashwords.com/books/view/146049 for review and purchase of Ife’s second book, an e-book, All Of A Sudden It’s Too Late,#ClandestineBookMANY THANKS!!!  DAALU!!!  GRACIAS!!! ASANTE SANA!!!Again, we thank each of you in advance for your confidence in our project and for your donations and support.  Also, and more importantly, thank you so very much for all that you have already personally done to recognize, elevate, honor and promote the dignity and triumphs of African/Black people.  We cannot stress enough how much we would also appreciate your endorsement of our promotion of LINKING GENERATIONS. OTHER WAYS YOU CAN SUPPORT THIS PROJECT1.  Mailing ListSign up for our mailing list at http://clandestine-life.com/contact-us/so that we can tell you about our special program to "Honor Thy Ancestor."2.  Sharing on Social MediaWhether or not you give a monetary donation, we ask that you PLEASE SHARE the LINK to this INDIEGOGO campaign with all of your family and personal friends by:
Email 
Twitter - (Follow us: @DamaniKeene)

Facebook - (SHARING our posts at: www.facebook.com/carole.i.keene and www.facebook.com/DamaniKeene) 
Use #ClandestineBook
A resonating voice creates interest and excitement.  So, please let yours be heard.3.  Word of MouthWord of mouth is the most personalized and powerful vehicle for getting the word out, no matter what the subject matter.  This intimate form of communication will do the job, so PLEASE SHARE your excitement about CLANDESTINE.4.  Opportunity for an Interview – Radio, TV, Podcast or PrintThese media attract an audience of dedicated followers who have made listening, reading and/or watching a part of their daily/weekly routine. PLEASE SHARE information about CLANDESTINE with those hosts, writers or producers you know AND share their contact information with us.We gratefully and humbly express our sincere and heartfelt thanks!!

story:
¿Qué?

Auras negras da una vuelta de tuerca a la eterna lucha entre el Bien y el Mal, poniendo de manifiesto que su autora es un valor muy a tener en cuenta.

En un mundo medieval la Corona del Reino es objeto de conspiraciones, engaños y traiciones mientras que sus habitantes no son conscientes de la verdadera amenaza que los acecha, de los que viven camuflados entre ellos con aspecto perfectamente normal... Unos seres superiores, unos seres malignos: los demonios.

Pero ahora algo está cambiando, y es que los demonios se mueren, víctimas de una extraña enfermedad que no comprenden. Y eso es algo que su Reina no piensa tolerar por más tiempo. La profecía ha empezado y si la raza demoníaca quiere sobrevivir, deberán acabar con ese extraño niño… aunque no están teniendo en cuenta todos los factores.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Lidia Ciprés.

Nacida el 25 de febrero de 1993 en Hospitalet de Llobregat, donde ha vivido siempre, luego de cursar varios grados formativos, se matriculó en la Universidad de Barcelona en la carrera de Psicología, de la cual está a punto de graduarse. Además, trabaja como administrativa sanitaria desde hace varios años.

La pasión por la lectura y la escritura le viene desde la infancia. Ya desde pequeña disfrutaba leyendo libros de aventuras y escribiendo historietas que luego pasaba a compañeros de clase. Llegar a publicar un libro siempre ha sido una de sus metas, y años más tarde escribió sus primeras obras formales, entre las que se encuentra Auras Negras. 

Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en nuevos proyectos.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 970€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Auras negras que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Lidia Ciprés vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
As a tribute to my father, I am putting together a chapbook of poetry in his honour.  The title of this chapbook is Never Lick the Spoon.  The title refers to my dad's interest in chemistry and the way he and his classmates hazed his chemistry teacher.

My father, Reginald Freedman, was born in Johannesburg, South Africa in 1948.  He grew up during the Apartheid era.  He suffered from a stroke in his early '20s, leaving the right side of his body paralysed.  In addition, he had to learn how to write with his left hand and learn how to speak.  Dad was not able to speak for two years.  He met my mother in Israel, as they both "ran away from home."  They stuck to that story.  While living in Tel Aviv, my mum and dad lived through the Yom Kippur War in 1973.  My parents eventually married in 1974 and gave birth to me in 1981.

My dad was a great inspiration to me.  It was he who introduced me to Monty Python and Benny Hill.  It was he who introduced me to the music of Miriam Makeba and Fela Kuti.  It was he who proved that any obstacle could be cleared.  Dad's work ethic took him far in life, even with this disability.  Having been a lab assistant for years, his greatest accomplishment was working for Hoffmann-La Roche, a major pharmaceutical company.  His greatest accomplishment was getting a promotion to pharmaceutical chemist and his involvement in AIDS research.

On June 11, 2013, he passed away from the complications of another massive stroke.  As hackneyed as this may sound, I feel his presence.  Every day, I receive subtle reminders that he is within me.  Throughout this period, I have kept my humour about me and stayed true to my creative passions.

I wrote this chapbook to show him that I am still persevering, even amid the pangs of sadness and grief.  I want to show him that I will neither be hindered by my mourning, or let my creative spirit fall by the wayside.  Most of the poetry in Never Lick the Spoon have been published in journals spanning the country.  This is a project I hope will get off the ground.  Not only do I want to honour my father, but I also want to pass his wisdom and mercurial spirit to my son, Owen.  God willing, my dad's  strength and tenacity will reach future generations.

Throughout this period, I have kept my humour about me and stayed true to my creative passions.I wrote this chapbook to show him that I am still persevering, even amid the pangs of sadness and grief.  I want to show him that I will neither be hindered by my mourning, or let my creative spirit fall by the wayside.  Most of the poetry in Never Lick the Spoon have been published in journals spanning the country.  This is a project I hope will get off the ground.  Not only do I want to honour my father, but I also want to pass his wisdom and mercurial spirit to my son, Owen.  God willing, my dad's  strength and tenacity will reach future generations.

story:
Campaign Pitch

 

Golf is a remarkable sport. It's inspiring, fun, frustrating, addictive, unisex and global – so why aren’t there any magazines out there reflecting this reality? That’s where we come in…

At Caddie Magazine, we've been working hard for the last year to bring a new type of golf publication to life. We've sourced 125 pages of remarkable stories and breathtaking photography from all over the world, and put them into a beautiful, minimalist layout. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We took our idea to some of the biggest brands in golf. They’re still coming round to the idea, so we're having to go it alone for Volume One. 

We want to give the incredible content we've collated from around the world the space and quality it deserves, so we're printing it on thick heavy stock, perfect bound and matte finished.

Volume One will be timeless and, we hope one day, a collectible.

To do it right, we need your help to cover our print costs and release Caddie Magazine out into the world. We've secured a print partner, distribution partner and enough funding to get us halfway there.

Help us tee off with a pre-print subscription and let us be your Caddie – your trusted advisor, motivator, fellow traveller and drinking buddy.

 

The Impact

 

We love the game of golf, but even more than that, we love everything around it – the people, the places, the way it makes you feel, the freedom and sense of connection.

Caddie is pro-adventure, unisex, fun, and inspiring – a mag as much for the non-golfers as it is for the diehards. Because golf ought to be for everyone: the young and the old, for women and men – and even people who’ve never played.

We know golf is so much more than just a game, which is why we decided to share its incredible stories and stunning visuals with the world.

It costs a fair bit to get a magazine off the ground these days – especially one that looks beautiful and lasts the distance.

Caddie is a magazine, but it’s also a movement – we want to change the way the world sees golf.

 

We promise you’ll love it.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

We realise that we’re launching a product into an industry that is in the midst of huge change. Lots of people tell us the magazine industry is dying. And in a sense, when you look at the traditional golf mag – all colour glossy, overrun with ads and lacking gender balance, it’s not hard to see why.

But we’re motivated by the new wave of magazine publications that cater to niche markets with rich aesthetic, timeless content and a voice that relates to the everyday person. Our price point is on the higher end, but our audience is one that prioritises quality above all else. There is always room for a quality, tangible publication like Caddie.

We recognise it will take time to build an audience. Our readers and subscribers are essential to the success of Caddie, affording us the financial capacity to continue printing the mag. We have applied our professional strengths to broaden the Caddie umbrella by providing a range of products and services that complement the magazine and provide us with more financial stability.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Everyone that we talk to about Caddie say what a ‘great idea’ it is. In fact, “it’s a great idea” has become our weekly meeting catch cry. Now is the best time to support our great idea and assist us in teeing off.

We’re keen users of social media so ‘like’ us on Facebook, ‘follow’ us on Instagram and tag any of your golf loving friends on our social streams.

We see a huge future for Caddie and we really want to share our ‘great idea’ with as many as possible. We can’t do it without you!

For more details on the printed edition, see our website.

Caddie Magazine // Production stills

 

Caddie Films // Production examples
Mark Pond - Produced for Golf Australia

Nick & Bianca - Produced for Golf Australia

story:
Help Send an Aussie Poet to Ireland 

G'day. I am James. Bendigo based Poet and community/internet radio broadcaster on www.phoenixfm.org.au.

I have been invited to attend the Fermory international Poetry Festival, in county Cork, Ireland.

And I need your help in getting there…I’m going on an adventure do you want to help me go through with it?


With your help I am going on an adventure to learn about Irish Poetry, stories from all over the world. And I will share the Australian story with the world. Help me get to Ireland and you can follow me on Facebook, on Twitter and my live video diary on YouTube, see the sights, hear the sounds experience the magic and mystique of the Emerald isle.

I have also recently learned that my Irish heritage on my grand-mother's side is more robust and famous than I thought...I will be visiting some Castles and strongholds of the O'Reilly family...

This is the family crest of my Grandmother's family.


I will be writing a book about the entire experience. The book will be called Gathering by the Blackwater. it will consist of travel memoirs, essays and interviews on different forms of poetry and on the poets who attend the festival, and of course brand new poems about the entire trip, experience, by yours truly.

As you can see from my plans this entire experience—adventure—this once in a lifetime 

opportunity

 is going to be totally interactive. Follow me while I am travelling over the oceans, exciting foreign lands—sleeping on chairs in airport lounges, busking on the streets, sitting in the back of a magical mystery tour bus, around county Cork. Follow me into fame and knowledge of a sacred and majestic world of history, art, friendship and poetry.

Up coming release my first full length novella (part 1 of a trilogy)

Tuesday Suicide. Bitten Press LLC. 


Why is Poetry important?

Poetry is not just a guy or girl on stage fresh out of rehab venting a spleen in a dimly lit bar on a microphone…Poetry is the music of language. 

Poetry is the history, the beauty, the soul of a culture and I want to share the Aussie soul/spirit with the world.

Help me share the Australian story with the world.

http://soundcloud.com/james-wf-roberts-poet/we-leave-before-the-morning.

My first collection of poetry, Blue Electric Dusk
Numen Books 2013. 

Brief Breakdown of the budget and why I am asking for this amount:

Promotional Expenses:

Video and Editing Cost for Poetry video for online crowd-funding and youtube exposure:$300-$500 AUD.
Equipment Maintenance:
Camera/Laptop and MP3 Digital Recorder : $300
Paying for sponsered Featured Facebook and social-media exposure:$350

Estimated Living Expenses day-by-day Ireland:

$50-100 Euro per day $125.75 AUD

110-120 Euro for non-Abbeyville-non-festival accommodation:

Travel costs to Cork and to Dublin for academic research:

$500

Estimated Budget as of the above costings:

earliest estimated budget: $ 4,248.07AUD

$2284 AUD

Text box: going to:Text box: united kingdomText box: departure date:Text box: 29 jul 2013Text box: return date:Text box: 12 aug 2013Text box: traveller age(s):Text box: 30Text box: base policy:

https://www.travelinsurancedirect.com.au

Price for this flight plus tax according to travel agency is $2284 plus estimated insurance

base policy: $71 AUD.

At this time the actual itinerary of the Festival has not been finalised in Fermoy yet.

But, using last year’s festival as a guide, the rough day-by-day guide of the Festival and my trip there should be:

Morning meeting. Travelling from Fermoy to Limerick or Tipperary; perform at several pubs in the afternoon. Attend workshops

Three day accommodation after completion of Festival:

Bed&Breakfast Rate - Double Room -

1 Adult

AUD62.77 x 3 Nights AUD188.32

Subtotal AUD188.32

All budgeting and travel quotes taken from Jetset and Flight Centre are subject to change, due to stockmarket and traveling to Europe during their summer.

But to do this project properly as you can see from the above objectives I need to stay longer. in all certainly another 7-10 days would mean that the correct research and editing, interviewing etc is done.

story:
There are several real costs involved in the production of a book, the need to pay for cover design, interior design, layout, editing, formatting. Each of these costs adds up fast, which is why I decided to launch this campaign.

I don’t take any task lightly, and I do throw myself in deep into what I believe and enjoy, so writing helps me escape real life issues which we all have, I like everyone who reads this have suffered loss, pain, heartache, illness which is why I'm not going to list my life’s problems, I write almost every day I'm a family man with a normal job, but I have no spare income as family is first in whatever I do. So what I'm asking for is a sort of a leg up in funds, to help me get two or more of my books I have written, edited and covers done and formatting, along with all the other tasks necessary to get the book out there using a self publishing system still to be chosen, in paperback and e-book.

I write in several genre from Horror to Science fiction to whatever seems to pop into this weird head of mine, I have even written in friends who have asked to be added into or an entire story to be written about them, my written work is not too conventional, I use strong language but only when necessary, and I do describe graphic scenes but only when needed, as I do prefer to put in a description of what’s going on, leaving what I hope is the readers mind to conjure a picture of the event good or bad. There is sexual content in some of my works once again only on going with the story, and nothing non coessential, or under age. I have a few pieces of short stories and drabble, out in various anthology books but not a novel length so far.

I find it hard to describe what is in my mind and to place here to persuade you to giving some help for me, I can write a book but yet draw blanks when it comes to asking for help, I have the work done in a few written books and another well on the way, those I find easy enough to do but to ask people to believe in what I truly believe in, it’s simple I just can’t, I hope those who choose to read this can understand my meaning to those last few odd words. And last but not least is my fear of computers as not them physically but the lack of knowledge, and the statement, ‘oh its easy’ 'just do this and that press this and that', well I don’t understand the technology thus making the need for support that much more. Hence this is a much more simple campaign page than others as i do not have the knowhow to do all the fancy things.

I would like to thank my friends who so far have helped me out, but I don’t want to continue to press my luck and lose friends over an obsession to get my work out there, and if you choose to donate to my cause or not, I would like to thank you for at least reading this.

Thank you Darren Barker sometimes known as (Senior Maddog):

It would be nice just to hear those little words that mean so much, 'hey my dad/father wrote that book'. Feelings do matter:

story:
Why Primates? Why Me? Why Now?

Did you have a passion as a kid? Mine was apes. I could spend hours watching the gorillas and chimps at the Aspinall parks in Kent, where I grew up. I wanted to learn more about them. My college friends even said that I was most likely to be trekking in the jungles saving apes in my future.

But I didn't believe in myself enough to follow that path. Instead, I went to grad school, worked, married, and settled down. Admittedly, I didn't exactly do that in a conventional way, but I knew I wasn't a scientist so what could I do?

As it turns out, I could and can do a lot. You see I write. I write for a living. I write about things that fascinate me. And I write to teach others. I've authored several books, written for encylopedias, magazines, and more. 

So now it's time.

It's time to believe in myself, believe in my dreams, and write about apes. 

I'm heading to South Africa. That's an important point - no matter how much funding I am able to raise here, I am going to South Africa in the spring of 2013 and I will be volunteering at a primate rescue facility. 

So where does IndieGoGo come in? Simple.

I can afford to spend some time at one facility, but the more I raise, the longer I can stay and the more research I can. Raising extra funds will allow me to spend time at two facilities, including Jane Goodall's Chimp Eden, where I can not only volunteer but undertake an in-depth primate education program, learning about chimp habitats, rehabilitation, conservation, and so on.

With that extra time, experience, and research, I can produce a better result:

  • a book of photographs from my stay, illustrating conservation programes in South Africa
  • a non-fiction book about my time there and about the importance of primate conservation programs 
  • a slideshow and educational program which I can give at local schools and community groups

 

What I Need 

As I mentioned, I am going regardless of how much money I raise. But this is not a cheap undertaking. Costs include:

  • travel, both to South Africa and within the country
  • program fees, also living expenses and associated costs
  • vaccinations - to include hepatitis, cholera, rabies (I will be in contact with wild animals) and whatever else I need. OUCH!
  • costs associated with producing both books

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone can afford to contribute financially, but if you're interested in helping, as little as $10 can help my bottom line. You can also help by:

  • Sharing this with other folks you know. 
  • Reading updates as I post them here. 
  • Helping to support conservation efforts.

Read more about my work at www.fionayoungbrown.com or http://wanderingfi.blogspot.com .

story:
"In Stones of Remembrance Julie Presley handles some of the most difficult subject matter for young Christians with grace and style. Her genious approach to those subjects has birthed a new genre of Christian fiction written with the mature young adult in mind."

                                                                               Robin Pasley
                                                                                 Author of "The Healing Path"

 

UPDATE 4:

With only 4 days left and all of our initial goals met, we've decided that we probably should have factored in some promotional budget with the campaign! So, if you didn't get a chance to donate because we raised the cash SO fast, now is your chance to help us get the word out about the book when it releases! We plan to launch a Facebook Ad campaign as well as some Google ads as well! Every little bit helps!! Thanks so much!

 

UPDATE 3:

Got word today (6/2) that this campaign is featured on the Indiegogo homepage! I don't know how long it will be there, so check it out, I'm on the slideshow at the top! So exciting! 

UPDATE 2:

FULLY FUNDED!!!! IN UNDER A WEEK??? Oh my word! My heart overflows! I can not even begin to thank all who have made this possible. THIS FLOORS ME! SO WHAT DOES THIS MEAN NOW? All funds that are donated above and beyond the goal will go towards funding future projects, of which there are many!!! I can't wait to share them with you in the future! The campaign runs through July 8th, so let's see what else we can accomplish together! AGAIN!!! THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!!!

 Just a quick note: For those who have the perk of skyping with me, if you are local, we can meet in person, that's way more fun :) I'll be in touch with you all individually!

UPDATE 1: 

I am overwhelmed at the response! We are more than 2/3 of the way to our goal, and the campaign will run until July! I've posted an excerpt at http://juliepresley.com/2012/05/30/an-excerpt-from-stones-of-remembrance/ for your reading pleasure! Anything that is raised above and beyond the original goal will go towards funding future projects. I currently have 2 other novels ready for the editing process, and I am working on the second book in a series right now, so there is a lot of potential for the future! Thank you all, so much for continuing to support me and helping me make this dream a reality!

 

 

Short Summary

My name is Julie Presley, I am a wife, a mom, a singer and a writer! I was inspired a number of years ago to attempt to tear down some barriers in myself based on how I was taught growing up in the Church, and this book is the result of that process.

Stones of Remembrance is an out-of-the-box, genre pushing Christian romance novel about coming to grips with the fact that God is good, inspite of tragedy and pain, and recognizing that until we really believe in that truth, we can't fully receive the gifts that He has for us. Secondly, it embraces the fact that we were lovingly created as sexual beings, and that is not something to feel shame about or deny in ourselves. 

Allaya Sheldon, struggling to recover from a family tragedy, seeks retreat from the city, in need of solitude and healing, but she is met head on by what seems to be a huge distraction -- a childhood friend who stirs up something inside Allaya's heart that she never expected to feel again.

Finn Meyers has baggage of his own to deal with and his hard-hitting questions are what finally push Allaya to her breaking point, which is exactly where the Father needs her to be so that He can begin to piece together her broken heart.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The goal is to self-publish this novel, primarily for e-books to start, but also to print at least 100 paperback copies so that I can get into bookstores for signings etc., develop a following, and generate an income stream that can both print more books and create reserves for future publications, four of which are currently in the works including a three part series!

The breakdown:

//Basic self-publishing costs include purchasing ISBN numbers, editing, various website registration costs and legal fees. Those items total roughly $1000.

//Other costs include cover art, author headshots, campaign fees and on-demand printing fees (including shipping),  $2400.

I wouldn't ask you to support me without doing something in return for you. Please check out the perks to the right of the screen!

  

The Impact

This book is a realistic love story between God, woman, and man.  It pushes boundaries within the genre which have been long established and at times aggresively defended. To say that I embark upon this journey with trepidation is a mild understatement. However, one of the greatest things that we struggle with as believers is that we are fearfully and wonderfully made. It is a phrase that we attempt to understand and add to our belief system, but one that we seldomly recieve fully, much less walk in. This book helps the reader acknowledge God's goodness and grace in the way He created us, rather than shying away from it, repressing it, or receiving guilt and shame into our hearts. Stones of Remembrance resounds with clarity of the truth that we were created for intimate relationship with each other and with God, and that it is so easily attainable -- He doesn't hold us at arms length. He wants to embrace us fully, and His love is not selective.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

More than anyone, I understand that there is a time to give, and there is a time to tweet and update Facebook statuses. If you find yourself really wanting to support this project, but without funds, a tangible way you can help out is by spreading the word about this project!  Please make sure to include this link in all your posts! www.indiegogo.com/stones-of-remembrance

 

Get in Touch

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Julie-Presley/182254681814241

Twitter: http://twitter.com/jpresley48

Website: http://juliepresley.com


Production Credits

Video was shot and edited by Kara McDonald and the amazing team at Trolley House Productions in Dallas, TX and Rocky Presley.

Cover art work by Kyle Steed.

Photography by Keith Peeler Photography.

Original score composed, performed, and recorded by David Wilton.
story_txt:
"In Stones of Remembrance Julie Presley handles some of the most difficult subject matter for young Christians with grace and style. Her genious approach to those subjects has birthed a new genre of Christian fiction written with the mature young adult in mind."
                                                                               Robin Pasley                                                                                 Author of "The Healing Path"
 
UPDATE 4:
With only 4 days left and all of our initial goals met, we've decided that we probably should have factored in some promotional budget with the campaign! So, if you didn't get a chance to donate because we raised the cash SO fast, now is your chance to help us get the word out about the book when it releases! We plan to launch a Facebook Ad campaign as well as some Google ads as well! Every little bit helps!! Thanks so much!
 
UPDATE 3:
Got word today (6/2) that this campaign is featured on the Indiegogo homepage! I don't know how long it will be there, so check it out, I'm on the slideshow at the top! So exciting! 
UPDATE 2:
FULLY FUNDED!!!! IN UNDER A WEEK??? Oh my word! My heart overflows! I can not even begin to thank all who have made this possible. THIS FLOORS ME! SO WHAT DOES THIS MEAN NOW? All funds that are donated above and beyond the goal will go towards funding future projects, of which there are many!!! I can't wait to share them with you in the future! The campaign runs through July 8th, so let's see what else we can accomplish together! AGAIN!!! THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!!!
 Just a quick note: For those who have the perk of skyping with me, if you are local, we can meet in person, that's way more fun :) I'll be in touch with you all individually!
UPDATE 1: 
I am overwhelmed at the response! We are more than 2/3 of the way to our goal, and the campaign will run until July! I've posted an excerpt at http://juliepresley.com/2012/05/30/an-excerpt-from-stones-of-remembrance/ for your reading pleasure! Anything that is raised above and beyond the original goal will go towards funding future projects. I currently have 2 other novels ready for the editing process, and I am working on the second book in a series right now, so there is a lot of potential for the future! Thank you all, so much for continuing to support me and helping me make this dream a reality!
 
 
Short Summary
My name is Julie Presley, I am a wife, a mom, a singer and a writer! I was inspired a number of years ago to attempt to tear down some barriers in myself based on how I was taught growing up in the Church, and this book is the result of that process.
Stones of Remembrance is an out-of-the-box, genre pushing Christian romance novel about coming to grips with the fact that God is good, inspite of tragedy and pain, and recognizing that until we really believe in that truth, we can't fully receive the gifts that He has for us. Secondly, it embraces the fact that we were lovingly created as sexual beings, and that is not something to feel shame about or deny in ourselves. 
Allaya Sheldon, struggling to recover from a family tragedy, seeks retreat from the city, in need of solitude and healing, but she is met head on by what seems to be a huge distraction -- a childhood friend who stirs up something inside Allaya's heart that she never expected to feel again.
Finn Meyers has baggage of his own to deal with and his hard-hitting questions are what finally push Allaya to her breaking point, which is exactly where the Father needs her to be so that He can begin to piece together her broken heart.
 
What We Need & What You Get


The goal is to self-publish this novel, primarily for e-books to start, but also to print at least 100 paperback copies so that I can get into bookstores for signings etc., develop a following, and generate an income stream that can both print more books and create reserves for future publications, four of which are currently in the works including a three part series!
The breakdown:
//Basic self-publishing costs include purchasing ISBN numbers, editing, various website registration costs and legal fees. Those items total roughly $1000.
//Other costs include cover art, author headshots, campaign fees and on-demand printing fees (including shipping),  $2400.
I wouldn't ask you to support me without doing something in return for you. Please check out the perks to the right of the screen!
  


The Impact
This book is a realistic love story between God, woman, and man.  It pushes boundaries within the genre which have been long established and at times aggresively defended. To say that I embark upon this journey with trepidation is a mild understatement. However, one of the greatest things that we struggle with as believers is that we are fearfully and wonderfully made. It is a phrase that we attempt to understand and add to our belief system, but one that we seldomly recieve fully, much less walk in. This book helps the reader acknowledge God's goodness and grace in the way He created us, rather than shying away from it, repressing it, or receiving guilt and shame into our hearts. Stones of Remembrance resounds with clarity of the truth that we were created for intimate relationship with each other and with God, and that it is so easily attainable -- He doesn't hold us at arms length. He wants to embrace us fully, and His love is not selective.

If you find yourself really wanting to support this project, but without funds, a tangible way you can help out is by spreading the word about this project!  Please make sure to include this link in all your posts! www.indiegogo.com/stones-of-remembrance

Cover art work by Kyle Steed.
Photography by Keith Peeler Photography.
Original score composed, performed, and recorded by David Wilton.

story:
I am "Oz" and families at risk need your help.

Imagine for a moment that you come home from work today and it's raining. Your husband/wife also arrives home and you all grab dinner with the kids. You turn on the news and see that a storm is hitting the area and things are expected to get much worse. You decide to stay home because there have been false alarms in the past and you have candles and batteries and all the stuff necessary, just "in case."

And then the lights go out, and the wind picks up. Your 4-year-old daughter screams "Daddy I'm scared" from her room and you rush to calm her down. Suddenly a tree limb violently smashes into your living-room through a window, and as you go to the window to see the damage you notice that your car is floating away.

Things are getting much worse. The water is rising and is now seeping under your front door. You decide to get some survival supplies from the basement, but as you open the basement door you realize that your basement is gone, totally flooded and the water is rising rapidly.

Water is now rushing in through all of your doors and rising towards the windows. Now you're scared, really scared. You live in a one floor home and you're kicking yourself that you never fixed the stairs to the crawlspace. The water in your home is now three feet high and rising and you realize that you have to leave, right now. The two of you grab your kids and rush out the front door together, clinging to one another and to a few air mattresses that were in the kids room.

Moments after you wade into the rapidly moving water surge, the flotation you are clinging to is ripped away from you and you are all separated. You are moving at high speed in a torrent of water, refuse, trees and cars, and it is all going towards the Atlantic Ocean.

What do you do now?

My full name is David Osterczy. I am a photographer and writer by trade, and I shoot photos and relate stories that I hope elicits passion in my readers. I am a father of 3 amazing kids, and I have a story to share with you.

On October 29-30, 2012, Hurricane Sandy hit the east coast of the USA with a destructive force rarely seen in these parts. 15 foot waves repeatedly hit the shoreline in New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut. The devastation, loss of life, and destruction of property was massive due to several factors:

1) It was a full moon that evening.

2) It was high tide when the brunt of the storm hit.

3) It was a category 1 hurricane, despite what they tell you.

Several days after the storm I received a call from my friend, Bruce Spierer. Bruce is a young man committed to community service, in an organization we are both members of, MDI, which fosters service to mankind on many levels.

Bruce implored me to come out and help on Staten Island, which was hit particularly hard, and to "bring my men and anyone else willing to do the dirty work."

We spent the entire next weekend gutting and tearing apart homes, from the ceilings to the sub-floors. The sheer amount of refuse from demolition that our team of 30 men and women created was unbelievable,

yet it paled in comparison to what we saw being dumped on Midland Beach by huge army  trucks. The pile was about 30 feet high, 300-400 feet long, and about 50 feet wide. This was the demolished remains of peoples homes and lives, and more was coming every hour.


No-one could believe the sheer destruction. It truly looked like photos I've seen of third-world countries, yet here we were in New York City.


Afterwards, I was useless until the following Wednesday because I hurt in places I didn't know I had, as did many of the members of our team. Here we are after day one. I'm the guy kneeling on the far right with the grey camo pants.


And we went right back the following weekend and most every weekend since. No accounting for intelligence, eh?

This project is focused on the south shore of Staten Island, New York, and is the story of the families who lived through this horrific storm, some of whom barely survived, and all of whom lost everything they had. It will be told in "storybook format" directly from the mouths of those who lived it. All the passion, all the tears, terror, pain, and suffering that goes along with being a survivor of devastation. This story will also be told by the men and women who repeatedly put themselves in harm's way, the volunteers who refuse to give in to this day, and many days beyond until all these families are back in the homes that they love.

What I and my team are committed to:

  • Complete this book and multimedia campaign to spread the word and raise awareness that hundreds upon hundreds of families are still not back in their homes, a full year since the storm ended.
  • Raise $50,000.00+, to be able to dedicate myself full time to this project until it's completion (I already left my job. I am terrified and excited all at the same time!).
  • With this awareness and with non-profit aide, raise additional funding to assure that these families get the support that they need to rebuild safely, properly, and professionally.
  • Donate a large portion of book sales to YellowBoots.org, a 501(c)3 not-for-profit that creates miracles across the country when any sort of disaster hits. They are true heroes in every sense of the word and I am proud to have worked shoulder to shoulder with them on many occasions. 
  • And that every single family featured in this book (and many others) are safely back in their homes. I may be repeating myself here, it is that important to us, and to them. 

 Why We Need Your Full Support!

To be able to do this correctly, we need a great videographer, video editor, book copy-editor, cover artist, amazing publisher (speaking to Outskirts Press and I really like them!), lots of equipment, and a super-staff to assist me with the hundreds of interviews compiling many, many of hours of difficult footage.

Some discussed expenses we will incur are:

Professionally shot video @$150.00/hour X 100 hours = $15,000.00

Gas,Tolls, from The Bronx to Staten Island @ $30.00 per trip X 100 trips = $3000.00

Professional Video Editing (to be determined) and uploading all finished videos to a private YouTube account, accessible only with a login code.

Selp Publication Package including PR, Book Cover, ebooks, etc. = $1500.00

Professional Copy Editor for book = $5000.00

These numbers can be minimized to a degree if we buy our own equipment, however that too is expensive!

And of course there's the writing. So very much writing! If you've ever written a novel then you understand what a huge undertaking this is. Add the multi-media stuff, and, well, it's HUGE! Fortunately, this ain't my first rodeo, I've been published multiple times.

Additionally, we must be careful where we park in Staten Island. These people do NOT fool around!

Okay, now seriously:
  • Much of the money raised will go towards funding this project, however portions will immediately go towards supplies to assist the rebuilding effort.
  • Public relations will need to be enhanced and involved through my publisher.
  • A dedicated website upon completion of this campaign, for continued contributions through a 501(c)3 non-profit we are in negotiations with presently (it looks good and they love the idea!). 
  • And we need YOU to share this through social media with everyone that you know who cares about families, kids, and just great people in general.
  • And if we fall short of our goal, the funds will come out of our pockets, where they have been coming from for nearly a year now. This will happen, no matter what!

The Impact:

Just imagine yourself and your kids in this situation; you come home from work and it's windy and raining. No problem. You prepare dinner and notice that the lights are flickering and the wind seems a lot stronger. You look out the window and cars are floating by, some with people still in them.

The lights go out. Now you're scared. Suddenly water begins to seep into your front door. If you're very, very lucky you have a second level to go to, if not, what do you do? Your wife and kids scream as the waves bash in your front door and 7 feet of water fill your home in seconds.

Why am I repeating myself? Because this has happened to the people featured in this book, and much worse.

  • This project is only the beginning of a much larger idea.
  • Getting people to understand that there WILL be more storms similar to Sandy, and they will be coming more often than we are being told.
  • Our small team has accomplished more than 1.5 million dollars in demolition, rebuilding, and fundraising over the past 11 months with no prior experience and no professional backing. Imagine what we can accomplish with your help?
  • Nothing will stop us from attaining our goals.
  • What can you do to assist us?

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are not in position to help monetarily, please spread the word the best way that you know how. Social media is great for this, however word-of-mouth is amazingly effective! Please utilize the Indiegogo share tools to assist you in getting the word out! 

Please volunteer locally in your community. You have absolutely no idea how amazing it feels to be able to look in the mirror and KNOW that you made someone's life a little better today, tomorrow, and continue to do it! It is a truly empowering, incredible feeling! This work has changed my life, altered my focus, and all the volunteers I have had the honor to work with feel the same way!


The above is a cartooned piece of my art showing the amount of particulate matter and dust that our crew breathed in every week over many months. This is what a fully-gutted home looks like, leaving only the floors intact. It is included as one of the offerings (perks) to your right.

The image above was shot at New Dorp Beach on January 12, 2013. These were the very orange roots of one of many trees downed in Hurricane Sandy. So I may have mentioned that I'm an art-photographer? Well I created a style called "Imploded Nature" and this is what I created. It is by far my most popular selling image:

It is entitled "Hot Stalactites" and is included in the "perks" to your right, signed and numbered as a gorgeous Gallery Plexi. Gallery Plexis are the most beautiful way to display fine art. You have to see one to believe how amazing they are. Many fine artists here in New York will only display in this format due to the incredible nature of the high quality printing, and gallery quality plexiglass utilized.

Since I've never done anything like Indiegogo before, my friends have suggested that I "pull out all the stops" meaning offer as much stuff as possible to raise funds, especially since the holidays are right around the corner. So in the "perks" I'll be offering packages of greeting cards based on the 2 images below. One is a menorah shot on the 8th night of Chanukah rendered in my "Implosions" style, the other a winter shot of a pristine babbling brook and tiny waterfalls. They will be 10 - 5X7 cards (5 of each image) with envelopes all printed on metallic paper for amazing color and clarity. Your family and friends will display them proudly and may even frame them. Our lab is amazing!

story:
Story of My Book

Zelenia & The Heir to the Throne is a telenovela-inspired story of a brave princess who can pack more than a punch. With the looming decision that either she or her twin prince brother will inherit the throne, Princess Zelenia is met with rival royals, political secrets and emerging romance - while having to hide her lunar powers.


My name is E.Diana and I am the author of Zelenia & The Heir to the Throne. I wrote this book because I wanted to give Latines a fun, fresh slice of representation in a media world that otherwise depicts us negatively.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a coming-of-age story that has been long overdue in the Latin community. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with the re-imagined Caribbean islands, escape from reality to a world of dance and romance and learn alongside Zelenia about the importance of being true to yourself.

The Caribbean Monarchies have lived for centuries in harmony - that is, until the Cari War broke out. Princess Zelenia and her twin brother Celos were told as children that the Cari were just a fairytale, that these superpowered beings did not really exist among them. But when their mother vanished mysteriously, Zelenia discovered that she was the Moon Cari, and she had to keep it a secret for her own safety. Those who started the clash were still out there, and they want nothing more than to see all the Cari fall. The only people who share her mystery are her handmaiden Carmen, and her best friend, the servant boy Evander. She is isolated inside her palace without seeing much of the outside world aside from visiting the beach every night.

Zelenia longs to know what a normal life is like without royal duties, or uncontrollable celestial powers. The more she learns about the Cari, the stronger she becomes over time.

Once the twins turn 15, King Taveras rapidly makes plans for one of them to inherit the throne, causing tension between them. He deems Zelenia unfit for the throne and sends her away to finish school with the other Caribbean princesses. During this time, she develops feelings for one of the other princesses and deems herself bisexual. She enjoys her time there until two princesses discover her Cari identity and threaten her with blackmail.

Her father calls her back home on short notice. Upon returning, she meets Celos’ personal knight Fabian, who gives her an immediate negative vibe. She summons the courage to tell her father about her identity, which he rejects and shuts her down. Zelenia flags Evander and they run away together to the city, where their feelings for each other reach new heights and she is able to relish in the moment of being a normal girl for a night.

But it does not last long, and there is bad news awaiting her at home. The conflict for the throne reaches a new peak as the twins’ 18th birthday swiftly approaches. Zelenia must make a choice if she is to step up to the plate and become Queen, or continue hiding in the shadows of her family’s secrets.


You will love this book if you want more Latine representation, coming-of-age stories, and enjoy classic telenovela plots.

Zelenia & The Heir to the Throne speaks to the Latine community and young adults who want to grapple with identity and romance in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Zelenia & The Heir to the Throne inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What really makes someone family?
  • Does the way King Taveras treats Zelenia after she comes out become a quality mirror for the Latine community to see how they treat their LGBT+ children?
  • Is having a high social status really all that it’s cracked up to be?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing such themes will change us all for the better.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

E.Diana proudly works in a hospital and is very passionate about what she puts her mind to. She is always looking towards the horizon with bright expectations.

The idea for this book came about after a sudden strike of inspiration from a Biblical story. After pondering on the themes of found family, celestial powers, and a strong desire to give Latines (especially their LGBT+ community) much needed representation, E.Diana spent four years developing a story about a brave but emotional princess who she believes is much needed in the world of fiction.

In her spare time, E.Diana loves writing, reading, cosplaying, playing Animal Crossing or binging one of her favorite movie franchises like Star Wars or the MCU. Although clumsy and too soft for her own good at times, she has put her entire heart into Zelenia’s story to make her the girl everyone has been waiting for.

For more information, you can connect with E.Diana at caribbeanmonarchies@gmail.com and at @eileenxdiana on Instagram, and @ZeleniaHeir on Twitter.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ZeleniaHeir and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
E.Diana
story_txt:
Story of My Book
Zelenia & The Heir to the Throne is a telenovela-inspired story of a brave princess who can pack more than a punch. With the looming decision that either she or her twin prince brother will inherit the throne, Princess Zelenia is met with rival royals, political secrets and emerging romance - while having to hide her lunar powers.
My name is E.Diana and I am the author of Zelenia & The Heir to the Throne. I wrote this book because I wanted to give Latines a fun, fresh slice of representation in a media world that otherwise depicts us negatively.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a coming-of-age story that has been long overdue in the Latin community. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with the re-imagined Caribbean islands, escape from reality to a world of dance and romance and learn alongside Zelenia about the importance of being true to yourself.The Caribbean Monarchies have lived for centuries in harmony - that is, until the Cari War broke out. Princess Zelenia and her twin brother Celos were told as children that the Cari were just a fairytale, that these superpowered beings did not really exist among them. But when their mother vanished mysteriously, Zelenia discovered that she was the Moon Cari, and she had to keep it a secret for her own safety. Those who started the clash were still out there, and they want nothing more than to see all the Cari fall. The only people who share her mystery are her handmaiden Carmen, and her best friend, the servant boy Evander. She is isolated inside her palace without seeing much of the outside world aside from visiting the beach every night.Zelenia longs to know what a normal life is like without royal duties, or uncontrollable celestial powers. The more she learns about the Cari, the stronger she becomes over time.Once the twins turn 15, King Taveras rapidly makes plans for one of them to inherit the throne, causing tension between them. He deems Zelenia unfit for the throne and sends her away to finish school with the other Caribbean princesses. During this time, she develops feelings for one of the other princesses and deems herself bisexual. She enjoys her time there until two princesses discover her Cari identity and threaten her with blackmail.Her father calls her back home on short notice. Upon returning, she meets Celos’ personal knight Fabian, who gives her an immediate negative vibe. She summons the courage to tell her father about her identity, which he rejects and shuts her down. Zelenia flags Evander and they run away together to the city, where their feelings for each other reach new heights and she is able to relish in the moment of being a normal girl for a night.But it does not last long, and there is bad news awaiting her at home. The conflict for the throne reaches a new peak as the twins’ 18th birthday swiftly approaches. Zelenia must make a choice if she is to step up to the plate and become Queen, or continue hiding in the shadows of her family’s secrets.You will love this book if you want more Latine representation, coming-of-age stories, and enjoy classic telenovela plots.Zelenia & The Heir to the Throne speaks to the Latine community and young adults who want to grapple with identity and romance in a new way.Ultimately, I hope that Zelenia & The Heir to the Throne inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

What really makes someone family?
Does the way King Taveras treats Zelenia after she comes out become a quality mirror for the Latine community to see how they treat their LGBT+ children?
Is having a high social status really all that it’s cracked up to be?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing such themes will change us all for the better.

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.
