story:
Campaign Update - Paying it Forward

Future Pre-Orders & Donations will go towards Emergency Relief & Reconstruction Fund for Artsakh

Thanks to all of you, I've reached $8,000 - It's time to pay it forward!

NEW GOAL: Let's try to reach $10,000 together for a good cause. 

I will donate 50% of all future pre-orders proceeds past my $8,000 mark to the Paros Foundation  in support of the Emergency Relief & Reconstruction Fund for Artsakh. The other 50% will go towards future marketing efforts, as well as book promotion.

As an Armenian in California, it has been a tragic few months seeing the pain my family and friends have been experiencing due to the attacks on Armenians in Artsakh. Schools, hospitals, churches and more than 2700 residential structures have been destroyed and damaged. To support my community and culture, this is the least I can do. 

 

-

Story of My Book

 

Standing Out, While Blending In is about finding your own version of thought leadership and choosing to live with a growth mindset when leading yourself and a team in business and life.

My name is Alex Abramian and I am the author of Standing Out, While Blending In. I wrote this book to inspire the rising leaders of today and transform them to become the thought leaders of tomorrow. A majority of us were taught to seek stability and status quo, but I’m here to remind us to reach for the stars and shoot for the moon... to reach that next level of potential we all have within us.

We can only grow by trusting ourselves and taking the opportunity to step outside of our comfort zone by approaching projects and initiatives in a way that could bring some much needed friction to your work space and career path. We want to take innovative calculated risks we can and could learn from rather than dream about later and what we wish we had done.

This book is meant for people who feel stuck, people who want to embrace their leadership mindset and potential. Based on the experiences and practices of myself and other leaders, you will learn to be fearless in times of change and innovative during moments of contentment. With stories from Fortune 500 leaders like Elon Musk to global entrepreneurs like Sara Blakely, you’ll discover your unique leadership mindset and how to stand out as a leader in your own environment.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your own thought leadership potential and use my proposed mindset framework to get started on your leadership journey. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with your internal coach, escape from the traditional management norms and learn about the importance of showing up as a leader for yourself and those around you.

You will love this book if you enjoy learning about leadership trends, best practices, and want to dig into the mindset of what other leaders, CEOs, and founders have experienced while building their empires.

Standing Out, While Blending In speaks to managers wanting to grow as leaders and early career professionals who want to grapple with embracing a leadership mindset ahead of time that will allow you to grow in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Standing Out, While Blending In inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

 

  • How can I lead with more compassion rather than ego?
  • How does a leadership mindset impact not only the way we act, but also the behaviors of those around us?
  • Why it’s is it important to evolve the traditional hierarchical manager into a more collaborative thought leader?

 

I look forward to exploring these questions and more with my readers. I believe discussing purpose, trust, resilience and risk will change us all for the better.

 

The Book - Standing Out, While Blending In

 

The book is written in three parts.

Part 1 starts with a general understanding of what mindset is and why it’s important right now. You’ll learn about the science and psychology behind growth mindset from Dr. Carol Dweck, brain based research around mindset shared by Dr. David Rock, and Oprah Winfrey’s experiences growing up and how she chooses to view the world every day. We are living in an uncertain world and part 1 lets you find more certainty and be more accepting to the uncertain itself.

Part 2 breaks down the mindset strategy around your leadership journey. There are chapters in this section about understanding your purpose, building trust with yourself and those around you, enhancing resilience, and the power of taking risks. You’ll learn about my purpose journey and the journey of other famous companies and leaders. There are crucial elements of trust that you’ll learn about that will allow you to walk away and practice these skills in every day conversations; whether it’s understanding authenticity, becoming more empathetic, or practicing all 7 levels of active listening. There is also a chapter that tells you all about resilience where you will hear stories from my experiences, Abraham Lincoln, and learn an approach that will help you become more resilient. The last chapter in this section offers you stories and inspiration to have you look at risk-taking in a new way. In a way where calculated risks provide opportunities that you would have never thought of.

Part 3 is more focused on how this mindset is applied and used in the real world. There are applied experiences and stories shared for early career professionals, hungry aspiring leaders, ambitious students who want to start early on the leadership track, and people who are feeling stuck in their career and want to start making changes for themselves.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5000), I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6000), I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8000), I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

 

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

 

And much more!

 

About the Author

 

Alex Abramian is a Leadership Coach and Organizational Psychologist for leaders and founders in small businesses, startups and large organizations. Alex develops managers into leaders in organizations by enhancing their communication skills and improving their decision making abilities through trust, confidence and self-awareness.

 

With a PhD in Organizational Psychology and experience creating high performance leaders, Alex is quickly able to identify the development needs for behavior change and produce optimal performance and productivity for his clients. He’s also familiar with the entrepreneurial world and scaling businesses from his educational background and experience gained from USC with his Masters in Entrepreneurship and Innovation. By having the scientific and applied background in developing leaders and growing businesses, he decided to incorporate his learnings within this book.

 

Alex wrote this book to help inspire those around him who are ready to take the next step in their leadership journey. Alex’s passion is to help others grow into another version of themselves by being more self aware, conscious, and purposeful in all that they do. Each day he chooses to make a difference through one conversation at a time and this book could make that altruistic change happen at a larger scale.


On his spare time, Alex enjoys spending time with his friends, shredding on a snowboard in the mountains, and playing tennis on a beautiful sunny LA day. Family time is also very important to Alex and he wants to inspire his future nieces and nephews to live a life that offers them pure joy and purpose. 

For more information, you can connect with Alex Abramian at alex@alexabramian.com.
 

Risks & Challenges

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

With all the gratitude in the world,
Alex Abramian

story:
Short Summary

Searching for the Sun is a journey teetering upon the question of “what happens when we die”, seen through the lens of two characters: Death and the dead. Happy and Book, bonded by their isolation, attempt to discover where the sun lives, for what are friends to do other than seek out a golden orb running across the sky? Yet love, in all its sincerity, cannot block the past, as The Man, Happy’s creator, follows the duo. He lays a trail of red flowers in the night, luring Happy back into manipulation’s threshold. Such intentional delusions often tangle the strings of love, yet the sun still keeps its incessant pattern of rise and set. It is through the help of Time, an ancient tortoise seeking atonement for her ill treatment towards Happy, that the friends are protected. But tortoises themselves follow a similar up and down of the sun, and Time might stutter just enough for The Man’s words to yet again attain their influence. 

My name is Samantha Carter and I am the author of Searching for the Sun. I wrote this book as I struggled to understand the determination of death: the places we’ll go, the way it’ll happen, even the stereotypical personification of death followed an either sinful or melancholy trail. I wanted to do justice to these characters while simaltenously answering the question of “what happens?” 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that innocence can often be the weapon in which one may fight to retain themselves and what they love. It exists just next to their trauma. Walks alongside them. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to escape from the fear of the end and learn alongside Happy and Book about the importance of love and trust. 
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in November, 2020.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this April, 2021.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #SearchingftSun and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
S.R. Carter
story_txt:
Short Summary
Searching for the Sun is a journey teetering upon the question of “what happens when we die”, seen through the lens of two characters: Death and the dead. Happy and Book, bonded by their isolation, attempt to discover where the sun lives, for what are friends to do other than seek out a golden orb running across the sky? Yet love, in all its sincerity, cannot block the past, as The Man, Happy’s creator, follows the duo. He lays a trail of red flowers in the night, luring Happy back into manipulation’s threshold. Such intentional delusions often tangle the strings of love, yet the sun still keeps its incessant pattern of rise and set. It is through the help of Time, an ancient tortoise seeking atonement for her ill treatment towards Happy, that the friends are protected. But tortoises themselves follow a similar up and down of the sun, and Time might stutter just enough for The Man’s words to yet again attain their influence. My name is Samantha Carter and I am the author of Searching for the Sun. I wrote this book as I struggled to understand the determination of death: the places we’ll go, the way it’ll happen, even the stereotypical personification of death followed an either sinful or melancholy trail. I wanted to do justice to these characters while simaltenously answering the question of “what happens?” My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that innocence can often be the weapon in which one may fight to retain themselves and what they love. It exists just next to their trauma. Walks alongside them. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to escape from the fear of the end and learn alongside Happy and Book about the importance of love and trust.  

What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in November, 2020.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this April, 2021.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #SearchingftSun and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,S.R. Carter

story:
THE STORY BEHIND THE STORY

All around the world . . .

  • We buy ONE MILLION plastic water bottles a MINUTE.
  • We sip through ONE BILLION plastic straws a DAY.
  • We take home ONE TRILLION plastic shopping bags a YEAR.

 

Last winter, I was strolling on an icy beach near my parents' house in Newfoundland with my two young nephews. I stopped every few paces to pull bottles, scraps of plastic bags, and other shreds of debris from the rocks.

I explained to the boys, who had expressed curiosity, that I was collecting the trash to help save the plants and animals from getting sick or trapped. They considered this explanation for a moment,  then began collecting six-pack rings and bottle caps in their small mittens.

As we walked and worked, we paused every few minutes to take in a soaring bald eagle, a cresting whale, or an ice-pan heavy with seals. Jace (aged 5) pointed out a colony of whirring gulls, and Ben (aged 3) eyed a romp of playful otters against the backdrop of sea ice, twisted evergreens, and glistening black kelp.

"But . . . what happens if we miss some?" pondered Jace, spotting a single bobbing harbour seal. He examined his plastic-laden mittens, then looked to the seal again. What if we miss some.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

I want to share "Blueberry Bay" with as many children as possible, to spread the word about something so critically important and time-sensitive - because kids aren't just the future, they're the present, too. They, too, are responsible for making decisions that coud help save the sea.

My goal is to self-publish an illustrated storybook version of "Blueberry Bay" - but in order to do this, I will need to raise funds in advance to pay for illustrations, publication, editing, printing, and and distribution of my book.

If I'm fortunate enough to exceed my target, excess funds will be used to plan and fund an educational book and concert tour of schools, clubs, and libraries.

concept sketch by illustrator Leigh Davies.

WHAT YOU GET

In return for your support, you can choose from a number of Blueberry Bay pre-orders and perks.

  • The official audiobook companion (read by me!)
  • Private readings and musical concerts for children (ideal for birthday parties, clubs, and schools!)
  • Eco-friendly "character" merchandise
  • Signed first edition copies of the Blueberry Bay storybook  
  • A thank-you in the book's dedication
  • PDF e-book

 

SPREAD THE WORD

If you're passionate about marine conservation but can't spare pennies at the moment, you can help support plastic-free seas in other ways.

  • Please share and spread the word about this campaign - online and offline!
  • Ditch single-use plastic - there are so many amazing alternatives. Don't just stop at straws.
  • Pick up litter on your local beaches - encourage others to do the same.
  • Talk to your children about why single-use plastics are irresponsible and dangerous to people, plants, and animals.
     

 And in the words of our Blueberry friends . . . 

"Reduce and recycle, and choose plastic free,
Do what you can to help save the save the sea".

 


concept sketch by illustrator Leigh Davies.

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

Ashley Fayth is an award-winning Canadian singer/songwriter whose original compositions include commissions for Chester Zoo's global conservation campaigns. Her songs for sustainability have been endorsed by the European Association for Zoos and Aquaria ("Sing for Songbirds") and the Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil ("Palm Oil Conga"), and have even been translated into multiple languages. She has featured on BBC Radio 2, CBC Radio Canada, and has picked up awards from both Universal Music and the Canadian Songwriters Association. 

Ashley currently runs eco-themed songwriting workshops for children (AshleyFayth.com) and will be releasing a new kids' album in 2020. She and her husband Oliver live in Chester, UK, and are expecting their first child in September.

She hates coriander.

 

ABOUT THE ILLUSTRATOR

Leigh Davies is an award-winning creative practitioner from Wales UK whose work spans a wide range of creative disciplines. Leigh predominantly practices within the visual arts and audio design, with a strong focus on how different creative art forms and senses can inform each other and ultimately influence how artworks are drawn, sculpted, coded, animated, filmed, or performed. Some of Leigh's visual work include illustrations for a binaural children’s book 'The Thieves and the Cockerel' by Spacewalk Audio, as well as graphical interface design for software such as Mishmosh (Tate), Londonion (Film and Video Umbrella), pyka_loop (pyka) pyka_lens, (Cadw), and Acrux Seasons (Victor Gama).

Leigh is also the Director and Co-founder of an ed-tech company called pyka, who specialise in the design development of creative digital tools that are used to reconnect schools and young learners to their own creative capacity and the wider world around them.

Leigh loves coriander, but will stop at nothing to make sure it doesn’t get anywhere near Ashley.

story:
Secrets and Lies

New short fiction from the uncompromising and musical perspective of writer and comedian Josh Gross.


The Book
Stalking your pet's former owners. Faking your death to get out of paying back your student loans. Stealing your co-worker's cat to teach her a lesson about hygiene. These are secrets and these are lies. Sometimes they're both. They're also just a few of the stories in Secrets & Lies, author Josh Gross's debut collection examining things people prefer to hush up and gloss over.

In this book, you'll get inside the head of a cynical competitive debater forced to logically justify the existence of love, see an alternate history in which Congress banned heartbreak after the tragic events of February 14th and even experience abortion from a male perspective.

With Gross's wicked wit and wordplay focused through a lens equal parts existentialist and absurd, you'll be riveted from cover to cover.

In fiction, everything is a lie. Unless it's a secret.

Anyone looking for a teaser can follow the links to some of the previously published stories here.

http://thejoshgross.com/links/



The Author

In addition to his exploits as a musician, journalist and standup comedian, author Josh Gross has penned four produced plays, several short films, twice been a featured reader at the Wordstock Literary Festival in Portland, OR and published more than a dozen short stories in literary magazines like The Portland Review, Caveat Lector and The MacGuffin.

Those stories and more are set to be published in his independently produced and financed debut collection, Secrets & Lies, due out in summer 2011.


What We Need

The goal of this campaign is to raise at least $2425 to cover the expenses of a limited run publication and promotion of Secrets and Lies, and to establish and publicize online availability of the book through a POD e-store.

Expenses—itemized below—include design services through Jennie Jorgensen, printing and e-store setup costs, publicity and promotional services through ORRiginal Promotions.

$1264 printing/distribution
$511 Illustrations/Layout
$650 PR/marketing


What You Get

$5- "Evidence"
Contributors will receive a "clue" to the campaign.  This is your chance to participate in the fundraising beyond donating.....or you can just donate $5 and we would greatly appreciate it.

$15- "Secrets & Lies"
The book is yours accompanied by a limited edition bookmark with quotes from the author.

$20- "eSecrets & eLies"
This is the same as Perk 2 with an addition of the e-copy.

$50- "Proof: Secrets & Lies"
Includes a copy of the book, an e-copy and one of the original illustrations from the book.

story:
About the Kindle Kode Project

 

New York Times Best Selling author, Joel Comm, guides the path to writing and publishing your own successful books, leveraging the world’s largest digital bookstore. Aspiring authors want to write about their passions and interests, find their audience, and hope to potentially leave behind the 9 to 5 grind. Their path starts here.

 

With your backing, please help us guide aspiring writers to follow their passion, but with a strong dose of reality and practical methods.

 

Everyone has a story, experiences, and knowledge that is valuable when shared with others. Many would love to write and share, but fall back on beliefs and doubts that stop them short often never even starting.

 

It’s been said: “everyone has at least one book in them.”

 

We know they have more than that. So why haven’t they created that book? How can they know people will want their work?

 

The Kindle Kode takes them by the hand, and gives them the methods to satisfy that desire to create, find their audience, and thrive.

 

What is the Kindle Kode Project?

 

It is our five step system, delivered in multi-media, comprised of 5 distinct sections, delivered in 30 day increments, similar to taking a full course over several months. Here’s a short breakdown:

 

Kindle Kode ebook

 

A condensed digital book that guides you through all the steps to writing and publishing your own ebooks on Amazon’s Kindle platform. You will learn how to research and determine what readers who share your interests and passions search for, and what they buy. Kindle Kode students will focus on those readers to determine exactly what they want. The Kindle Kode ebook can transform students from wishing they can write and publish, to publishing their first (or many) books, that readers want to buy.

 

Advanced Techniques eBook

 

After studying the Kindle Kode ebook, learning how, what and who to write and publish for, next you will learn the techniques to find your audience and maximize your research, satisfy the readers and achieve your own goals and accomplishment.

 

Live webinar with Joel Comm

 

Subject. “How can I transform my past habits of writing, into this Kindle Kode system to provide income, for me and my family?” This live webinar will be available to all students and future members of the Kindle Kode Project. In addition to live coaching during the webinar, live Q&A will be included, providing advice and questions answered.

 

Custom Publishing Programs

 

For students who choose the advanced levels of our training, personal one on one guidance, coaching, and helping students publish their first ebooks in the Amazon Kindle Store will be offerred. The 2 Custom Publishing Programs differ in service level. One program consists of extensive step by step personal advice, to assist the students formatting and submitting their ebooks for Kindle publishing approval. The premium "done for you" program provides a complete turn key service, with the student furnishing their original edited manuscript to Joel's team. The team performs all steps, design, cover creation, formatting, submission to Amazon Kindle for approval and publishing. Of course, these invitations will be limited. We want to make publishing students' books a great success.

 

Our goal with the Kindle Kode Project:

 

For as many as will take action, apply our training and desire results, we will help members of the Kindle Kode Project write, publish, maintain and build successful writing opportunities and careers.

 

Thank You

 

To all the Backers of this project, we appreciate your role in standing with us, helping to create a path for aspiring writers to transform their ideas into books that will be published and read by their unique audience. Ideas without appropriate actions are vapor. Thank you for helping us build those ideas, and create something remarkable.

story:
Short Summary

Revelation Before Rehabilitation is a Publishing Company and movement founded by author Kristopher Holbert. Mr. Holbert began working on RB4R when he realized the lack of positive and ethical material being highlighted in not only urban communities, but in many other lower income areas across America as well. He coined the term “Revelation Before Rehabilitation” upon the organization’s creation to raise awareness of the lack of prevention-based life skills programs in America, despite the enormous amounts of money being pumped into rehabilitation programs of all sorts.

 

With a long family history of brute convicts and drug addicts, Holbert understands the country’s infatuation with rehabilitation. As most Americans know, statistically it is easier to track, allocate, and explain on paper the success and failure rate of a person once they are numbered, categorized, and designated to confinement. It is far more “efficient” than spending money on classes and programs that promote morality and ethics in a free society, which cannot be scrutinized as closely in areas that have high crime rates and low educational scores.

 

At RB4R we believe that every person is not created equal when it comes to understanding the true moral sense of what it is to be an American without financial or material relevance consuming your life. We believe that when a person is more appreciative of life and made aware of their significance to society, that person is more likely to invest into who they are. Moreover, they will build up (or Rebuild) where they are from when that philosophy is in line with what they stand for. When people have true stock in a community they are less likely to require government assistance or interference. The problem with this vision is this understanding must be gained and taught. The solution is people like you and I (especially those of us who originated in these areas) making contributions of time, finances, and energy to make sure that every person no matter their background has an understanding and sense of value in their personal worth and relevance. RB4R not only promotes you to appreciate you but also is dedicated to providing the Life Skills and a wealth of wisdom and knowledge to those in need, specializing in everything from literacy material to workshops, coaching and so much more. Please become a part of our movement today and let’s get this lifelong journey moving in the right direction.

 

PLEASE SAMPLE THE BOOK IN THE GALLERY!!!!

 

What We Need 

 The funding for this project is to not only market and raise awareness for the movement but it is also to make sure that the RB4R book line and Publishing Company has a successful launch, which is vital to get the word out. All of the funds will be used to support and market the RB4R Campaign and Publishing Company, starting with the release of the book Wisdom & Knowledge Sprinkled With Some Good Game: The Recipe For A Better You, which is available for sample in the Gallery.

What You Get

-Posters
-"I Am The Solution" T-shirts
-Electronic Copy of Wisdom & Knowledge Sprinkled With Some Good Game: The Recipe For A Better You
-PaperBack/Hardback Copy of Wisdom & Knowledge Sprinkled With Some Good Game: The Recipe For A Better You
-Ticket to the "Celebrity Launch" Party in Dallas
-The satisfaction of knowing you are making a difference

story:
There is a movement happening in cities around the world. Citizens are finding ways to rekindle their civic participation in government through technology.
 
I've been on the front lines of this movement for a number of years and one way positive change is happening is through open source programs, platforms, and philosophies. The movement is called: open government.
 
As many have, I found a powerful way to blend my passion for open source, local community, and civic participation in the open government movement. Along the way, I've met many civic-minded 'geeks' like me who have stepped up to advocate for a more open and transparent government.

My mission is to create a better citizen experience.

Improving the citizen experience means that interactions with government officials, policies, and plans are more participatory and collaborative. And that starts with having a more transparent, open, and inviting government.

I decided one of the best ways I could encourage this was to write a book about my experiences; I dubbed the journey: "the path to the open source city."

In my book, I explore what it means to be an open source city using Raleigh, North Carolina as an example. I highlight the elements of the open source culture there and provide insight into Raleigh's government policies and economic development in order to create a guide for other cities who want to or are currently pursuing an open source city brand.

Why this campaign?

This campaign will help fund the first 500 copies of my book, The foundation for an open source city. You can be one of the first to get a paperback copy of it--before the release to the general public--by supporting this campaign. I've published a version of the Introduction as a preview and to gather some feedback.

I've also created some fun perks for supporting the book--copies of the book (some signed), stickers, bookmarks, and, for a few, dinner and drinks in downtown Raleigh with yours truly.

Funding of this campaign will help with publishing the first copies of the book and fund the efforts to create an eCopy. All support and sharing of this campaign is greatly appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're interested in helping to make this campaign successful but can't chip in, tell your friends, spread the word, and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools. Thanks!

What about the license?

A few folks have asked about what license the book will be published under. It will be released as a Creative Commons work. This is the licensing information in the book:

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/

story:
Shortly after starting at a new school 13-year old Henry falls in love with a girl in the grade above him. Too shy to confess his feelings to her openly, he watches her from a distance... until he gets a chance which sets off an unlucky chain of events.

 

Background

My name is Richard Rothkugel and I am an aspiring writer. I started writing seriously in 2010 and have written two books (unpublished) and a few short stories since then. In 2012 I completed my Masters in Creative Writing from the Queensland University of Technology, Brisbane. 

I wrote Young Boy's Heart in the span of two weeks in 2012 for the The Australian/Vogel's Literary Award for young writers, a prestigious writing competition hosted by Allen and Unwin Publishing House and the Australian Newsagency. I did not win and neither was I shortlisted, but I felt that the novella I had written was the first piece of my work I wanted to share with the world. Since then I've spent a year editing and polishing it for self-publishing.

This crowd-funding campaign is important to me because I want to deliver a story of the highest quality that is enjoyable to read and memorable. I think my writing has something to offer the world and I want to share it with everyone.

 

Funding

The funding for the campaign will go to costs involved with self-publishing a short novella.

Of the $1130 dollars, $580 will go to a professional editor and proof-reader. Although I have proof-read and edited the manuscript myself I want to make absolutely sure that it is in as near to perfect condition as I can get it.  To this end I will require the services of an editing professional.

$440 dollars will go to creating a personal website for myself and small section for each of my upcoming books/works, including Young Boy's Heart. This will allow me to further advertise my work and create a central area where readers can access information and hear about upcoming news and projects.

A small percentage (4% or 9%) of the total funding will go to indiegogo, as per their terms, and the remaining money will go to miscelleneous costs such as hosting and domain registration (up to $50 for 2 years).

The amounts above are in Australian dollars so the exchange rate must also be considered.

The perks for this campaign centre around the final product, a PDF and/or eBook version of the novella. For every level of funding a contributor will receive both with the PDF/eBook versions. Silver will receive digital Letters of Thanks along with copies of Young Boy's Heart. Gold supporters will receive hand-written Letters of Thanks personally addressed to their shipping address.

I intend to sell the novella for $1 on Amazon.com, so I think it is only right to give everyone who contributes a copy of work. That being said, all contributions are sincerely valued.

If I do not reach my goal the funding will be prioritised according the most critical components for online publishing. This would be the editor/proof-reader first and then anythng left over would be put toward the website. 

Young Boy's Heart is already written and whether or not the funding goal is met, every contributor will receive a copy. The funding is purely for the level of polish the final product will have.

 

Beyond Young Boy's Heart

I love reading and I love stories. Before I wrote Young Boy's Heart I wrote two other books, one of which is a fantasy novel I am rewriting for self-publishing and the other is a martial arts manual (which still needs a little work). Beside these (almost) complete works I have many other projects  that I am working on. 

I enjoy writing and I'm passionate about it, but I'm not delusional enough (yet!) to think that I could do it full time and get a living salary from it. I'm still a student and these crowd-funding projects help me publish my work while still being able to eat and live. 

I write in my free time and every dollar helps me spend less time working for a living and allows me to devote more time to my writing projects.

 

Sharing is caring

If you like my work and would like me to write more, please share it with your friends or direct them to this campaign. Writing and publishing is tough without support and even sharing a few simple words like "Have you seen this book?" could mean the difference between being able to publish this novella.

There are also many in-built sharing tools that Indiegogo has to offer which may be invaluable for this campaign to reach its funding goal. 

 

Thank you,

Sincerely,

R.C. Rothkugel

 

Young Boy's Heart

      My brother was a strange boy. He had no friends at school and had spent forty-two days trying to talk to a girl he had fallen in love with. For the first twenty of those days I had closely monitored his failed attempts. But after twenty days I could no longer bear to watch.

      In the morning as we drove to school, I would turn around and see him staring out the window. His breath fogged up the dirty glass of our old car and his eyes were empty. I didn’t know at that time, but what I was seeing was the face of unrequited love. A love not acknowledged or returned in kind. The melancholy surrounding him was palpable. It made me sad to watch him. When I tried to cheer him up, he would simply hang his head.

      My brother was young, barely caressed by the curse of puberty, and small for his age. His features were delicate, almost feminine. Not a single freckle stained his face but a single deep scar hovered above his left eye like an upturned moon. In the morning-sun his eyes were a crystal blue and as the sun set beyond the horizon they would turn a deep green. He was growing his hair long. It was a light auburn colour any little girl could envy and would often get him mistaken as a little girl himself. This is how I remembered my brother... 

 

The full first chapter is available at http://youngboysheart.blogspot.com.au/

story:
TANQEED | a magazine of politics and culture

website: www.tanqeed.org

Twitter: @TanqeedOrg

Facebook: www.facebook.com/tanqeed.org

Artist: Ayesha Malik | "Kid on Bricks"

***If you'd like to send a check or donate via bank transfer, contact us: tanqeed@tanqeed.org***

It's time to change the conversation about Pakistan.

Tanqeed is an experiment in critical reflection. It is a quarterly e-zine that publishes long form journalism and essays that analyze contemporary Pakistan and South Asia. We think, we write, we report and we analyze the stories that the mainstream media won't cover. 

We are a crop of young Pakistanis who are, frankly, quite bored with the mainstream narrative about Pakistan as a country of total violence -- a failed state with a wretched history and no future. In our experience as journalists, academics and writers, that story is neither interesting nor accurate. We aim for critical analyses that dissect a range of issues without falling into a narrative of hopelessness. And we are developing a conversation that is multi-lingual: Tanqeed's issues are published in English and Urdu. You can check out the first 5 here. 

From observations on politics, culture and media to video, audio and multimedia, TQ takes account of a country that has hitherto been overtaken by its representations. We publish 4 issues per year with single-standing essays, reporting and multimedia work published in-between each issue. Our longterm goal is to develop a public place for hard-hitting, in-depth reporting as well as intellectual and lively discussion about our complicated present.  

We've already had a spate of wonderful writers working with us: Mohammed Hanif, Saadia Toor, Muhammad Idrees Ahmad, Preeti Chopra, Ammar Ali Jan, William J. Glover, Jakob Steiner, Abira Ashfaq, Aasim Sajjad Akhtar, Dr. Allah Nazar Baloch, Matthew Green, Ziyad Faisal, Malik Siraj Akbar, Sunaina Maira, Magid Shihade, Majed Akhtar, Daanish Mustafa, Badar Alam and Taymiya R. Zaman.

We also produced an unrivaled multimedia map for our elections issue. 

Issue 5: Space

Issue 4: Onwards Pakistan ~ The Elections Issue

Issue 3: Solidarity Politics

Issue 2: After the Floods

Issue 1: Room for Debate ~ On Malala Yousafzai

We've come a long way since our first issue in last November about Malala Yousafzai. Our latest issue, about space, borders and boundaries can speak to that. We now feature more original artwork and photography and more multimedia work including audio interviews and slideshows. But, there's still a lot more to do. So, contribute and help us build a better conversation.

We Are:

Mahvish Ahmad | editor-in-chief M.A. is an independent journalist and university lecturer living in Islamabad, Pakistan. She regularly reports on Pakistani politics and culture for a spate of news outlets, and teaches political theory at Quaid-e-Azam University, Islamabad. M.A. has previously studied at the London School of Economics and Political Science, and Harvard University. Twitter: @mahvishahmad

Madiha R. Tahir | editor-in-chief  M.T. is an independent journalist reporting on conflict, culture and politics of Pakistan. Her work has appeared in several media outlets including: Foreign Affairs, The National, The Columbia Journalism Review, The New Inquiry, The Wall Street Journal, The Herald (Pakistan), The Friday Times, Caravan, Left Turn, Jadaliyya as well as on Democracy Now!, PRI and BBC’s "The World," Global Post and other outlets. She is currently working on a documentary, Wounds of Waziristan and a long form article about drones and the terror wars.Tahir is co-editor of a volume, Dispatches from Pakistan with historian Vijay Prashad and editor Qalandar Bux Memon. She is a doctoral candidate at Columbia University. Twitter: @Madi_Hatter

Ahsan Kamal I senior editor A.K. teaches politics and history at Quaid-e-Azam University, Islamabad. His research interest focus on state, violence, political subjectivity, politics of nature and development, political theory, social theory, and colonial and modern history. He has previously studied at Columbia University, and will commence a doctoral degree at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

Salman Hussain | senior editor S.H. is a writer and a graduate student based in Wisconsin, USA. He co-edits Chapati Mystery, and writes for it as Patwari. He has written essays or various publications, online and in print, such as Dawn Books & Authors, The Sunday Guardian, and Counterpunch. His book on Pakistan’s civil war in 1971 and the subsequent liberation of Bangladesh, Towards 1971: A Personal Journey, is forthcoming. He blogs at Greased Cartridge, and tweets as @salmaan_h

Mehreen Kasana | social media editor M.K. is a media scholar currently based in Lahore, Pakistan. She has written for The Nation (Pakistan), Express Tribune and Dawn and has appeared in The New York Times, Jadaliyya, The State, Himal Mag, Huffington Post, Der Spiegel and BCC among others. She previously worked as a high school teacher in Sargodha. She blogs at Mehreen Kasana. Twitter: @mehreenkasana

Hafiz Soofi | editor and translator H.S.is an engineer by profession. Given time and inspiration, he likes to take on translation of English texts into Urdu.

Sajjad Hussein Changezi | editor and translator S.H.C.is an engineer by profession and a student of Peace & Conflict Studies by choice. He was born and raised on Alamdaar Road in Quetta.

Sheeba Bhatti | translator S.B. is a computer science major from AJK University. Her interest in different languages has driven her to learn Hindi (Devanagri script), Punjabi (Gurumukhi script), Korean and many local languages of Pakistan. She works as a freelance translator.

Anum Naz | intern A.N. is a graduate of political science from Quaid-e-Azam University (QAU). Her areas of interest include the Balochistan insurgency, the Iran-Pakistan gas pipeline and ethnic conflicts in Pakistan.

Palwasha Mushtaq | intern P.M. is a graduate of political science from Quaid-e-Azam University (QAU), Islamabad. Her areas of interest include questions around radicalization in Pakistan, colonization and decolonization, social/cultural constructs, especially the supremacy myth of man.

Why We Need Your Help

You maybe wondering why we need your help since we are an online zine. Although we don't have publishing costs, we do have production costs. We do a lot of work to put out each issue. Your donation would help us pay our journalists, writers, translators and photographers, develop our web presence and to keep TQ accessible. 

Specifically, your contribution would help us to:

  • Do more in-depth reporting. Our journalists work under enormously difficult conditions in FATA, Balochistan and elsewhere. They don't just phone it in. We generally require them to travel and go where the story is. 
  • Present critical analyses. Our writers spend hours writing and revising work to our standards.
  • Develop translations. Each story that is translated is literally hours upon hours of work that takes time but also creativity to render the meaning of an article properly. 
  • Bring you original photography and art. TQ now uses only original artwork and photography on our site. To change the conversation and to ensure quality, we try and stick to what you haven't seen.  
  • Develop our web presence. We can only develop the conversation if our website is accessible, legible and a useful read for our audience. We need money to help us work out the kinks.  
  • Keep TQ accessible. We hate going to to websites and being bombarded by ads too. But, we are subject to the same economic realities as everyone else. Help us keep TQ accessible for the widest possible conversation and readership. 

Giving in Pakistan?

Contact us for details on bank transfers or checks: tanqeed@tanqeed.org 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out about Tanqeed and about this fundraising campaign. Got language skills? Pitch to us and write for us or help us translate. 

You can find us at: tanqeed@tanqeed.org

Join us in changing the conversation!

story:
Short Summary

Velociriot! was conceived of by Reed and Samantha, two best friends who wanted to focus on creating a blogging project together. That initial idea transformed into this website, where posts are made on an almost daily basis that analyze and critique culture, politics, history, and more. Currently, Velociriot! boasts an unpaid staff of 10, all of whom bring different experiences and backgrounds to the table. Subject matter in posts ranges from cultural appropriation to musical empowerment to feminist and LGBT* issues from across the board. Whether we're focusing on political headaches that should have been avoided, Twitter accounts that we think you should check out, gossip rags that are getting it all wrong, or food and drink recipes that will make your stomach grumble, we'll always bring the most up-to-date, relevant and interesting content to the web that we can find.

Now that the site is approaching its one-year anniversary, we're seeking to improve on everything we do currently. We'll be revamping the entire site with a design from talented web designer Caro Griffin, inviting friends and peers to contribute even more diverse opinions, interviewing various people whose views align with our mission statement, and improving the site on a daily basis. We are also seeking to introduce a physical zine, products that make statements and empower our audience, and more. 

What We Need & What You Get

So here's the deal. Our fundraising goal for this campaign is $500. That money will be broken down as follows:

  • $125 will got to Caro Griffin for redesigning and restructuring the site, as well as moving all of our  content from our current server (WordPress) to a new server that will provide us better bandwidth and more control.
  • $100 will go to the first year of hosting on our new server. Moving from WordPress will allow us to avoid fees, have more bandwidth, and exercise greater control over our content, advertising, and more.
  • $50-$75 will go to advertising on social media sites like Facebook. These advertisements will help us drive site traffic and get more views, which will increase our visibility and help us raise the issues we discuss to a higher level.
  • The remaining money ($200-$225) will be dedicated to creating products that you can purchase, which will help us sustain the site from this point forward! We'll be producing a physical zine, posters, t-shirts, stickers, and more. Our goal is to get several artists involved to appeal to multiple tastes.

For every donation level, there are perks! We'll be giving away free copies of our first zine, free stickers, virtual hugs, endless thanks, and maybe some lollipops. We want to reward you for helping us out! So in addition to our eternal gratitude, you'll get some cool stuff, too.

If we do not meet our goal of $500, the money we do raise will go toward whatever we can afford from the list above. Hopefully, we can make up the difference some other way. But if we reach our goal, we'd be immeasurably happy.

The Impact

Velociriot! has already been publishing since mid-2012, and we've created a unique niche in online discussion. We mix together Buzzfeed's up-to-the-minute pop culture, Tumblr's social justice perspective, and traditional journalistic practices. From breaking down how "Peeta Mellark is the Ophelia to Katniss Everdeen's Hamlet" to reporting on sexual harassment in nightclubs, Velociriot is political and pop culture news for millennials that's actually written by them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate but you're a fan of the site, or you like what we're doing, you can help by promoting this campaign and the site itself! Thanks to our brilliant new social media manager, our Twitter, Facebook and Tumblr accounts are updated constantly with links to new posts, news about the site, and relevant subject matter.

By sharing this campaign with your friends and family on these social networking sites, you'll be helping us to get the word out so that we can continue to expand and grow, providing news, criticism and more on a regular basis. Check out the share tools down below and stay tuned! We'll be keeping you updated as the campaign progresses to let you know what's up. Thanks and keep rioting!

story:
Summary

Almost everyone agrees that rich special interests control our Congress, and that our so-called representatives neither know nor care about how we live and the problems we face on a daily basis; that the only thing they care about is getting re-elected.

The do not like the fact that our democracy has turned into a plutocracy, and that our government has devloved into a system of legalized bribery.

They think that there is so much money involved that they are powerless to do anything about it.

That used to be true, but now, Stupid Tuesday provides a simple and effective way to fight back.

We won't go into how it works here - you can visit the site and see for yourself.

Please Help

The site took over a year to create and was totally funded by personal savings and credit cards. Therefore, any amount you can donate will be greatly appreciated.

Like any website with (hopefully) a large number of members, there is always a LOT of work that needs to be done. And doing all of this work on nights and weekends while holding down a full-time job and trying to have some kind of "life" is not only extremely difficult but decidedly unrealistic.

Also appreciated:

  • Feedback on the site.
  • Help spreading the word. (Anything you can do here will be greatly appreciated.)
  • Help with managing the large amounts of data we need to deal with. (No specail skills are needed for this - honesty, integrity, and the desire to help others are sufficient.)
  • Add SellOuts to the site. Become an investigative reporter and shed some light on how our so-called representatives have been selling themselves to the highest bidder just so they can remain in office (or become a lobbyist after they leave Congress).

Notes About Contributions

1) We use PayPal, but you do *not* have to be a member or even join PayPal in order to contribute.

You can donate as a "guest" using any major credit card - simply uncheck the box labelled "Save this information with a PayPal account" at the bottom of the form. This option makes it just like using your credit card on any other website.

2) We list a goal of $6,000 because you have to do that when you set up an Indiegogo account. If we meet that goal we get to keep a larger percentage of the money raised; if we don't, we get less. (This is to discourage everyone from simply saying they'd like to raise a million dollars and is a fair policy.)

Rest assured that we can use more than that amount. $6000 won't even keep us afloat to the Novemember elections, and it pales in comparison to the billions of dollars that special interests spend buying... er, lobbying our Congress every single year.

 Thank You

story:
Getting Up

“For though the righteous fall seven times, they rise again” -Proverbs 24:16 NIV

Many people go on to accomplish great things but many don’t. The fact is most people live and die without ever scratching the surface of what they were put on this earth to do because of a moral failure, an addiction holding them back, a divorce that plagues them for years to come, or living a compromised life with little character or integrity. The purpose of this book is to equip people with a spiritual and practical plan to help them Get Up from devastating circumstances and fulfill their God-given destiny.


The Author

I've been in ministry, church marketing, and graphic design for over 15 years with some bible college training at The King’s College and Seminary under the direction of Dr. Jack Hayford.  I’ve served as a youth pastor, college pastor, & a creative pastor. I have had the amazing opportunity to see God move in the lives of so many people and am blown away at how He continues to change people from the inside out.

On the other side of the spectrum over the years, I have experienced the bondage of sexual addiction and substance abuse and have found freedom in both areas! I’ve been through two substance abuse treatment centers and a sexual addiction recovery program. I’ve been to counselors and have been a counselor from a pastoral role for many years and am very familiar with the shame and guilt people live in on a daily basis. I feel this book can help them on the road to restoration because not only have I been where they are but I am a living example of how this process can change lives.


The Impact

Getting Up is the story, the process that helped bring me freedom, and the biblical principles that helped me grow into the person God has called me to be. I believe that each person's story is unique and distinctly different but the principles and process of restoration are the same. My belief is that this process can help bring freedom to people worldwide.


What We Need & What You Get

I have a unique marketing plan and some creative ways to help people will get the most out of Getting Up, but we do have some costs involved and this is where your contributions will go:

1. Self-publishing costs. This includes editing, layout and interior design, ebook conversion, small group curriculum publishing, and getting hard copies in hand.

2. Website costs. This will be the interactive part of the project (getupbook.com). This site will host chapter intro videos, have links to download sample chapters & order the book w/ curriculum, along with a section for people to share their story of Getting Up to help foster restorative community.

3. Video production costs. The chapter & promo videos will be have a professional look and treatment so there will be production costs involved to get these done with excellence.


What you'll get in return is the biggest perk of helping people! Everyone who helps out with $25 or more will receive a copy of Getting Up. Check out the 'perks' section of this page to see all of the cool perks you get with each level of giving.


Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways you can help get this project going is by using the sharing tools located on this page. Sending out a few emails to your family and friends with a link to this page and posting this link on your Facebook page or your Twitter account would help more than you know!

Ashley is also available to speak at churches, youth ministries, high schools, and recovery centers or programs. If this is something you'd be willing to help out with or if you'd like to receive an advanced copy of Getting Up in order to schedule an interview or review on your blog or in print, email us at getupbook@gmail.com. Thanks for all your support! We believe with your help, many people will Get Up and fulfill their God-given destiny!

story:
About The Ne'er-Do-Well

The Ne'er-Do-Well is an independent literary magazine based in Portland, Oregon. Since 2008, we've published "misfit lit": stories and essays that explore the ironically universal experience of being the odd one out. We value prose that is well-developed, character-driven, and empathetic, and we value authors who are as obsessed as we are with the craft of writing.

What’s Next for The Ne’er-Do-Well…

After publishing three print issues of The Ne'er-Do-Well, we've decided to transition into an online literary community. We'll publish long-form stories and essays, and we'll have a blog dedicated to the craft of writing. We're raising funds for the design, development, and artwork for a new website.

Curious to know what the new site will look like? Watch the video above to see a wireframe presentation.

How Will This Be Better? We're So Glad You Asked!

  • Sustainability—of Time, Money, and Passion. We believe that a web-based publishing platform is a more sustainable model for us. We'll be able to quit doing those things that cost a lot of money and don't excite us—such as layout, printing, and trips to the post office—and instead focus on what does excite us: Stories! And lots of 'em!
  • Increased Production. With our new website, we'll be able to publish more stories, by more authors, more frequently. The Ne'er-Do-Well will be a vibrant, active space with lots of fresh content to tickle the eyeballs.
  • Increased Visibility & Reach. While a printed, physical book is a delight for readers and writers alike, web-based content is just so much easier to share. With our new website, we'll be able to reach more readers, and give writers the satisfaction of knowing their work will reach a wide audience.
  • Awesome Look, Feel & Functionality. Finally, we can be smart and pretty, thanks to Kim Genly of PIXELovely Web Design and Development, who has created a customized web design that is tailored to our specific goals and audience. The color palette will carry over (with minor changes) from the existing site (grey + blue + rust), but will have an updated logo and will feature brand-new illustrations from Portland artist Christian Labansky.

What Will We Do with Our IndieGoGo Funds?

Funds raised will pay the cost of web development, graphic design, and illustration. If we raise additional funds beyond our goal, we'll squirrel them away to ensure the future health of the organization.  

Details About Perks

We're offering three different types of perks to our donors: product, participation, and editing.

Product Perks:

Issue #1 ($20 donation): Our first print issue features stories and essays by Laura Bogart, Ryan Davidson, Allan Shapiro, Keith Rosson, Ricardo Perin, and Jon Lasser, with cover art by Dan Miller.

Issue #2 ($20 donation): Our second print issue features stories and essays by Lacey Jane Henson, Stephen D. Kelly, Eve Rosenbaum, Kara Weiss, Dan Moreau, Jane Rosenberg LaForge, and Maggie Morgan, with cover art by Jonathan David Hanh Vu Hill.

Issue #3: Working-Class Stories ($20 donation)*: This themed issue features working-class stories, essays, and comics from Willy Vlautin, Kevin Sampsell, Suzanne Burns, Gigi Little, Chris A. Bolton, Sheila Ashdown, Megan Zabel, Daniel Hall, Christina Mackin, Jill Holtz, and John Gifford, with cover art by Christina Mackin.

*Please note: Issue #3 was published as a fundraiser for ILWU Local 5. For every copy of this issue that is chosen as a perk, The Ne'er-Do-Well will donate $5 to the Local. (P.S. Support independent booksellers!)

Participation Perks:

Donors who opt for our “participation” perks—i.e., the opportunity to write either a one-line story ($10 donation) or a guest blog post ($40 donation)—have creative license to submit anything that strikes their fancy, as long as it's related to the craft of writing. Guest blog posts may include self-publicity (i.e., go ahead and give a shout-out to your new book, website, etc.), but keep the content relevant to an audience of literary readers and writers. These perks carry no expiration date.

A note on editorial standards: All submitted work will be held to The Ne’er-Do-Well’s general editorial standards. Which basically means have some taste and be civil. We don't expect this to be a problem, but just to be safe, let's cover our bases and spell it out: We reserve the right to reject submitted work, or request a rewrite, if said work promotes any of the isms (sexism, racism, etc.), is pornographic, propaganda, or poorly written. All work will receive a basic copyedit, but submitters are expected to turn in prose that is as polished as possible.

Editorial Perks:

Donors who opt for our editorial perks—i.e., critique of either a short piece (story, essay, or chapter up to a max word count of 5,000 -- $100 donation) or a full-length manuscript (max 80K words --$350 donation)—will receive editorial critique in the form of a reader's report.

Reader's reports are performed by Sheila Ashdown, who is managing editor of The Ne’er-Do-Well in addition to being a full-time freelance editor with nine years of related experience. You’re welcome to check out Sheila’s website to learn more about reader's reports and see Sheila's work samples and resume. Sheila’s areas of expertise are fiction, personal development, and health and wellness. She welcomes prose of all variety (No poetry—sorry!), but if you’ve got something really obscure, you should probably shoot her an email (sheila@theneerdowell.com) before you commit to purchasing the perk. If she feels she would not be a good editor for your work, she’ll let you know.

Also, please be aware that Sheila reserves the right to decline to edit writing that promotes any of the isms (sexism, racism, etc.), or is propaganda. She will probably consent to edit writing that is pornographic or poorly written, but will feel embarrassed for you both. Donors’ manuscripts will be handled in the order in which they’re received; if a wait list forms, Sheila will keep donors updated regarding wait time, and will do her damndest to return manuscripts in a timely fashion. These perks carry no expiration date.

Sheila’s areas of expertise are fiction, personal development, and health and wellness. She welcomes prose of all variety (No poetry—sorry!), but if you’ve got something really obscure, you should probably shoot her an email (sheila@theneerdowell.com) before you commit to purchasing the perk. If she feels she would not be a good editor for your work, she’ll let you know.
Also, please be aware that Sheila reserves the right to decline to edit writing that promotes any of the isms (sexism, racism, etc.), or is propaganda. She will probably consent to edit writing that is pornographic or poorly written, but will feel embarrassed for you both. Donors’ manuscripts will be handled in the order in which they’re received; if a wait list forms, Sheila will keep donors updated regarding wait time, and will do her damndest to return manuscripts in a timely fashion. These perks carry no expiration date.

story:
Empires fall hard.

When Jacob was alive, his lust for killing made him the perfect henchman for Simon's army of immortals. But after centuries of slaughter and war, Jacob's desire to find love leads him to the one person who could be his salvation...or his undoing. Now, at the end of his life, he has one final task remaining in order to save the world -- and himself -- from eternal torment.


And it is not a task he can accomplish alone.


The Impact

In this first novel by author Steven M. Baric, the forces of evil are ultimately pitted against each other. Though a lethal warlord in his own right for many years, Jacob is seduced into a world of ultimate power and dominion by the mysterious vampire wraith Simon. While on the surface it appears that Simon's constant hunger for wealth and control is little more than avarice, Jacob learns--almost too late--that it is really a far more insidious plot to prepare humanity for enslavement to Simon's master.


Having had enough of his warrior life, and looking to enjoy some of the fruits of his tremendous power, Jacob takes a leave from Simon's army. He falls in love with a precocious young artist named Ekaterina. Kat, as she's known to her friends, has a distaste for authority and is even less impressed with talk of military prowess. She is inadvertently turned, however, and becomes an immortal in Simon's service. Naturally that service doesn't last long and she falls in with a band of rebels who are trying to subvert Simon's influence.


Kat is discovered, and by way of punishment for both her and Jacob is promptly and brutally executed. Jacob, destroyed by the loss of the only good he's ever felt in the world, vows to destroy himself in atonement for all the death he has brought into the world over the last seven centuries.


But not until he has his revenge.


What's Needed & What You Get

The book is fully scripted and outlined, with key scenes and chapters already completed and fully linked. What's needed now is a few months (think summer) to push through the rest of the writing and editorial process. The book will be published and available online at Lulu.com this fall.


Consider contributions "pre-purchases" for most levels.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share this link, or the link to my Facebook Group at https://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=113446515340311&v=wall

story:
In the 10 years that have passed since Dana Edell and chandra thomas founded viBe Theater Experience to fill the void of artistic and mentorship opportunities for young women, hundreds of talented teen writers and performers have developed their skills and honed thier craft in our rehearsals and performances.

As viBe has grown and evolved, we’ve come to consider ourselves not only a resource for teen artists – one that empowers them artistically, amplifies their voices and encourages them to speak out on current social issues; but also as a model for arts educators seeking to engage youth through the performing arts. 

This year, to celebrate our 10th Anniversary, we plan to self-publish, print and sell StageWhispers: viBe Monologues, Poetry & More by Teenage Girls, our first book of original monologues and poetry written by teenage girls from New York City. This collection features the writing of viBe girls who address issues critical to them, and to youth around the country. It features brave, original poetry and monologues that are meant to capture a range of perspectives and experiences from girls who all call New York City their home. By publishing StageWhispers, we hope to inspire other young artists to use creativity as a tool for transformation, and to explicate viBe's pedagogy, that is, the unique way that the viBe "experience" uncovers and nurtures the powerful voices of teenage girls in New York City.

StageWhispers features over 30 of viBegirls and viBeAlumnae’s monologues and scenes.  Once it is published, a broad and diverse audience of youth, adults, teaching artists educators and avid readers can see through the lense of the urban teenage girl and enjoy pieces that offer a mix of humor, hardship, realism, idealism, hopefulness and celebration.  Readers can experience Alexandra's  discovery that her beauty and self-esteem extend beyond the contents of “a Fabulaxer perm bottle"  and journey with Unique as she challenges her father to take a more positive role in her life. They will smile and nod in agreement as they read Genna’s  humourous monologue about using “call waiting” to show her sister how to let go of a love gone wrong, and read with suspense throughout Brittney's haunting exploration of  a young man “on the down low” who is waiting for the results of his first HIV test.

We’ve aimed to make StageWhispers friendly to the young artist – just like our creative processes– by featuring supplementary quotes and tips from established female artists and “An Artist’s Life” section sharing youth-driven information and resources for readers who want to create their own work.

When you contribute to our IndieGoGo campaign, you will help to make this resource guide and archival collection of writing available to the general public.  It will help us to reach urban teen girls across the country, to spread our pedagogy, our methodology, and perhaps most importantly, give voice to some of the talented young women who have worked with us over the years.

As you know, publishing and printing a book is an expensive venture, costing thousands of dollars.  We’re pursuing individual and grant funding to help make StageWhispers a reality.  Your generous donation at any level - $25, $50, $100 $500 – or anywhere in between will help us to reach our $3,000 goal and bring viBe’s spirited work to the masses.  Please join us in bringing this viBrant book alive!

We thank you for supporting viBe, and the remarkable young women that we serve!!
