story:
¿Qué?

De cara al espejo refleja las vivencias, venturas y desventuras, subidas y caídas, en lo que no deja de ser una exploración del pasado del autor; un ejercicio de reflexión que viene a demostrar lo mucho que puede ofrecer una vida y, en este caso, es el propio autor quien nos la tiende en bandeja.

El hogar triste de una familia sumida en el depresivo silencio de la postguerra. Los primeros inmigrantes que llegan al pueblo huyendo de la miseria, con la voz de Elena Francis en la radio. Los abusos sexuales y las agresiones físicas en el internado de los Hermanos Maristas de Gerona. La aparición de la minifalda y las desinhibidas turistas. Las tradiciones locales en invierno y el desmelene veraniego. La picaresca del servicio militar de un antimilitarista, que coincide con la muerte de Franco. Amor y prostitución en las Ramblas de Barcelona. El matrimonio con una niña bien: sexo, drogas y rock and roll. La convivencia en una comuna de artistas e intelectuales, los primeros ácidos. La decadencia del desamor, los celos y el odio. La soledad de un camello y los estragos de la heroína. Los hippies de Cadaqués y la fascinación por la India. Tres años en Goa que culminan en un retiro budista en el Tíbet. Y el embarque en el J.J. Sister con rumbo a Tenerife…

Con mucho desparpajo, poco pudor y un provocativo sentido del humor, DE CARA AL ESPEJO narra las peripecias de un personaje quijotesco que busca sin tregua la alegría de vivir. Un inconformista de espíritu libre y atrevido cuya trayectoria viene definida por las convulsiones y cambios sociales que tuvieron lugar en las últimas décadas del siglo XX. Los estertores de la dictadura franquista, la liberación sexual, el boom económico, el feminismo, el movimiento hippy, la llegada de la democracia… Una tragicomedia trepidante cargada de erotismo. Una catarata de aventuras a un tiempo divertidas y acongojantes que atrapan al lector desde las primeras páginas.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Josep Maria Serra.

Nací en Sant Feliu de Guíxols, localidad gerundense de la Costa Brava, en 1953. Mi gran vocación ha sido la pintura, seguida de la música, artes que he practicado toda la vida. A los diecisiete años expuse mis cuadros por primera vez, y no solté los pinceles hasta 2004, año en que nació mi hija Eva. Mi formación ha sido autodidacta. Terminado el bachillerato, seguí los pasos de mi padre como agente comercial de trajes de novia, de primera comunión y de cristianar y ropa interior femenina, trabajo que me llevó a conocer España entera. También he sido fabricante de jabón, importador de bisutería, regalo y textil de la India, fabricante de moda juvenil, feriante, tendero de coral y caracolas del sexto continente, músico, cantautor, cómico y poeta, restaurador y heredero universal.

Un buen día de octubre de 2014, al mirarme en el espejo vi al niño que fui y me quedé patidifuso. Los ojos que tenía delante de mí no me observaban con la ingenuidad propia de la infancia sino con el aplomo de un adulto con una larga vida a sus espaldas. Por un momento no supe quién estaba a qué lado del cristal azogado. En ese instante eterno, viajé a toda mecha desde los años cincuenta hasta la actualidad, reviviendo el sinfín de experiencias que me ha regalado el paso del tiempo. Aquella misma noche me puse a escribir mi autobiografía novelada, convirtiendo mis recuerdos en las “memorias de un mentiroso sincero”.


Josep Maria Serra ha decidido desnudar sus recuerdos y vivencias para todo aquel dispuesto a entrar en su mundo.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de De cara al espejo que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Josep Maria Serra vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

de la dictadura franquista, la liberación sexual, el boom económico, el
feminismo, el movimiento hippy, la llegada de la democracia… Una tragicomedia
trepidante cargada de erotismo. Una catarata de aventuras a un tiempo divertidas
y acongojantes que atrapan al lector desde las primeras páginas. 

¿Quiénes?Tandaia es
 una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a 
autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes 
ideas como es el crowdfunding. De este modo eres tú, 
ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra 
que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro 
catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.Hoy se nos presenta Josep Maria Serra.

Nací en Sant Feliu de Guíxols, localidad gerundense de la
Costa Brava, en 1953. Mi gran vocación ha sido la pintura, seguida de la
música, artes que he practicado toda la vida. A los diecisiete años expuse mis
cuadros por primera vez, y no solté los pinceles hasta 2004, año en que nació
mi hija Eva. Mi formación ha sido autodidacta. Terminado el bachillerato, seguí
los pasos de mi padre como agente comercial de trajes de novia, de primera
comunión y de cristianar y ropa interior femenina, trabajo que me llevó a
conocer España entera. También he sido fabricante de jabón, importador de
bisutería, regalo y textil de la India, fabricante de moda juvenil, feriante, tendero
de coral y caracolas del sexto continente, músico, cantautor, cómico y poeta,
restaurador y heredero universal.
Un buen día de octubre de 2014, al mirarme en el espejo vi al
niño que fui y me quedé patidifuso. Los ojos que tenía delante de mí no me
observaban con la ingenuidad propia de la infancia sino con el aplomo de un adulto
con una larga vida a sus espaldas. Por un momento no supe quién estaba a qué
lado del cristal azogado. En ese instante eterno, viajé a toda mecha desde los
años cincuenta hasta la actualidad, reviviendo el sinfín de experiencias que me
ha regalado el paso del tiempo. Aquella misma noche me puse a escribir mi
autobiografía novelada, convirtiendo mis recuerdos en las “memorias de un
mentiroso sincero”.


Josep Maria Serra ha decidido desnudar sus recuerdos y vivencias para todo aquel dispuesto a entrar en su mundo.

¿Cómo?Para
 arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la 
cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con 
un ejemplar de esta primera edición.
Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.
Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de De cara al espejo que saldría pocas semanas 
después a la venta.Además... Sabemos
 que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible 
que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en 
estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, 
incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta 
campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Josep Maria Serra vea publicada su obra. Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
HOW I TRAINed TO LEARN RAILS is a book that teaches programming fundamentals and the programmer mindset to aspiring developers.


THE STORY

In June 2013, I wrote an article on medium called “How I TRAINed to learn rails” where I shared my story and the path I took to learn rails in 2 months.  The article went viral and was even recommended by the founder of Ruby (Yukihiro Matsumoto aka Matz). Since then, I’ve received hundreds of emails from people around the world that wanted to thank me for writing it. I also received success stories via email from people that had read and followed my article and landed their first web developer job after 2 months. Some of the readers asked me if I ever considered writing a book where I would go more in depth and share my experience and techniques. So I took their comments to heart and I decided to go even further into the subject and explain in detail how to learn not only ruby and rails but also how to think like a hacker, and learn coding more efficiently.

Unlock Each Chapters 

Every-time a milestone is reached I'll write a new chapter.

- $100 - Prologue - My Story

-  $200 - Chapter 1 - Cultivating the mindset

- $300 - Chapter 2 - Understanding Programming - UNLOCK

- $400 - Chapter 3 - The Knockout Method: How I train to learn smarter - UNLOCK

- $500 - Chapter 4 - Learn to search like a Hacker - UNLOCK

- $600 - Chapter 5 - It’s all about the syntax - UNLOCK

- $700 - Chapter 6 - My favourite resources and tools- UNLOCK

- $800 - Chapter 7 - Command line crash course - UNLOCK

- $900 - Chapter 8 - Getting to know Ruby like a ninja - UNLOCK

- $1000 - Chapter 9 - Pry Sensei : The debugger who told me everything - UNLOCK

- $1100 - Chapter 10 -This is how the web works - UNLOCK

- $1200 - Chapter 11 - The ABC of HTML/CSS - UNLOCK

- $1300 - Chapter 12 - Master your browser dev tool, Master the Web - UNLOCK

- $1400 - Chapter 13 - The 4 steps to DEV epiphany - UNLOCK

- $1500 - Chapter 14 - Jump into RAILiality - UNLOCK

- $1600 - Chapter 15 - Model, Views and Controllers - UNLOCK

- $1700 - Chapter 16 - Config files and Databases - UNLOCK

- $1800 - Chapter 17 - Mastering Parameters, Requests and Routing - UNLOCK

- $1900 - Chapter 18 - RVM, GEMs and GEMSETs - UNLOCK

- $2000 - Chapter 19 - UNLOCK THIS TITLE - UNLOCK


WHY DOES THIS MATTER FOR EVERYONE?

There are hundreds of programming books out there that focuse on specific languages but not enough that allow someone that have absolutely no background in computer or programming to learn how to code quickly.

I want to help people build a foundation that will allow them to learn ruby, rails and their next language smarter and faster. This book will show you the KNOCKOUT method I used, and the path I took to start from knowing absolutely nothing, to becoming a good programmer.

WHY DOES THIS MATTER FOR PEOPLE THAT WANT TO LEARN RUBY or RAILS?

Ruby and Rails just keeps on changing. Both Rails 3 and 4, as well as Ruby 1.9 and 2.0, bring hundreds of improvements, including new APIs and substantial performance enhancements. For someone that has absolutely no prior experience in ruby or rails this is a big deal. There are a lot of tutorials online available, and solutions for fixing bugs on specific versions but it is still very hard for someone with no experience to keep track of updates when they are new at this.

With this book, you will be able to filter the noise and the confusion, save hours of frustration and learn to dive between the differences in each version. 

WHY YOU SHOULD LEARN TO CODE?

In a world where kids are born with smartphones in their hands and iPads in their cribs, computer programming is becoming the new literacy.

Our world is increasingly run by software and we need more diversity in the people who are building it. Young people across the world are embracing technology and entrepreneurship.

With more schools integrating C.S. into curriculum for kids as young as 12, coding will one day be as foundational as arithmetic or grammar. Why not get ahead of the curve and start today!

If you have the talent to turn your great idea into a working prototype, this significantly increases the likelihood that it will become a reality.


WHAT MAKE THIS BOOK AWESOME??

A few things:

- This book is for EVERYONE

- This book has great advices for beginners

- It promotes computer science education

- The curriculum of this book will be high-school and university ready so other instructors can employ the techniques taught in this book to teach or start teaching.

- This is a coding book written as a self Improvement book that not only teaches you how to code but also how to become a good developer.

- It helps you follow your joys and fall in love with code.

- Coding is really like a super power.

TESTIMONIALS

This is what people said about the "How I TRAINed to learn rails" article on medium:
" I took a lot of the advice that you shared in your post when I was learning Ruby on Rails myself and thought you might like to know that your posts really helped accelerate my learning. " ~Leah Phan

"Your "How I TRAINed to learnRails" write-up at Medium boosts my desire to learn how to code. Thanks for writing it." ~Nar Dichoso

"Im learning Ruby on Rails. Its fun to write code! His advice comes in handy." ~Don Vito

"Fantastic source of info as I am looking into learning Ruby and well written." ~Michael Malek

"Useful!" ~ Alicia Casuso

"Thank you for this article. It reads like an honest conversation from an experienced programmer.I feel ready to start learning Ruby now, especially with all the material you have provided." ~Andrew Ellul

And the founder of Ruby himself:


WHO AM I?

I've been a Rails developer for about 5 years now. I am very thankful for all the great resources I found online when I was learning so now I'm teaching people about what I learned about learning. 

I am currently a Senior Developer and Team lead at Plumlytics and a mentor at Bitmaker Labs (a coding school located in Toronto). Prior to working there and on this book I was a Senior Developer at Rogers and Sportsnet. I was also part of Extreme Startup 2nd cohort  incubator and a MarsDD client with a few startups.

On the weekend I teach people how to code at DevWeekend. Where people can learn how to code on the weekend for people that have not enough flexibility to quit their job and commit to a 12 week curriculum course. The technique I use to teach people how to code in a month at DevWeekend employs the same technique I will be teaching you in the book.

WHAT’S THE MONEY GOING TOWARDS

To make a minimum order of 200 copies, I need you.

In addition, if I reach my stretch goals; I will work on video tutorial that will go with the book available for FREE online.

I’m writing all of this myself. Most of the funds will be production costs: printing the books and hiring an editor. And you'll get to be a part of the journey of a first time author that want to teach the world how to code.

Breakdown of budget

  • Editor for spelling and storyline
  • Purchase of fonts
  • Book and workbook layout design
  • Obtaining ISBN numbers, registration fees and costs associated with getting listed in online bookstores
  • Production of the books 
  • Shipping
  • Stickers


WHAT IF I RAISE MORE MONEY THAN WHAT'S NEEDED?  DO AMAZING THINGS HAPPEN?

If this campaign reach its goal for the book, I'll be able to release the book as a professionally-edited, professionally typeset, professionally-designed. The more money this campaign raise the more content I will be able to build toward the book such as online screencast.

Strech Goals

200 pre-orders need to be reached to unlock the stretch goals.

- ?

WHAT IF I DON'T RAISE ENOUG MONEY?

If I don't raise enough money. I will email all the backers and find out how I can make this book better. Without meeting the 200 pre-orders I might not be able to self-publish the book, but I will still release a shorter PDF version for all the people that supported it.  

DELIVERY DATE

I plan to release a final version of the book in February 2015. 

While I won't be delivering the books in time for Christmas, if you pledge $50 or more you will receive stickers for the holiday with an e-card from me. It's the perfect last-minute gift for anyone on your list.

story:
This is a crowd-sourcing campaign for my new book; Running Towards the Light, about a 6,000 mile journey I made across America on a 105cc Australian Post bike named Dorothy. It follows on from my first book, The Long Ride Home, about my initial trip from Sydney to London on that same bike.

For this second adventure we flew into New York from London, then proceeded to ride through Pennsylvania, Detroit, Chicago, along old Route 66, Kansas, Colorado and the Rockies, then Monument Valley, Grand Canyon, Las Vegas, Death Valley and San Francisco. From there to Seattle and up through Canada, to journey's end in Alaska.

Because we could only do 37mph this meant we had to avoid the interstates and major highways, forcing us along the backroads and sidestreets where most people choose not to venture. My budget of £500 also meant I had to camp wild, eat cheap, ride fast and loose if we were to make it last until the end.

This book is about what I saw and what I felt. It starts quite bleak as I deal with a few demons back in England, turning to the road once more and heading in search of happier times on that bike of mine. I also do my best to explore and understand America; such a fascinating place and somewhere I'd love to go back to one day.

There is no risk in this project as the book is already written and about to go to the printer's. Being self published I just need some help getting this first batch up and running. Delivery date will be mid to late November, with all books ordered at this stage coming signed and hand wrapped. After that it's down to Amazon and other such things.

The book is 290 pages long, with 24 of those containing full colour images illustrating the trip along the way. I'm really proud of the book. It's taken a lot of writing and agonising over. It's now just a case of getting out there, and it's at this stage where I really need your help.

Nathan and Dorothy.

(nb. For those who haven't read the first one, I've also done a reprint of that, now with colour images and available hopefully in a bit of a gift box, so ideal for someone for Christmas, birthdays, funerals and weddings etc)

story:
Short Summary

What if you're running for president of the United States and your brother is accused of murder and kidnapping.  What would you do?  Would you try to cover it up?  

What if you're the chief homicide detective and best friend to the senator.  Would you arrest his brother?  

What if you're the murderer.  Would you try to silence the brother because he may be the only witness to the crime?

These are the many questions facing the main characters in my novel, Nighthawk.  This is a story of three old friends who grew up together, and are now caught up in a web of lies and deceit that threatens the foundation of their friendship and the future of our country.

Senator Neil Peter Smith must leave his presidential campaign to return to his hometown to help in the fight to clear his brother's name.  The circumstances dig up a past Senator Smith has long been trying to keep buried.  Lies are told and loyalties are tested as the small town of Gainesville, Florida starts to wilt under the glare and pressure of a relentless press trying to uncover the biggest political scandal since Watergate. 

Set against a backdrop of racism and organized crime, Nighthawk provides the perfect dose of greed, betrayal, infidelity and redemption.  It is a race against time as the election, friendship and truth come dangerously close to the point of collapse.

As a native of South Florida, I have enjoyed many professional and personal experiences including serving as an aide to a US Congressman.  I hope my life experiences add to the dynamic quality of my story.  This is the end of a two-year journey.  Publishing my first novel will fulfill a lifelong dream. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • $10USD
         Friend

        As a Friend you will recieve my eternal thanks and a listing in the novel as a financial Friend.

  • $25USD

    Supporter

    As a supporter you will recieve my eternal thanks, an e-copy of the novel and a listing in the novel as a financial supporter.

  • $50USD

    Contributor

    As a contributor you will recieve my eternal thanks, an e-copy of the novel, a signed copy of the paperback novel and a listing in the novel as a financial contributor.

  • $100USD

    Sponsor

    As a sponsor you will recieve my eternal thanks, an e-copy of the novel, two signed copies of the paperback novel and a listing in the novel as a financial sponsor.

  • $500USD

    Guardian

    As a guardian you will recieve my eternal thanks, an e-copy of the novel, five signed copies of the paperback novel, a character named after you in my next novel and a listing in the novel as a financial guardian.

  • $1,200USD

    Angel

    As an angel you will recieve my eternal thanks, an e-copy of the novel, five signed copies of the paperback novel, a character named after you in my next novel, dinner for two with the author to an upscale Palm Beach County restaurant and a listing in the novel as a financial angel.


    The publication of a novel is a labor of love that requires community based support if it is going to succeed as an art form.  Most of the money will go towards the editing, graphic arts, photography and publication of my first novel.  I have always strived to make this a first-class project and with your help I will achieve my life-long dream of publishing a novel.

    I know some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Please help me get the word out about the campaign by mentioning it on Twitter, Facebook or any other social media platform.

    I have to lastly thank my editor and co-author Christa Davison.  Without her leadership, insight and incredible writing skills this project would never have been completed.

    Thank you so much for your involvement in this project.  This is the first of what I hope is a whole series of novels based around the characters I have created.  Your contribution is the beginning of a lifelong partnership between us.  Thank you again from the bottom of my heart.

I know some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Please help me get the word out about the campaign by mentioning it on Twitter, Facebook or any other social media platform.

I have to lastly thank my editor and co-author Christa Davison.  Without her leadership, insight and incredible writing skills this project would never have been completed.

Thank you so much for your involvement in this project.  This is the first of what I hope is a whole series of novels based around the characters I have created.  Your contribution is the beginning of a lifelong partnership between us.  Thank you again from the bottom of my heart.

story:
Hello. I'm Ronald Haynie, the author of "DUPPY: Ya Reap Whatcha Sow". My work has been expedited in three ways. It is a long awaited novel that is set for release in 2015. It is a screenplay that was converted and performed as an award winning radio drama via WBAI-FM (99.5) in New York City's tri-state area. It is also a stage play that has been performed in various theaters on the off-Broadway circuit, as well as the College of Southern Maryland's Theatre Department. I'm elated to collaborate with Ms. Toya Revo-DuBarry, a generous, diligent filmmaker who strives for excellence and who takes the art and craft of creating quality cinema extremely serious.


Contributions

All contributions, donations, volunteer help (Production Crew) will go towards the video production of the trailer and screen play for Duppy: Ya Reap Whatcha Sow. For official budget and production documents please contact by email or phone (after email contact) iamrevfilms@gmail.com or haynie.ronald@gmail.com.


The Impact

Mission Statement

Our mission is to gain the interest of reading literature through the use of digital film. We hope to inspire less likely, yet talented individuals to become writers and filmmakers, and to share their stories in an artistic form, through creative writing, script writing, stage writing, or whatever platform they are able to step foot on.

With the completion and success of our trailer, along with the success of the novel, the next goal is to begin pre-production on the theatrical series for television and/or web series for DUPPY: Ya Reap Whatcha Sow. We intend to bring out the beauty and grit of Harlem, taking our audience back in time, as well as introducing the work to a younger audience to see their world in a flashback. With quickly changing times in this digital world we live in, the full series brought to screen will allow us to target an audience that will find interest in a brilliantly written piece of literature, titled DUPPY: Ya Reap Whatcha Sow.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you will be in the New York City Area during Production 2015 and would like to be a part of the Duppy Production please feel free to contact us. Send an email with contact information to: iamrevfilms@gmail.com.

story:
A Short Summary 

Writers' Studio, in conjunction with The Cape Town Central Library, are taking Writers Boot Camp to Cape Town, South Africa. 

The Writers Boot Camp is scheduled to be held from the 24th – 28th of November 2014.The Workshops will be facilitated by acclaimed writers and teachers, and fueled by peer critique.  The six hour daily sessions are designed to help participants assess their own work objectively, while working on issues of craft. In the evenings participants will attend readings and interact with distinguished visiting writers who will share their professional experiences.

A series of evening events and a story exchange seminar powered by Narrative 4 will complete the workshops.

The Cape Town workshop will be facilitated by Jeffery Renard Allen, Rob Spillman, Rachel Zadok and Jenna Cato Bass.

The workshop is free and, as such, participants will not be charged any participation fee.

Objectives:

• To ignite the imagination of participants and then show them how to turn those blazing ideas into stunning stories.

•  To support and strengthen literature in Africa, especially South Africa

•  To create a platform for artists in Cape Town to express, develop and expose their art.

What We Need & What You Get


Writers' Studio is a non-profit organization that relies on the generosity of the literary enthusiasts for support. Our Scholarship Fund helps defray the cost associated with organizing our workshops, ensuring that our participants, especially those who have demonstrated promise through their entries participate in our programs free of charge.

We see our projects as pivotal given that writers in Africa often have either limited or no access to educational opportunities and training.

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need to raise $18 000 to cover the costs involved with bringing the facilitators and  to Cape Town. This includes travel, accommodation and nosh. (don't tell them, but we're planning on feeding them sandwiches).  Every facilitator is donating their time for free. 
  • $2000 goes towards workshop materials and refreshments for the participants and facilitators. 
  • $1000 goes towards covering fees and charges related to this campaign.
  • Cape Town Central Library has partnered with us and is providing the venue. We're grateful to them that we don't have to pay for that. This is a picture of the amazing amphitheater where our readings will take place.
  • Help us a little and we'll splash our gratitude all over social media, which will make you very popular. One can't put a price on popularity. A little more and one of the acclaimed authors involved will personally email you a short story attached to the end of a thank you note. Give generously, and  award-winning author of your choice will sign and personally inscribe a copy of their book and send it to you.  Sponsors wanting to benefit from the good PR this project generates for all involved can buy a spot on our website and programme for their company logo.  We're doing this for the love of African literature, and we know you're funding us for the same reason.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we're still determined to go ahead with the Boot Camp. We'll just have to find other ways of raising the money.


The Impact

Creative writing workshops offer people an opportunity for self-expression and help them to shape their thoughts and transform their experiences into powerful stories or pieces. Writers' Studio organizes programs for anyone wishing to nurture their creativity, stimulate their imagination and develop their writing skills. Writers' Studio is for both beginner writers who want to get the fundamental techniques of writing under their belt, and also for experienced writers who wish to sharpen their writing skills. 

Writers’ Studio was started in 2013 by Nigerian writer, Samuel Kolawole as a leap of faith.  He used the money for his rent and moved to his parent’s house. Within a short time Writers Studio successfully organized writing workshops in major cities in Nigeria with hundreds of writers participating. The project was so well-received that in 2014 the organization decided to extend her activities to other African countries.  In June 2014, Writers’ Studio presented a five day workshop during the 2014 Writivism Festival in Kampala, Uganda. The project was in collaboration with Center for African Cultural Excellence (CACE), The Prince Claus Fund, The Danish Centre for Culture and Development, Open Society Initiative for Eastern Africa and The African Writers Trust.

Past facilitators of Writers' Studio workshops have included: literary agent, David Godwin, Zukiswa Wanner, NoViolet Bulawayo, Abubakar Adam Ibrahim, Toni Kan, Igoni Barrett, Yewande Omotoso, Jennifer Nansubuga Makumbi, Ayodele Morroco Clarke, amongst others.


Testimonials from Participants

If you've ever wondered whether there's an emerging writer, poet or journalist in you, then a Writers' Studio workshop is an opportunity you definitely don't want to miss. Let your imagination be unleashed and you'll be very pleasantly surprised. Samuel Kolawole and his friendly team put together a well organised, inspiring program - excellent value and great fun. Don't miss out, just do it!"

Dayo Abayomi, Senior Consultant Gynaecologist, Ibadan/London

“Sam Kolawole and the Writers' Studio team gave me the best days of my recent life. The absolute best!”

Frank Mba

Airline worker

"Attending Writers' Studio was like finding that missing screw... A forum where you have access to the minds of beautiful writers..."

Harry Okoromadu

Lawyer and Team Leader, ACE Network

"The Writers' workshop in Ibadan remains, for me, a re-awakening- a timely wake up call for a sleeping muse. The sessions on Creative Non-Fiction, Developing as a Creative Writer, Prose Writing, and Poetry especially, granted me a fresh look at the creative landscape... I recall...the mere presence of those gifted facilitators...The next time I put pen to paper, I felt something well up from within me-a new wave of creative energy..."

Koleola Oladayo Jacob

Lawyer

“What I enjoyed most from the Writers’ Studio Workshop were the intensive reading and writing exercises. These took me away from my comfort zone; when your work is critiqued you learn to be humble and develop a tough skin in the process. I also had the opportunity to ask celebrated writers on the continent questions and they were very helpful. In the end, you have an obligation to yourself to write, and the more you do that, the more you learn to write."

Emmanuel Anyole


About the Workshop Facilitators

Jeffery Renard Allen

Jeffery Renard Allen is the author of five books, most recently the widely celebrated novel Song of the Shank, which is a riff on the life of Thomas Greene Wiggins, a nineteenth century African American piano virtuoso and composer who performed under the stage name Blind Tom. The novel was featured on the front page of the New York Times Book Review.  Allen is also the author of two collections of poetry, and two other works of fiction. He is the recipient The Chicago Tribune's Heartland Prize and the Ernest J. Gaines Award for Literary Excellence.

Born in Chicago, he holds a Ph.D. in English (Creative Writing) from the University of Illinois at Chicago and is currently a faculty member in the writing program at the New School. He is fiction director for the Norman Mailer Center’s Writers Colony in Provincetown, and served as the Program Director for Literature for the Jahazi Literature and Jazz Festival in Zanzibar, East Africa.

Allen is the proud father of three children and is happily married to Zawadi Kagoma Katunzi Allen, who is formerly of Tanzania.

Rob Spillman

Rob Spillman is editor of Tin House magazine and editorial advisor of Tin House Books. He was previously the monthly book columnist for Details magazine and is a contributor of book reviews and essays to Salon and Bookforum. He has written for the Baltimore Sun, the Boston Review, British GQ, Connoisseur, Details, Nerve, the New York Times Book Review, Premiere, Rolling Stone, Spin, Sports Illustrated, SPY, Vanity Fair, Vogue, and Worth, among other magazines, newspapers, and online magazines. He has also worked for Random House, Vanity Fair, and the New Yorker.

Rachel Zadok

Rachel Zadok is a writer and publisher. She has a National Diploma in Fine Art and is a graduate of The Novel Studio, City University, London. She is the author of two acclaimed novels; Gem Squash Tokoloshe, nominated for the Whitbread First Novel Award, the John Llewellyn Rhys Prize, the IMPAC award; and Sister-Sister, nominated for the Herman Charles Bosman Prize, the University of Johannesburg  Prize, and l The Sunday Times Fiction Award.

In 2011, she launched Short Story Day Africa, an initiative to highlight African short fiction. 

Jenna Cato Bass

Jenna Bass is a South African writer, filmmaker and ex-magician. Her films have been screened at the Sundance,  Berlin Film and the Durban International Festivals.  In 2012, under her pen-name, Constance Myburgh, she was shortlisted for the Caine Prize for African Writing. Jenna is also the editor and co-creator of Africa’s only pulp-literary magazine, Jungle Jim, and a programmer for the Encounters Documentary Film Festival. 

Story Exchange by Narrative 4

Narrative 4 is a global organization headed up by some of the world’s most renowned and influential authors, artists and community leaders who have come together to promote empathy through the exchange of stories. In an effort to break down barriers and shatter stereotypes, N4 encourages people to walk in each other’s shoes and prove that not only does every story matter, every life matters.

A story exchange seminar will be held at the end of the Boot Camp

http://narrative4.com/

Other Ways You Can Help

We need accommodation in Cape Town, close the The Cape Town Central Library if possible. Or you own a hotel and are willing to donate rooms or give us a huge discount. If so, email us on meandmymanuscript@gmail.com. 

We need to eat too, so if you're a Cape Town based catering company or restauranteur and you'd be willing to feed our facilitators and the board behind the Boot Camp, email us on meandmymanuscript@gmail.com. 

You could design and/or print a banner and programs for us. Cape Town based printers email us on meandmymanuscript@gmail.com. 

Please share our campaign via email, social media and the press, if you are the press.

story:
THE POETS

We are  "true heart son of Allen Ginsberg" Andy Clausen and his talented writer partner Pamela Twining. We're hitting the road this summer for the Beat Revival Tour -- bringing dynamic live poetry to audiences large and small starting from our home in Woodstock, NY.  Destination - San Francisco. We have a July 5th reading at the Art House Gallery with Pagan Neil, at Moe's Books on the 9th with Bruce Isaacson, and a July 16th reading at The Beat Museum, Andy with with A. D. Winans. We plan stops along the way to experience poetry communities large and small.

So far we have readings set in St. Louis, Boulder, Denver, & Ward Colorado,  San Francisco, Berkeley, Oakland, & Willets CA. We're arranging new dates right now and plan to visit open mics in North Beach, Santa Cruz, and maybe Chicago and Detroit. 

Andy has traveled this country so many times and read in cities and towns all across the US. He's psyched to share the Journey with his partner and favorite living poet.

I want this to be a real On The Road adventure (Pamela). I plan to keep a journal, write as we go, plot the route out and share what's happening via iPad. This will be the trip of our lives. A long time coming and--if you've heard Andy's poetry--a long time remembered. Be part of it. 


THE PLAN

We'll be on the road from 6/28 to 8/2! We aim to raise enough to 

  • Keep Goldie the Toyota Corolla running and the road moving under us. So oil, gas, tolls & in-transit repairs -  $800
  • The occasional  motel room. Mostly we'll be camping and staying with folks but we figure we'll need about 8 motel stays  -  $800
  • We plan to prep our own meals while camping and use grocery stores a lot, but some meals out will be needed. We estimate one a day. $1200.
All the money received will go to bare bones needs while on the road. Beyond that, we hope to sell books at readings, and a few of the gigs pay a small stipend. Because we do sort of want to be tourists a little bit too.


THE IMPACT

Andy was invited last year to teach & give a presentation at Harper College in Chicago. He's toured and given readings with Allen Ginsberg, Gregory Corso, Ray Bremser, Philip Whalen, Jack Micheline and many others..... For a list of events since last spring see here. Both Andy and Pamela have poetry collections that old friends long to hold and new friends need to read. The long term impact of this journey on American poetry can not be measured. Or wait - maybe this is a measure:

“Andy Clausen’s character voice is heroic, a vox populi of the democratic unconscious…The expensive bullshit of government TV poetics suffers diminution of credibility placed side by side with Mr. Clausen’s direct information and sad raw insight. Would he were, I’d take my chance on a President Clausen.” Allen Ginsberg


IT WON'T BE EASY 

Yeah it's a long way to San Francisco from Woodstock. But Goldie, our '06 Toyota, is in good shape and we have plenty of friends along the way to offer rest and support. And man, do we love a road trip! Camping out, the discovery of the back roads of America and whatever adventures they bring, new and old friends, and the open eager faces filling with poetry, images, words, passion, past and future story...well that's everything! We'll take it slow and make it real, mile by mile.  We plan a longish rest with old friends and family along the way.


HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP 

If you can't chip in much, we get it. But you can still help a lot by spreading the word. Share this fundraiser with people you know. Looks like it's pretty easy to share from here. 

And if you know of a place en route that might want to host a reading, let us know.

story:
A damaged serial killer is stalking the city streets. 

Bodies left at random.

Ritualistic in their method.

Brutal.

Can Detective Lobo find the JackPort Killer before events get too close?

Too personal?

Welcome to The Endless, Sprawling, Neon City beneath the broken EverNight.

Welcome to the world of The Wolf.

Acclaimed author Kneel Downe released the first of his Detective Kurt Lobo case files, The JackPort Killer, in May this year to great critical reception and his VirulentBlurb universe grew bigger. Starburst Magazine picked up on the teaser trailer for it and reviewed the book, saying “you will soon find yourself completely immersed into the bizarre, cyberpunk, dystopian world Downe has created, and find yourself wanting more” and TheCultDen gave it 10/10.  Now the universe is set to expand again as, for the first time, the Wolf gets a voice when The JackPort Killer comes to audiobook!

Who wrote it?

Kneel was born in 1967 and raised in the middle of countryside and silence where he immersed himself in books and fantasy.  After trying several writing styles, Kneel began tweeting short fragments of fiction. A meeting with his idol, Jeff Noon, made Kneel realise that these short bursts could make up a whole universe of fiction and so the VirulentBlurb projects began.

Who is this Kurt Lobo anyway? 

Police Detective Kurt Lobo has been in the VirulentBlurb universe since before the war that cracked the skies. A wolf-splice, he lost his cat-splice wife Katrina when she was brutally murdered by... well, we'll get to that story eventually, and has been working cases for the police department with his partner Geldof (yes, he's a rat-splice) to try and keep some kind of law in a broken city.

The case of The JackPort Killer is ritualistic. Bodies left, tortured and arranged, around the city with messages specifically for Kurt Lobo. Always killed by a rod jammed into the JackPort behind their ears. It starts with strangers and ends with... but I don't want to give the story away if you haven't heard it.

Why an Audiobook? 

You just need to read the first paragraph of the story to realise that it is a transcription of an audio journal... so we want to give you that original audio experience; to hear the Wolf Splice detective record his own thoughts as the case of The JackPort Killer gets more brutal and more personal... you need to experience the case as it unfolds, as it happens. 

What we need the money for

We have struck a deal with London-based award winning studio Spokenworld Audio, winners this year of both an Audie (the Oscars of the audio world) and a New York Award for their work, and the production and distribution costs are sorted. All that is left now is to find the funding required to finish the project off and get all the parties in to the studio. This requires £2500. So we have loaded up the perks and crossed our fingers...

The search then began across the globe for a voice actor to bring Lobo to life in a way that excited both Kneel and the fans. After an extensive hunt, actor Greg Patmore of Big Finish fame was approached. 

Greg is from the industrial heart of England, son of a soldier and a nurse, with a childhood background in brass bands and community theatre. A working class boy, his expectations were set pretty low until he discovered music and theatre almost simultaneously in his mid teens.  He recently appeared with Kevin Costner and Bill Paxton as Good 'Lias Hatfield in the hit US series "Hatfields & McCoys' which won 5 Emmys, and this year appeared with Bradley Walsh in the current series of 'Law & Order UK'. Subsequent appearances include 'Vera -The Deer Hunters' alongside Brenda Blethyn, and a role in new US TV series The Assets. He has appeared in several episodes of Coronation Street as thug Jonny Smith and has featured in David Morrissey's directorial debut film Don't Worry About Me and alongside John Henson and Neil Fitzmaurice in the British comedy feature Charlie Noades RIP.  He will next be seen on stage at the Edinburgh Festival with Anne Archer in Terry Jastrow's hard-hitting play 'The Trial of Jane Fonda'.  Watch his showreel  and see why we want him as our wolf.

We were all delighted when Greg read The JackPort Killer and loved it. He has excitedly agreed to the role and plans have been started to go into production of a full audio book. 

How can you help?

This is where you come in! There is a void that needs filling. The silence is unbearable.  The wolf must tell his tale...  Help us to give a voice to Detective Kurt Lobo.

Find out more about Kneel Downe and the VirulentBlurb universe on his website at www.VirulentBlurb.com  and follow Kneel on Twitter at @kneeldowne

#FILLTheVOID

story:
Introduction

Lucid Moose Lit engages the literary arts with social justice issues by using poetry and the arts as a vehicle for social change. Our first print anthology, Gutters & Alleyways: Perspectives on Poverty and Struggle, is almost ready to send to print but we need your help!

Editors-in-Chief: Nancy Lynée Woo and Sarah Thursday

Gutters & Alleyways 

As active leaders in our arts community, we were thrilled to have received over 450 poems, 50 works of prose and 100 pieces of art from around the world for our first submissions call in July! Using Nancy's experience as a professional editor and Sarah's experience in publishing books, we honed our selections into a raw and diverse collection of poetry, prose, and art from over 80 contributors. We are almost ready to put it in your hands!

Impact

  1. First and foremost, the goal of the book was to simply hold space for marginalized perspectives to emerge, and to grant them dignity and respect.
  2. Second, we wanted to open up the lens of poverty and ask what this really means — who is in poverty? What do they look like? Could it be me or you? We wanted to minimize Othering, maximize empathy, and gather a wide range of viewpoints (which we are happy to say, we think we did).
  3. Third, we hope that sharing these important perspectives will spark conversation about the pressing issues around us, and serve to shed light on the diverse realities of people living below the poverty line.
  4. Then, we hope the conversations may inspire action.

What We Need

We have very clear goals! 

  • $400 will cover the costs of printing & shipping 82 books as contributor copies for each of our contributors -- some of which are outside the U.S.
  • $200 will allow us to print around 50 more copies to sell for a reasonable price without dipping into our personal budget.
  • $100 will cover the cost of the venue for the book launch on September 28th .
  • $100 is estimated to go toward fees, marketing and promotional materials.
  • Everything after that will go toward building a sleek website, releasing the next anthology, and possibly donating extra funds to a local organization that is doing excellent work in the community or otherwise linking tangible action to a social cause (for example, providing hot meals at our events to those in need).
We are on Fixed Funding so we need to reach our goal in order to get any of your donations!

The Trajectory

Okay, let's be straight. Literary presses and poets are not generally rolling in the Benjamins. In order for this important literary and social project to be successful, we really need your help to fund the first phase!

Phase 1:

  • Print & distribute Gutters and Alleyways: Perspectives on Poverty and Struggle
  • Host the book launch on September 28th
  • Link up with community organizations

Phase 2:

  • Promote the book at other literary and community events
  • Launch a professional Lucid Moose website and social media
  • Send out a submissions call for the next anthology
Phase 3:
  • Edit and produce our second anthology
  • Grow!

What You Get

We want to thank you for helping us support this project with some Lucid Moose gifts!

  • $10 - We thank you with a cool Lucid Moose sticker!
  • $15 - We will thank you with a Lucid Moose bookmark and a sticker for all the great reading you do! Wonderful! 
  • $25 - This is our recommended donation level! For $25, you receive the Gutter & Alleyways anthology that this project is built to support! (plus sticker and bookmark)
  • $50 - Sadie Girl Level: At this level, you get your choice of the Cadence Collective: Year One Anthology (a fantastic paperback collection of Long Beach poets) or All The Tiny Anchors (Sarah Thursday's full-length collection of raw and beautiful poems). Superb books, both of them! (plus previous perks)
  • $75 - Editor's Package Level: This is a great level to donate! The Editor's Package gets you books and CDs from each of the editors! Including:
    Cadence Collective: Year One Anthology
    All The Tiny Anchors, by Sarah Thursday
    Rampant, a chapbook by Nancy Lynée Woo  
    Anchors, a poetry and music CD by Sarah Thursday
    Face the Blaze a poetry and music CD by Nancy Lynée Woo 
    (plus Gutters anthology, bookmark, and sticker!)
  • $100 - Fernando Level: This is a very special perk because for $100, you can have a photo of yourself or anyone you choose to be "Fernando-ized." Fernando Gallegos is our resident artist superstar and he specializes in turning photos into beautiful paintings or ink drawings. Scroll to the bottom to see Fernando-ized portraits of the editors. (plus you get all the other perks)

  • $150 - Silver Level Sponsor: We will give you a written Thank You acknowledgement in the book! (plus all the other perks) (NOTE: because we need to send the books to print, the DEADLINE FOR INCLUSION IN THE BOOK IS SEPTEMBER 7th)
  • $175 - Gold Level Sponsor: We will include a 100 word message from you in the book! Anything you want to express, any message or bio or shout out (within reason, of course)! (plus all the other perks) (NOTE: because we need to send the books to print, the DEADLINE FOR INCLUSION IN THE BOOK IS SEPTEMBER 7th)

  • $200 - Platinum Level Sponsor: If you donate $200, we will consider you an Event Co-Sponsor for our book release event on September 28th! We will give you a special thank you in the book and in person at each of our Gutters events, and promote you or your organization/business on our event page! (plus all the other perks)
  • $250 - Diamond Level Sponsor: We will be touring with the book after the launch, and we will include your name or business logo on our banner that we'll use at our events! Your gift will travel with us in the next few months as we spread the word about our project! (plus all the other perks)
  • $500 - Lucid Moose Angel: Wow! At this level, we will consider you a Lucid Moose Angel donor and give you all the perks listed! Plus, a subscription to receive the next 5 anthologies and ongoing acknowledgment! And of course our endless gratitude!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help!

Here are some other ways you can help us launch this project:

  • Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and all your social media networks!
  • E-mail our campaign to family and friends who would be interested in donating.
  • Buy the book when it comes out on September 28!
  • Attend our book launch on September 28 in Long Beach, CA! (More details to come soon.)
  • Get the mayor or other influential people to come to our event!
  • Share insight or ideas about how to build pathways out of poverty!

And if you have special skills that you would like to donate or offer at a low cost, we really need:

  • A snazzy website
  • Marketing and promotional materials
  • Venues for future events to promote the book and press
  • A custom logo
  • Volunteers to help edit the next anthology
  • Connections to local philanthropic or community organizations
  • Other things you think will help get us off the ground!

Book Launch

We are so excited to be collaborating with an amazing group called 100 Thousand Poets for Change. From their website: 

Do you want to join other poets, musicians, and artists around the USA and across the planet in a demonstration/celebration to promote peace and sustainability and  to call for serious social, environmental and political change?

Yes, we do! We are coinciding our book release date with this global network! 100TPC uses the month of September to link poetry events all over the world under the umbrella of using poetry for social awareness. We will be launching Lucid Moose Lit and Gutters & Alleyways on September 28th at St. Luke's Church in Long Beach, CA. 

We hope to have an impact on our local community by involving some of the people with influence. If we raise enough money to make this a big event, we hope to attract Mayor Robert Garcia, whose recent conversations have been directed at alleviating poverty in the city. He says on the subject:

“I think sometimes people view poverty as someone on the verge of homelessness,” he says. “But you could walk by an apartment building in Alamitos Beach and never know that inside a one-bedroom apartment there could be eight people living there who are experiencing poverty...Poverty can look like anybody."

An astounding 22% of adults and 33% of children living in Long Beach are living in poverty, according to Long Beach Community Action Partnership. This is what Gutters and Alleyways hopes to shed light on: the almost invisible yet scathing reality of poverty -- and the potential for building better and healthier lifestyles for all.  Stay tuned for more details about this event on September 28th!

Big Vision                        

The aim of Lucid Moose Lit is to be an activist press with one goal: improve the state of the world for humans, animals, and ecosystems by welcoming multiple perspectives on controversial topics. We aim to be inclusionary rather than exclusionary by bringing different views together in productive conversation. We want to plant the seeds of productive conversation.

As two poets with a background in sociology, social issues are important to both of us. I (Nancy) have always wanted a way to use poetry and art to affect positive change in the world. I would rather do this than anything else because I believe the first step to cultivating a better tomorrow is to begin and continue the conversations that matter. Since poetry helps spread empathy, Lucid Moose Lit aims to publish a wide variety of perspectives on important topics, while hosting events in our local community - so that we may do more than talk; we can start to build real connections with people who are doing work from the ground up.

Lucid Moose has big plans, from working with community organizations to releasing future anthologies. The next one is already in the works! We really need your help to get this important project off the ground and take next steps!

    Our Story & Our Successes

    Sarah and Nancy became friends in the summer of 2013 when they both realized they shared a passion for poetry. Since then, these two fiercely driven women have worked together to make their dreams a reality.

    Here are some of our accomplishments:

    Sarah Thursday:

      (Fernandoized portrait)

    • Launched CadenceCollective.net, an online space for Long Beach and Long Beach-inspired poets
    • Started hosting a Cadence Collective reading series featuring local poets every second Monday at Gatsby Books
    • Edited and released a Year One Anthology for Cadence Collective
    • Planned and hosted Rock'n Robin, a poetry and music extravaganza
    • Self-published her debut full-length collection of poems entitled All the Tiny Anchors with her own Sadie Girl Press
    • Released a music and spoken poetry CD with Blacksheep Music Productions
    • Learn more about this editor at Sarahthursday.com

    Nancy Lynée Woo:

     (Fernandoized portrait)

    • Hosted and curated various social action events with non-profit Shift Long Beach
    • Released chapbook entitled Rampant with Sadie Girl Press
    • Collaborated on spoken word CD, which is soon to be released
    • Started hosting a monthly creative salon to bring together local poets, artists and musicians
    • Envisioned and gave birth to Lucid Moose Lit
    • Learn more about Nancy at her freelance website, Spilltheink.net

      Thank you for your support! We look forward to keeping you updated with our progress!

story:
Saturnalia Books has been publishing outstanding poetry since 2002. We are proud to have discovered supremely talented poets such as Sabrina Orah Mark, Kathleen Graber, Sarah Vap, Catherine Pierce, and so many others. As a small press, we rely on individual donor contributions to continue publishing the high quality texts you have come to expect. Please donate today and take home some of our very special perks - many of which are only available through this campaign!

Saturnalia Books’ mission is to publish literary works, primarily poetry, of high merit, by new and established writers; to encourage collaboration between poets and visual artists, particularly in book form; and to encourage the publication of literature of a non-commercial and challenging nature.

In 2015, Saturnalia Books will publish four texts and release a digital edition of a previously published text. New titles will include books of poetry by Laurie Saurborn Young (Industry of Brief Distraction), Sandra Simonds (The Glass Box), Michael Robins (In Memory of Brilliance & Value), and the winner of the Saturnalia Books Poetry Prize, Jay Nebel (Neighbors), selected by Gerald Stern.

We will also expand and digitally enhance our popular 2010 collection of art and poetry, Gurlesque: the new grrly, grotesque, burlesque poetics (ed. Lara Glenum and Arielle Greenberg). The new digital edition, Electric Gurlesque, will include more poets, artists, audio content, video content, hyperlinks, and a teaching guide. “Gurlesque” is a term that describes writers who perform femininity in their poems in a campy or overtly mocking manner, risking the grotesque to shake the foundations of acceptable female behavior and language. Built from the bric-a-brac of girl culture, these works charm and repel: this work is fun, subversive, and important. Since its publication, Gurlesque has been utilized in college and university courses, specifically those with an emphasis on Gender Studies. As such, Saturnalia Books seeks to develop an enhanced digital edition that can be enjoyed by individual readers and used to deepen the exploration of students and professors. We believe that Electric Gurlesque will be an experience like nothing else in the world of poetry!

Please help us spread the word about this campaign! Share it with your friends. "Like" us on Facebook.

Testimonials from our readers:

"Saturnalia's texts are unique, impressive works that, together, create a coherent constellation."

"The variety of the authors represented by Saturnalia continues to surprise me."

"The books look gorgeous! There's a design sense in each volume that isn't traditionally available with a small press."

Saturnalia Books has been publishing outstanding poetry since 2002. 
We are proud to have discovered supremely talented poets such as Sabrina
 Orah Mark, Kathleen Graber, Sarah Vap, Catherine Pierce, and so many others. As
 a small press, we rely on individual donor contributions to continue publishing the high quality texts you have come to expect. Please donate today and take home some of our very special perks - many of which are only available through this campaign! 







Saturnalia Books’ mission is to publish literary works, primarily
poetry, of high merit, by new and established writers; to encourage
collaboration between poets and visual artists, particularly in book form; and
to encourage the publication of literature of a non-commercial and challenging
nature.



In 2015, Saturnalia Books will publish
four texts and release a digital edition of a previously published text. New
titles will include books of poetry by Laurie Saurborn Young (Industry of
Brief Distraction), Sandra Simonds (The Glass Box), Michael Robins (In

story:
Thank you all for your amazing support. 

This project is over but you still can pre-order the book! Just send an email to JohannaLehmannBooks@gmail.com 

We've passed $9,000 and this campaign is about to become one of the most successful San Francisco publishing projects! 





As featured in: 


   

    

The story of a spirited young woman who finds adventure in San Francisco. By crossing continents Hanni, in her mid twenties, starts a new life – with unexpected hurdles.

When Hanni gets the offer to work in San Francisco for a year, she doesn’t expect the experience to turn her life upside down. Not only does she get infected by the Silicon Valley virus to start her own company, but she also falls in love with an American guy whose behavior causes her to question her understanding of relationships. Sacrificing German caution for American optimism, Hanni navigates the ups and downs of this bizarre new world, from finding a place to stay in the most expensive city in the U.S., to deciphering the cryptic code of American dating, to developing a taste for the ‘secret sauce’ of Silicon Valley.

A rousing, fresh twist on the fictional memoir, How to Love San Francisco – One Year in the City by the Bay, takes you on a year-long excursion of life in this “Least American” of American cities, one filled with culture clashes, international friendships, and an outsider-turned-insider’s view of what living in San Francisco is really like.

  


  • 12 chapters loaded with an entertaining story of life in the most bizarre city of the United States - combined with informative facts on San Francisco

  • An inside view into the the San Francisco dating scene

  • inspiration on best bars, most scenic locations and tasty restaurants 

  • background information on tech culture of San Fran & Silicon Valley

  • Advice on how to get settled in San Francisco  

  • An outside-in perspective on American culture 

  • Access to great perks, including access to the book before official release, signed versions, exclusive invite to author events, your wonderful name featured in the book and many more  



  


  • "It reads like an entertaining blend of narrative nonfiction and POV travelogue." - Lisa, Co-founder Coliloquy

  • "Really well written and I couldn't stop reading it!" - Lucy in the Sky with a canon, SF photographer

  • "This book sets up "a fresh, somewhat frisky and unusual “take” on San Francisco. The author teases us with questions that ask us to look at our stereotypes. And she presents an answer about San Francisco not being what we think it is. It’s an “island nation,” not just a city. We liked this fresh voice, which is very hard to attain with travel articles about popular cities that have been written about so many times before. We wanted to turn the page to see what other nuggets the author brought forth." - Jury of Writer's Institute Madison University



_________________________


About the author

Hi, I'm Johanna, a San Francisco-based writer. How to love San Francisco - One year in the City by the Bay is bringing you the outside-in perspective of San Francisco. It's my declaration of love to my favorite city!

Being a German native I wrote it in German -- getting it out to our English readers is the goal!

This book is written for those of you, who look for information about San Francisco - wrapped in a fictional travel memoir  (that means: all the places described do exist, some of the characters are fictional). 

My previous work on San Francisco won the '2013 Writer's Institute' and was a semi-finalist of the Tuscon Festival of Books in Arizona. In Germany I was selected as a Top 50 non-fiction author. The German version of the book is one of the highest rated book in its category on Amazon.




>>>Simply click here<<<
...to enjoy a taste of the SF journey for yourself!

You can also watch Johanna read the first pages of the book here:


Or download the MP3 for your phone/media player
by clicking here.


 

 

Your help will help share the experience of How to Love San Francisco, with the English-speaking world! A German language version is already published and distributed by my publisher in Germany, however, they don't publish internationally, so now with your help, we'll do it together! The first few chapters are already translated and edited. With your help, the rest will follow in the next couple of weeks. Publishing the book in the US will cost a minimum of $9,000.

The basic goal of $9,000 will pay for:

  • Translation
  • Copy Editing
  • Layout & Design
  • ISBNS
  • Cover Art & Illustration
  • Getting the word out

   


A huge thank you to San Francisco travel for giving us access to their great video resources on San Francisco!! You guys are awesome! Dio, thank you soo much for your help.StudiosDio was an amazing experience to create a video for a special cause!

Special thanks go as well to our Soft Launch Sponsors:

RocketSpace is a technology campus that connects tech startups, innovative brands, accelerator programs, and entrepreneurs to bring the future to market. Thanks for supporting this cause!

                                 

A German style Pilsner, Trumer Pils is characterized by a distinct hops flavor, high carbonation and light body. Trumer Pils is a great beer and since the characters in the book love to drink Trumer Pils, Trumer will be sponsoring some delicious beer for the event

EFACTOR is the entrepreneur's Wingman. EFACTOR is the world’s largest entrepreneurial community. EFactor provides online and offline resources that every small business owner needs: knowledge, funding, gain revenue and save cost. At EFactor, entrepreneurs can exchange ideas with experts, receive exclusive discounts on business tools, interact with potential partners or clients, find employment, healthcare and discover funding for their startups.

Also thanks to Matt from The Expeditioner.com for helping to get the word out!


Dear Backer!

You will find many ways in which you can invest in this project: e.g. being one of the first people to receive a copy of the book ($39) or getting 10 signed copies of the book shipped to your doorstep & making this a very special present to your friends ($220). Have a look and thanks so much for taking part in this campaign. You are making this book a reality!

Pledge now, and you will also have my lifelong gratitude.


 

In case you like the book, but can't contribute financially - no worries. There is another way to help that we really appreciate! Please just spread the word by reposting our campaign on Twitter and Facebook to your friends and followers!

Just click one (or both!) of the buttons below to make a real difference in just moments!

story:
Wait ... you already reached your goal. Now what?

Now we keep going! Self-publishing isn't cheap, and every dollar made via this campaign will go toward everything self-publishing related -- marketing, promos, giveaways, paying off the cover design of the next book, etc. Not to worry, your money is going toward a good cause.
Reaching the goal also means it's STRETCH GOAL TIME! 
Stretch Goal #1
If we can hit $600, I will include a cover art card for the sequel, Chasing Nonconformity, in all the physical perks shipped out (i.e. all the perks $10 and up).

What the heck is Imminent Danger?

Hi! My name's Michelle – I'm a 25 year old fiction writer from Halifax (Nova Scotia, Canada). Imminent Danger And How to Fly Straight into It is the young adult sci-fi book I've been working on since 2006. The inspiration hit me when I was sitting in Astronomy class, bored to tears, and I daydreamed about aliens bursting through the ceiling of the lecture hall and flying me far away from my professor's droning attempts to regurgitate the contents of the course textbook. 

Since then, that kernel of an idea has blossomed into Imminent Danger And How to Fly Straight into It, an awesome sci-fi adventure about an ordinary teenage girl who gets abducted by six-armed lizard men with a weird obsession with the color blue. I first self-published the book via iUniverse back in 2013, but I was displeased by the lack of control they gave me over the book. So this year I'm going to re-publish the novel myself via Amazon KDP and Createspace, using a gorgeous new cover created by the talented graphic designer Ravven.

I've got the full book description below, but basically all you need to know about the book is it's a ton of fun, with a feisty heroine and her fuzzy alien sidekick, a charming space pirate, an evil admiral, spaceships, laser guns, humor, friendship, adventure, and a dash of true love to tie everything together. It's been described as The Princess Bride meets Star Wars. You're going to love it :)

Why am I running this IndieGoGo campaign? 

The purpose of this IndieGoGo campaign is threefold:

  1. To raise funds to pay back the costs of the cover design. If we hit the goal and keep going, the funds would go toward marketing, publicity, sending copies to reviewers, holding giveaways for my fans, etc.
  2. To increase awareness and visibility of my book. It's hard to buy a book if you don't know it exists!
  3. To provide awesome Imminent Danger themed swag for my fans. See the perks for details!
I have lots of awesome stretch goals planned if we hit the current target, so don't be shy about contributing if we hit and surpass $500! 

    Why should you support this project?

    • You want to support a self-published author
    • You have no idea what Imminent Danger is, but want to find out
    • You have money to burn and are thinking, "Hey, why not throw it at this random person on the internet?" (you, sir or madam, are a rock star)
    • You want awesome Imminent Danger swag (and yes, it's awesome)
    • You want a signed copy of the book
    • You couldn't care less about my book, but want to support me as a person (totally legit option)
    • You're an evil mastermind and figure that, by supporting this campaign, you'll earn my loyalty and can then use me in your plot for world domination (not recommended -- my loyalty requires, at the very least, a gift of sacrificial cheesecake)

    Summary for Imminent Danger And How to Fly Straight into It

    High school junior Eris Miller thinks she’s having a bad day when her roommate’s boyfriend catches her stepping out of the shower wearing nothing but a towel. Then she gets abducted by scaly six-armed aliens with a strange fondness for the color blue, and her day suddenly gets a whole lot worse. 

    Trapped on a spaceship bound for the slave markets of Sirius B, Eris fears she’ll never see her home again. But then fate whisks her away from her reptilian captors and into the arms of Varrin, a fast-talking space pirate who promises to deliver her safely back to Earth. He claims to have her best interests at heart, but Eris soon discovers that her charming rescuer has a hidden agenda. 

    As they race across the galaxy, outrunning a villainous figure from Varrin’s past, Eris begins to realize that their relationship is putting her planet, her life, and her heart in imminent danger. She knows that trusting Varrin could prove deadly … but what other choice does she have?

    Cover design by Ravven

    What are readers saying?

    In a nutshell, they're pretty pleased with the book. Here are some excerpts from reviews to help sway you:

    The story starts with a bang and ends with a smile that makes you want to say, “That’s just so Varrin.” I highly recommend this book to anyone who loves a good inter-galatic, wild and crazy adventure. This book has it all: alien abductions, human trafficking in space, galactic peace corporations, double-crossings, beautiful aliens, seduction, war, mysterious planets, and love gone strangely alien. I found myself lost in this book, caught up in the scenes, and air pumping my fist when things got exciting. A must buy. A must read. A must recommend. Congratulations to Michelle Proulx for being meticulous and getting it so right, I want to read it again.

    – Tania L Ramos (writingapocalypse.com)

    I loved the zippy back-and-forth banter between the main characters; I loved the description of the different types of aliens; I loved how the relationships formed slowly while the main character focuses on surviving, and yet how she isn’t afraid to keep living even when things happen she can’t explain. This book is original and fun, and I’ll keep recommending it to people as often as I can.

    – Gwendolyn Bristol

    I can’t even begin to describe just how well written this book is. I love books and reading is such a big part of my life, but with school lately, I just never get the time. Of course, until I started reading Michelle’s book. I immediately was lost in Imminent Danger, so lost I read over 200 pages in about 4 hours. I simply couldn’t put the book down. Every ten minutes or so I kept telling myself, “Just put the book down…” Nope. This story dragged me into Alien spaceships, witty arguments, laser guns, and highly advanced technology with so many different Alien species and names it felt like I was right there with Eris. It was just a load of fun to read, and I’m pretty sure I’ll read it again. It’s a mind blower. I’m not much of an Alien fan, but boy did this story change my mind. It was just fantastic, and I am glad I got the chance to read it. I could imagine everything so vividly; everything was described well enough to get that clear picture of any character you ran into. Every cliffhanger at the end of each chapter just kept me so intrigued In the book; I just couldn’t stand the thought of leaving Michelle’s beautiful world. I still have alien warships shooting their plasma cannons and so many different types of aliens running around in my head. If you’re looking for a book that just throws you into a completely new world, (Literally) then this book is an absolute read without a doubt. It’s so easy to lose track of time when reading this, but I loved every second spent.

    – Emma Nicholas (Blackbird LSD)

    What's next for Imminent Danger? 

    I'm so glad you asked! The first step is to actually publish the book once this campaign is over via Amazon KDP and Createspace. After that, our eyes turn to ...

    Chasing Nonconformity! This sequel to Imminent Danger is nearly done with editing and proofreading and should be available Spring 2015. I'll be running another IndieGoGo campaign around that time to raise funds to pay back that cover design, and that campaign will have many of the same perks, but all Chasing Nonconformity themed (of course!).

    Also, if you do grab a copy of Imminent Danger via this campaign, read it, and love it, please make sure to pop over to Amazon and Goodreads and leave a review! Self-published authors live and die off reviews, and the last time I checked, living is a good thing.

    What happens if I don't meet my goal?  

    Everyone gets their perks and basks in the happy glow that comes from knowing they've helped a young writer pursue her novelling career. Like I said, I'm half doing this to pay back my cover design costs, and half because I want to offer these awesome perks to all my fans (new and old). So if we don't hit the goal, no sweat. All the perks still go out. It would just be really nice if we did hit the goal, because self-publishing costs money and I'm poor.

      No cash to spare? There are other ways you can help!

      Dude, don't even worry about it. Money doesn't grow on trees, and everyone has bills to pay. If you can't commit to contributing right now, you can help me out instead by:

      • Sharing this campaign on social media (Facebook, Twitter, etc.)
      • Telling your friends about the campaign
      • Posting a review on Amazon and Goodreads (if you've already read the book)
      • Doing literally anything else you can think of that would help draw attention to this campaign or Imminent Danger in general (unless it's something illegal, in which case give me a heads up so I can hire a lawyer)

      Have any questions about the books or the campaign?

      Feel free to send your questions my way via the campaign comments section, or via a comment on http://michelleproulx.com/ or my Facebook page. I'm happy to answer any and all inquiries, no matter how silly. In fact, the sillier the better!
