Of course, until I started reading Michelle’s book. I immediately was lost in Imminent Danger, so lost I read over 200 pages in about 4 hours. I simply couldn’t put the book down. Every ten minutes or so I kept telling myself, “Just put the book down…” Nope. This story dragged me into Alien spaceships, witty arguments, laser guns, and highly advanced technology with so many different Alien species and names it felt like I was right there with Eris. It was just a load of fun to read, and I’m pretty sure I’ll read it again. It’s a mind blower. I’m not much of an Alien fan, but boy did this story change my mind. It was just fantastic, and I am glad I got the chance to read it. I could imagine everything so vividly; everything was described well enough to get that clear picture of any character you ran into. Every cliffhanger at the end of each chapter just kept me so intrigued In the book; I just couldn’t stand the thought of leaving Michelle’s beautiful world. I still have alien warships shooting their plasma cannons and so many different types of aliens running around in my head. If you’re looking for a book that just throws you into a completely new world, (Literally) then this book is an absolute read without a doubt. It’s so easy to lose track of time when reading this, but I loved every second spent.
– Emma Nicholas (Blackbird LSD)
What's next for Imminent Danger? 

I'm so glad you asked! The first step is to actually publish the book once this campaign is over via Amazon KDP and Createspace. After that, our eyes turn to ...
Chasing Nonconformity! This sequel to Imminent Danger is nearly done with editing and proofreading and should be available Spring 2015. I'll be running another IndieGoGo campaign around that time to raise funds to pay back that cover design, and that campaign will have many of the same perks, but all Chasing Nonconformity themed (of course!).
Also, if you do grab a copy of Imminent Danger via this campaign, read it, and love it, please make sure to pop over to Amazon and Goodreads and leave a review! Self-published authors live and die off reviews, and the last time I checked, living is a good thing.
What happens if I don't meet my goal?  

Everyone gets their perks and basks in the happy glow that comes from knowing they've helped a young writer pursue her novelling career. Like I said, I'm half doing this to pay back my cover design costs, and half because I want to offer these awesome perks to all my fans (new and old). So if we don't hit the goal, no sweat. All the perks still go out. It would just be really nice if we did hit the goal, because self-publishing costs money and I'm poor.

  No cash to spare? There are other ways you can help! Dude, don't even worry about it. Money doesn't grow on trees, and everyone has bills to pay. If you can't commit to contributing right now, you can help me out instead by:

Sharing this campaign on social media (Facebook, Twitter, etc.)
Telling your friends about the campaign
Posting a review on Amazon and Goodreads (if you've already read the book)
Doing literally anything else you can think of that would help draw attention to this campaign or Imminent Danger in general (unless it's something illegal, in which case give me a heads up so I can hire a lawyer) 
 
Have any questions about the books or the campaign?
Feel free to send your questions my way via the campaign comments section, or via a comment on http://michelleproulx.com/ or my Facebook page. I'm happy to answer any and all inquiries, no matter how silly. In fact, the sillier the better!

story:
Hi, my name is John. Another restless soul searching for a real adventure. After living 27 years, I have come to the conclusion that there is more to life than working it all away for nothing. Especially if you have a dead end job like me. Still, I have no regrets and aim to push forward, learning as I go. This backpacking journey across America is more for my self improvement and to put a fire back into my extinguished candle. I will keep a journal and write about these experiences I encounter and get photos of the people, places, and things I find as I go. The journal and photos may become part of a book I will author. East coast to West Coast, my journey will total over 2500+ miles and will take 6-9 months. A well built cart will help me carry all of my necessities (tent, water, food, misc.). I am going to try to avoid staying in any hotels for the duration of my trip. Hostels are an exception though.    

 Life shouldn't be lived thinking, "What if"? So now I ask you, will you help me break my cycle of this meaningless day to day monotony?     

The funds are for the 6-9 month journey. I have enough money saved to keep my bills paid for that time. All I need is a little help from you. Anything at all is greatly appreciated. I will keep you updated on my journey via social media.

story:
(Concept Book Cover Art)


Help me fund my novel project to fight human trafficking

Thank you for taking the time to review my campaign page. I am a Christian author and blogger named Barry Irwin Brophy inviting you to help combat human trafficking through fiction. The project I am requesting funds for is to publish a novel I have written called A Woman's Choice that follows the broken life of a rescued human trafficked victim named Katrina originally taken from Albania. Since her captivity, she has fallen into a life of drug addiction and promiscuity leading her to homelessness and a crude job as a bikini barista to fuel her addiction. She discovers she is pregnant and must decide whether to keep or terminate the pregnancy. Her choice in this matter begins a search for the meaning of life and what role Christianity plays in understanding the purpose of life and suffering. Throughout the novel I expose the methods of human trafficking experienced by rescued victims as well as address topics of abortion, sexual immorality, poverty, and drug addiction.

Half of all the profits made from my novel will be donated to The Defenders Foundation and The Genesis Project to fight local human trafficking. The story of my novel, opinions, and experiences of the characters in my novel do not necessarily reflect the mission and values of The Defenders Foundation or The Genesis Project.

What do your contributions pay for?
Your contributions will pay for a publishing package from a self-publishing book company that will copy edit my novel, publish the final copy in paperback, hard copy, and ebook formats, copyright registration, a press release, and video trailer. The press release and video trailer will be marketed to journalists and newspapers across the nation.

What happens to any extra funds that are contributed to this project if they surpass the original goal?
These excess funds will be donated to The Defenders Foundation and The Genesis Project.

What happens to the funds that are contributed to this project if the goal is not met?
The funds will be set aside until I am able to generate my goal of $7000. Indiegogo will take 9% of the funds as a fee. Because I cannot guarantee the availability of hard copies and paperback copies of my novel, under this scenario, all contributors will receive an audio copy of The Weak and Foolish Things of Seattle. Any hard copies or paperback copies that are available will be sent to the top contributors in descending order until there are no more copies to left to distribute.

How will I receive a copy of the novel if I am one of the top Level 2 or Level 3 contributors?
I ask that you leave me your mailing address, email, and phone number so I can contact you. Once the novel is released, I will mail a copy of the book to you. If you do not provide your mailing address, your book will go to the next contributor. In the case of a tie of donations between contributors, the contributor, who donated the earliest, will receive their book before the other contributor and the count will resume in descending order until all books are distributed.   

How will I receive an audio copy of your novel The Weak and Foolish Things of Seattle?
I will send one or more emails through my personal account with audio files by which you can download. You will need to leave me your email address when you donate so I can do this otherwise you will not receive the audio files.

Other ways to support me if you cannot contribute any funds.
Prayer is always welcomed and encouraged! You can follow me on one or more of my social media pages through Facebook, WordPress, YouTube, Vimeo, or LinkedIn. If you are a Christian artist, send me a message through one of my social media pages and I will promote you through my Creative Christian Moments blog. You can also volunteer with The Defenders Foundation, The Genesis Project, or any other organization fighting human trafficking. Above all else, become part of the movement to end human trafficking around the world.

story:
This a story of privilege. Tenacity. Willingness. Turning a negative into a positive and believing in yourself. Read on.

If you have an affinity for writers, read on.  If you love public school teachers, EYES ON ME!  If you share a love of travel and relate to expatriates living abroad, then, hear this!

I wrote this funny, bittersweet book which I illustrated myself but have yet to publish for two reasons:  Firstly, I am currently teaching for a rather prestigious non-profit (which it is best not to name) and since my book is about 'BooBs' (not the people, but the real thing), the subject matter is considered inappropriate for a teacher in a high-need school in South Louisiana.

Secondly, before I can even think about releasing this work, I must pay the debt I owe to the creative team who formatted the e-book.  Please know that I would never have gone forward with this service if I had known the grand and sweeping changes my life was about to take--that by teaching for this particular non-profit I would clearly have to withhold publishing until the completion of my two-year commitment.

Alas, the e-book is finished but the debt remains.  Any money raised here will go toward this end.

Accepting this teaching position took every penny I had to move myself, two suitcases and my Chihuahua, Martino, back to the United States from Tuscany, where I had been living for fourteen years.  I wish to honor my debt to the Italian firm that worked on my book and to the creative team that came up with the wonderful cover which I absolutely adore.

Here is a preview of "downsize*"

On this note, I leave you to ponder as I thank you, brilliant souls. 

Peace,

Stephanie Page

Teacher/student, artist, california girl from the midwest, peace-maker, writer & reader, yogina, singer & dancer, sleeper & gardener, diplomat & expat, extrovert who likes to be alone, tribe member, marty's best friend, & a new yorker @ ♥.

Other Ways You Can Help

Encouragement is contagious and all good thoughts will be relished!  If you believe in  what you see here, pass the word!  Indiegogo has some great share tools to help this along!

story:
What started out as a mix CD exchange between my friends and I evolved into a “My Favorite Band 101” where we each sent each other entire mixes composed of songs from one artist, and then it morphed into the next issue of my zine that I’ve been publishing since 2002.


Receiving a mix of one particular artist from a friend made me wonder what I had been missing by not having been exposed to that artist. But more importantly, it was intriguing because it made me wonder about my friends. What is it about this artist that my friend loves, and how does it tie into their own personal mythology? What’s the lore, culture and juice associated with that artist, and why is it important to the specific person who is a fan? I was also just charmed by the idea of recognizing each of my friends as being an expert in something. Have you ever noticed amazing people are when they’re good at something or sharing their expertise on what their into? No matter what the topic, music or non music-related, when people share what they’re into, their geekiness is contagious.


The artist I picked for the My Favorite Band 101 mix project was Britney Spears. Why her you ask? When I became a devoted karaoke enthuseast I encountered the song “I’m Not a Girl, Not Yet a Woman.” The song title alone intrigued me because I was constantly encountering it on karaoke lists. I would listen to a song for my first time, and I would think “This song is preposterous! I MUST master this song and perform it at karaoke.” And so I did, song after song, each one as additional ironic icing. But then one thing led to another. The next thing I know I’m actively tracking her in the media, buying remixes, postulating theories about her singing style as well as her artistic or career choices, collecting magazines with her in them, reading biographies about her, mandating that my husband buy me the Britney doll. Then when I was diagnosed with cancer, I couldn’t help but notice that my treatment paralelled Britney Spears’ personal crises as played out in popular media, right down to the shaving of her head.


In this issue of Caboose, I learned that every culture, every subculture, every genre, every thing ever, there’s always something intelligent to be articulated about it. The ways of the world need to be mapped out, so we can understand the universe, and improve each piece of it, or do whatever needs to be done to evolve.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Stina Leicht, and I'm a Science Fiction/Fantasy author. My first two novels were published by Night Shade Books. (The first book is titled Of Blood and Honey and the second is called And Blue Skies from Pain.) I was recently nominated for a 2012 Campbell Award for Best New Novelist. The awards ceremony will be held in Chicago, Illinois during Chicon 7-- a SF/F convention. It's a huge honor to be nominated. Huge. Authors can only be nominated twice--ever. Needless to say, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity. (Okay. Twice. But twice is unlikely.) Unfortunately, I can't afford to attend the ceremony as things stand. I really, really don't want to miss it. I've always wanted to be a writer and this means the world to me.

What I Need & What You Get

I need $2000 for the trip to Chicago. The money will go to the cost of the flight ($600), transportation to the hotel and the airport ($50), hotel ($725), meals ($350), and contributions to two hotel parties to help promote the books.

Anyone who contributes at any level will get their name mentioned in thanks at the end of my next book. (Which I'm working on right now and am almost finished with the first draft. The working title is Cold Iron.)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, I understand. (Believe me.) However, you can still help by spreading the word on Twitter or FaceBook. Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ashley Jenkins. What you need to know about me is that I have a passion not only for Yoga, but for helping others. In fact, perhaps I’m a bit different than most would-be Yoga book authors, since the decision to take on this project didn't originate with me. Actually, I was asked to write this book by my fellow peers and students.

Overall, I think they appreciate my Mid-Western/Heinz 57 approach to teaching. But they also told me they were looking for something that went beyond the Yoga sessions.

In a nutshell, they wanted a resource that would allow them to sequence conscious practices that would inspire personal evolution and transformation. For many this meant having something they could use during their busy workday – a guide with fresh, innovative ways to incorporate Yoga at their work stations. Others told me they wanted a quick reference for Yoga pose alignment, such as the “maha” pose/asana; while still others were seeking something that provided more spiritual aspects like a pathway to self-empowerment to increase healing of their body/mind/spirit.

There are many Yoga books. A new Yoga book pops up on Amazon every day (well, almost). Our objective is to share an American perspective on modern lineages that have crossed paths, integrated, and brought forth new truth in the healing process of Yoga. When an individual is whole, there is much more that can be realized from their offering to benefit the collective.

This book will highlight safe progression in practice.

There will be show-stopping poses/Asanas available for practice. Some will be discussed and demonstrated in our first edition of Krama, Yoga Chronologically: An Approach to Embodying Yoga. In these chronological tales of Yogic expression, our intention is to prepare the tissues and prerequisites in practice, to empower individuals to eradicate injurious setbacks or stagnation.

We know you are eager to achieve certain goals (possibly touching your toes or standing on your head). We want to encourage you, inspire you, and cheer you all the way there; but it does not happen overnight. Yoga is a process, not a product. We seek to cut through the illusions and expectations, giving you palpable methods to transform your journey.

Translating the science within Yoga, we will explore the ancestry of the traditions and bodily technologies of Yoga from the East, and the parallels of these in Western adaptations. The examination, process and progression of embodiment within this text gives each practitioner the keys for unlocking their powerful and unique potential.

Physically, we desire to see results. Yes. But the rich inner context of this book explores the layers of behavior, thought process, and emotional blockage through the cultivation of powerful themes and the quest for truth. It’s the inside out approach.

Captivating everyone with the unique and quirky lens we hold on Yoga, our intention is to visually and mentally stimulate our audience, inspiring all readers to do Yoga whenever, wherever, and allowing their process to be one of curiosity, compassion, and play.

The ability to carve out space to sustain bliss (yes, if only for nanoseconds) is within your grasp from chronologically moving, Krama in practice.

Your Support + Contribution

Will help us reach our project budget of $80,000 covering:

  • Photography detailing the ins and outs the sequential alignment of postures
  • Graphic design to illustrate and highlight visual aspects of the work
  • All that jazz in self-publishing (editorial, marketing, websites, + all that stuff that goes on behind the curtain).
  • Development of book (eBook + print formats, including shipping in US)
  • Team budget (in-house staff, + enough to live on mung beans + rice during the process)

Perks For Your Contribution

Please enjoy our book + other offerings for your contribution.

To offer our sincere gratitude, we want to grant you, our supporters + dedicated fans, exclusive access to the passion and creativity behind this revolutionary project based upon the support amount you select, you may enjoy one or many of the below perks:

  • Vision Board + Guide for Krama, Yoga Chronologically Deliberate Life By Design PDF
  • Krama, Yoga Chronologically: An Approach to Embodying Yoga our ebook
  • Creative Scapes 11x17 Image/Print layouts of core book concepts
  • Krama, Yoga Chronologically: An Approach to Embodying Yoga our book
  • One year unlimited membership to Element Yoga in Columbia, MO
  • Bulk Book Order: 5 Copies

Where Your Money Goes
Your funds will help make this book a reality: production, printing, and shipping our book to students, teachers, and yogis everywhere, creating and inspiring conscious + transformative practices. We will be including donated copies, globally empowering people, specifically yoga practitioners of the Africa Yoga Project.

We have selected a flexible funding campaign to begin this private project. Our hope is that you will see a need from the request for a multidimensional resource illustrating and instructing the progression for strategic Yoga postures + overcoming the roadblocks that halt growth in practice.  

 


The bulk of our campaign comes from the production costs of the physical book. If you would prefer to save the trees because you enjoy digital books, we have ebooks available. The benefits of tangibly handling a book will make a greater impact on your personal practice.

That’s why our printed book production is:

100% Recycled

Made in the US

Printed with Soy Color Ink

On Super High Quality, 100% Recycled, 60% Post-Consumer Waste

Processed Chlorine-Free Paper

With Embossed Titling, + Bound to withstand use as it becomes a part of your Yoga Practice on the mat.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand monetary support is just not possible for everyone.
 
For getting the word out and making noise about our campaign we will post to our Facebook, Twitter, + eNewsletter about the book progress (oh and share additional goodies that you may enjoy).
 

You can find us at www.kramayogachronologically.com

You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

Share Our Indiegogo Story

Help us get the word out!

With your family, friends, colleagues, and fellow yoga practitioners via:

  • On Facebook: www.facebook.com/Kramayogachronologically
  • On Twitter:  https://twitter.com/kramayogabook#
  • Get on our list! We’ll be updating you every step of the way at www.kramayogachronologically.com
  • Blog about Krama, Yoga Chronologically...
  • Email the campaign as a suggestion to others
  • Tell people in phone calls, + at play or coffee dates
  • Ask for a pledge as a birthday or holiday present!
  • Turn to five people in the next Yoga class and tell them about the campaign
  • Purchase in-bulk with this perk option for students as gifts, teacher training students, or retail options

We know they will say “thank you” for turning them on to this unique opportunity.

We thank you for your curiosity, enthusiasm, + support.

Deep bow, Namaste

There are many Yoga books. A new Yoga book pops up on Amazon every day (well, almost). Our objective is to share an American perspective on modern lineages that have crossed paths, integrated, and brought forth new truth in the healing process of Yoga. When an individual is whole, there is much more that can be realized from their offering to benefit the collective.
This book will highlight safe progression in practice.
There will be show-stopping poses/Asanas available for practice. Some will be discussed and demonstrated in our first edition of Krama, Yoga Chronologically: An Approach to Embodying Yoga. In these chronological tales of Yogic expression, our intention is to prepare the tissues and prerequisites in practice, to empower individuals to eradicate injurious setbacks or stagnation.  We know you are eager to achieve certain goals (possibly touching your toes or standing on your head). We want to encourage you, inspire you, and cheer you all the way there; but it does not happen overnight. Yoga is a process, not a product. We seek to cut through the illusions and expectations, giving you palpable methods to transform your journey.
Translating the science within Yoga, we will explore the ancestry of the traditions and bodily technologies of Yoga from the East, and the parallels of these in Western adaptations. The examination, process and progression of embodiment within this text gives each practitioner the keys for unlocking their powerful and unique potential. Physically, we desire to see results. Yes. But the rich inner context of this book explores the layers of behavior, thought process, and emotional blockage through the cultivation of powerful themes and the quest for truth. It’s the inside out approach.
Captivating everyone with the unique and quirky lens we hold on Yoga, our intention is to visually and mentally stimulate our audience, inspiring all readers to do Yoga whenever, wherever, and allowing their process to be one of curiosity, compassion, and play. The ability to carve out space to sustain bliss (yes, if only for nanoseconds) is within your grasp from chronologically moving, Krama in practice.

Your Support + Contribution
Will help us reach our project budget of $80,000 covering:

Photography detailing the ins and outs the sequential alignment of postures
Graphic design to illustrate and highlight visual aspects of the work
All that jazz in self-publishing (editorial, marketing, websites, + all that stuff that goes on behind the curtain).
Development of book (eBook + print formats, including shipping in US)
Team budget (in-house staff, + enough to live on mung beans + rice during the process)
Perks For Your Contribution
Please enjoy our book + other offerings for your contribution. 
To offer our sincere gratitude, we want to grant you, our supporters + dedicated fans, exclusive access to the passion and creativity behind this revolutionary project based upon the support amount you select, you may enjoy one or many of the below perks:

Vision Board + Guide for Krama, Yoga Chronologically Deliberate Life By Design PDF

Krama, Yoga Chronologically: An Approach to Embodying Yoga our ebook
Creative Scapes 11x17 Image/Print layouts of core book concepts

Krama, Yoga Chronologically: An Approach to Embodying Yoga our book
One year unlimited membership to Element Yoga in Columbia, MO
Bulk Book Order: 5 Copies
Where Your Money Goes Your funds will help make this book a reality: production, printing, and shipping our book to students, teachers, and yogis everywhere, creating and inspiring conscious + transformative practices. We will be including donated copies, globally empowering people, specifically yoga practitioners of the Africa Yoga Project.

We have selected a flexible funding campaign to begin this private project. Our hope is that you will see a need from the request for a multidimensional resource illustrating and instructing the progression for strategic Yoga postures + overcoming the roadblocks that halt growth in practice.  
 
The bulk of our campaign comes from the production costs of the physical book. If you would prefer to save the trees because you enjoy digital books, we have ebooks available. The benefits of tangibly handling a book will make a greater impact on your personal practice.
 That’s why our printed book production is:
100% Recycled
Made in the US
Printed with Soy Color Ink
On Super High Quality, 100% Recycled, 60% Post-Consumer Waste
Processed Chlorine-Free Paper
With Embossed Titling, + Bound to withstand use as it becomes a part of your Yoga Practice on the mat.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand monetary support is just not possible for everyone.
 
For getting the word out and making noise about our campaign we will post to our Facebook, Twitter, + eNewsletter about the book progress (oh and share additional goodies that you may enjoy).
 
You can find us at www.kramayogachronologically.com

You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!
And that’s all there is to it.
Share Our Indiegogo Story
Help us get the word out!
With your family, friends, colleagues, and fellow yoga practitioners via: 


On Facebook: www.facebook.com/Kramayogachronologically


On Twitter:  https://twitter.com/kramayogabook#


Get on our list! We’ll be updating you every step of the way at www.kramayogachronologically.com

Blog about Krama, Yoga Chronologically...

Email the campaign as a suggestion to others
Tell people in phone calls, + at play or coffee dates
Ask for a pledge as a birthday or holiday present!
Turn to five people in the next Yoga class and tell them about the campaign
Purchase in-bulk with this perk option for students as gifts, teacher training students, or retail options
We know they will say “thank you” for turning them on to this unique opportunity.
We thank you for your curiosity, enthusiasm, + support.
Deep bow, Namaste

story:
“Stirring” 

“Stirring” is a collection of original poetry, by Jada A. White with visual art and music by contributing artists.  The theme is Love: Divine, Natural, Self, Familial, and Romantic.  The intention of the book is encourage Collective Healing and Peace. 

For many decades it has been the mission of politicians to claim our Hearts and Minds for their causes.  With this, we have watched our World slip into a harsher state and our bodies into disease.  I am an author and songwriter who urges us to reclaim our pieces for Peace.  


What We Need & What You Get

For US

This campaign is to fund the pressing of a print book, audio-book, cd, e-book, video production, and tour.  On the tour, I will be performing songs and reading poems from the book, gathering photos, video, and creating new pieces for the next project, “The Art of Living.”  The tour will take me to intentional communities across the U.S., Mexico, and eventually over seas from Thailand to Northern India, where it is my intention to photograph the vast Buddhist temples, landscape, communities, and visit Dharamsala, the current home of His Holiness the Dalai Lama. 


General Allocation of Funds

  • $4,000 for printing 500 copies with a local press, using high quality, environmentally-friendly materials. Full color, perfect bound, glossy, 64-pages and a convenient size.
  • $1,000 (approximate) for audio-book production, which is already underway. Includes studio time, post-production, distribution formatting, marketing and music licensing. 
  • The remainder of funds are earmarked for a modest commission for the artists’ contributions, website construction and maintenance, and various marketing platforms and services, and assist with touring expenses.


For You

You are invited on this Journey.  Your donation will allow me to promote and distribute “Stirring” as I read from it’s pages to audiences across the United States, into Mexico, and eventually North India, while taking photos, blogging, and sharing with you.  I have compiled a few perk packages to exchange for your monetary contribution.  Included is a signed copy of the book, in invitation to an intimate reading and mixer with myself and some of the artists, .mp3’s of songs from my music project, Dream State, or the “Stirring” audio-book, and email updates from me from the road!  Come along!


The Impact

I feel that nothing is more important at this time than to reclaim our Hearts, Minds and Spirits and use them to create a healthy situation for all life.  It is my intention that “Stirring” encourage the rustling within drawing us to Light.  It is our Love for our Selves, the recognition of the connection of all things, our reverence for our home on planet Earth, and our commitment to our children and those who came before us, that will propel us into Healing and a Peace-full, Fear-less Life.  

The Artists involved with this book contributed their pieces because they were stirred by the words in these pages.  Not one of them asked for compensation, and a few are established professionals.  They support this book because they were moved to do so with Love and a desire to Nourish and Heal our sensitive Being.  Please, join us in the ascent towards our Highest Selves.


Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for your time and perusal of this page. You have already given of your Self, and for that I express Gratitude. If you are interested in following this project and other work by me, "like" our facebook pages for Jada A. White and U.N.I. Verse Productions. I also author a blog featuring prose, poetry, music, and general social commentary: "At the Gates of the Madhouse." You can also find more videos on my youtube channel.

Also, please spread the word amongst your Loved Ones regarding projects like this, the resurrection of Romantic Poetry, the Awakening of HumanKind, and Peace.

Thank you for your support.

Peace, Light, and Love.

story:
Thank You Everyone!

We have raised 1,000 dollars which, allows me to purchase the dc1400 underwater camera.  With underwater strobe.

                                                           


If more funds are raised, 400-500 more dollars, I will be able to purchase better lenses and light accessories. Which means even better quality pictures.


If the entire amount is raised I will be able to purchase Rx-100 underwater camera with strobe.   
 

                             

My Goal

My goal is to create an Ibook which will teach the reader all about the native marine life, as well as where to go, on the island of Maui, in order to find it. Also the book will teach, the reader, basic safety and how to avoid hazardous situations, which can occur while in the water. However I do not want my book to merely be a guide book. I want it to be beautiful. I want to be able to capture as much of the natural beauty as I can. In order accomplish this I need a HD professional grade underwater camera. With this camera I will create a gorgeous book which will immerse the reader in an underwater paradise. So please consider helping me create such a book, so that I can share my island and my passion with the world.

story:
The Story of Wander Lust: The Chocolate Made Me Do It

 

In life, we often have a picture of how we think the future will look. The picture is so clear to us, we can embrace it as if it has already come into existence. What do we do when we become so attached to a vision of how things should be that we lose sight of how things are?  When we are scared to alter our current course for fear it will change our future.

Take a moment to evaluate your day. Is it filled with draining people, boring routines, and an overwhelming desire for more? What if you stepped outside of your ordinary day-to-day and tried something different? Sure, it’s easy to dream about, but there are a million reasons why we just keep on keeping on. Sitting with our excuses and spending many of our days living out the monotonous moments creates complacency. in turn, all we can do is long for more.  When we alter the course, each moment becomes something so much more impactful. It changes our perspectives. It changes us.

My name is Devon Werner and I am the author of Wander Lust: The Chocolate Made Me Do It. I wrote this book as a way to chronicle my adventures and reflect upon the happenstance of my life. The process of writing this book made me realize that I wanted to share my story with others who may need to read it. I have been through some difficult moments in my life and found it helpful to read about others who had similar experiences. People who get it.

Join me as I welcome you in to some of life’s most epic moments, from adrenaline rushing adventures, hilarious outtakes, and the raw emotions of navigating through life, love, and loneliness. This book will take you on a journey through all of the feels.

As you read this book, I hope you realize that you are worthy of an epic story, regardless of what has been written before. When you prioritize yourself over your excuses, you too, can rewrite the story that you deserve.

You will love this book if you enjoy reflection and story telling that embraces self discovery and human connection.

Wander Lust: The Chocolate Made Me Do It, speaks to all readers regardless of age, background, circumstance whether you are a traveler; want to be traveler; adventure seeker; hopeless romantic; lover of chocolate; or just really want a relatable character that struggles with many of the same challenges we all face every day
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I am raising the publishing funds myself to own the book's creative rights and to invite readers on my journey, and I have set up various pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for final publication. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.

  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

When I pre-sell over 120 copies of my book ($5,500), I will publish.

When I pre-sell over 150 copies of my book ($6,500), I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell over 200 copies of my book ($8,500+), I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook!

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • A handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • Early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • The opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • An invite to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author


Devon Werner is an author, world traveler, physical therapist and lover of all things chocolate. She is a New Jersey native and alumni of Rutgers University. After earning her doctorate in physical therapy, Devon relocated to the Greensboro region of North Carolina, where she went into practice as a licensed physical therapist and neurologic critical care clinician.

For the better part of two decades, Devon has found herself navigating a multitude of unpredictable trials and tribulations. During those moments, she turned to the words of other memoir authors for a sense of connection and understanding. It was through this, that her own passion for writing ignited. Writing has become a way for her process through the emotions and make sense of it all.

Outside of writing, you can find Devon teaching at the university, face-timing with her older sister Donna, enjoying a cappuccino at the local coffee house, or spending some quality time relaxing on the front porch with her ninety-pound lab/boxer/mastiff mix, BlackJaxx (a nod to her Atlantic City road trips with her sister). Devon loves to run at the local track, take day hikes through the mountains of North Carolina, and exchange bouts of laughter over a nice glass of wine with her friends.

For more information, you can connect with Devon Werner at balance.hiraethandwanderlust@gmail.com and @hiraethandwanderlust on Instagram and Facebook.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #TheChocolateMadeMeDoIt and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Tag:
Instragram - Hiraethandwanderlust / @Newdegreepress
Facebook - Hiraethandwanderlust/ @NewDegreePress


Writing this book has been such an indescribable experience and I just want to say thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Reflectively yours,
Devon

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I'm Retsu Motoyoshi, a filmmaker based in Brooklyn, and one of the members of this project, House of Desires. Currently I’m working on the photo book of an abandoned brothel in Osaka. I’m sure that many of you have visited well-known tourist areas such as Tokyo, Kyoto, and Mt. Fuji, but I doubt any of you have been to the old red-light districts.

Yukaku, the Japanese name for these red-light districts, existed from the first half of 17th century until the postwar period. A Yukaku was a neighborhood containing government-approved brothels which were surrounded by walls and moats. Yoshiwara Yukaku, in Edo (the old name for Tokyo), was one of the most famous examples. In fact, many manga and Japanese movies have stories set in brothels, including “Damon Slayer”, a box office hit in 2020, and the Japanese classic “Street of Shame” by Kenji Mizoguchi. That explains why many Japanese people are interested in Yukaku as a part of their history.

Left : Demon Slayer - Yukaku Hen (2021)           Right : Street of Shame (1956)

Nowadays, more and more foreigners have become interested in old Japanese brothels through these manga and movies, as well as through social media, when other tourists share photos of their visits to these now-shuttered brothels.

For this project, we decided to make a photo book of Masumi, a brothel built in 1929 and has been empty for the past 20 years, collecting the memories of brothels that remain in their abandoned state. Through this we can keep a record of the history of Japanese brothels, their architecture, and characteristics. Through what remains of Masumi, we can learn much about the culture and customs of historic brothels before it's demolished.

Without a doubt, we don’t justify prostitution. The brothel system that existed before women’s rights was a shameful part of our history. We cannot ignore that women who worked as prostitutes in brothels at that time were victims of human trafficking. And of course we agree with the criticisms of the brothel system, but we still believe that visualizing what is disappearing and showing its value is one of our roles as journalists. And, surely Masumi has that value. Part of the revenues of this book will be donated to an NGO that supports women working in the sex industry. Additionally, revenues will be used for repairing and maintaining the Masumi building, and for preserving the personal effects that were left behind.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The photo book is written in both Japanese and English. The book design has already been completed, and printing will start after sufficient funds have been raised to cover the book binding, shipping, design and other miscellaneous costs from the crowd funding. Regardless of the amount raised, all those who contributed will receive their designated package. So please join us in this unique project! Since the photo book will be shipped from Japan, it may take additional time to arrive, and the item arrival may be delayed depending on circumstance of the postal service on your address. We appreciate your understanding.

1. A copy of photo book + Zoom backgrounds

   JPY 7,000 ≒ US$ 65 (shipping included)

2. A copy of photo book + Zoom backgrounds + 3 postcards

   JPY 10,000 ≒ US$ 95 (shipping included)

3. A copy of photo book + Zoom backgrounds + 3 postcards + Donation

   JPY 30,000 ≒ US$ 275 (shipping included)

4. A copy of photo book + Zoom backgrounds + 3 postcards + Donation

   JPY 50,000 ≒ US$ 460 (shipping included)

144 pages, 320x220mm (12.6x8.7inch), soft cover, title stamped with gold leaf, full color offset printing and spot colors

Currently we do not have a plan to distribute the book on any EC sites or bookstores outside of Japan. As of now this Indiegogo campaign is the only way to purchase.

 

Articles

In addition to the photos and captions of Masumi, we interviewed the following people and summarized their comments.

01: Memory and legacy of Tobita Shinchi, the last red-light district by Kunihiro Tokuyama, president of the Tobita Shinchi Restaurant Association

    An interview with the person in charge of the union that manages the red-light district of Tobita Shinchi

02: Tobita Yukaku is a pioneer of the Quick, cheap and direct sex trade by Ashita Saga, Professor at the Department of Japanese History, Graduate School of Literature and Human Sciences, Osaka City University

    A history, transition and international criticism of the red-light districts in Japan

03: Tobita Yukaku is an homage to Edo Yukaku by Shinya Hashuzume, Architectural historian

    The architectural characteristics of brothels in Japan

04: Arguing if sex work is right or wrong, an uncomfortable dilemma by Ritsuko Inoue, Non-fiction writer

     The viewpoint of a journalist who interviewed the brothel owners, prostitutes and other female workers and wrote pieces about it. She talks about their circumstances, human rights, and current ordeal of prostitutes.

05: Preserving the past by Shinichiro Kaneda, writer and journalist

    Why it is important to preserve what exists now before it disappears. An essay by an experienced journalist.

 

Here we share the preface of the book, written by Tadashi Shinohara, our editor.

In Osaka, Japan’s second largest city, there is a neighborhood called Tobita Shinchi. Full of wooden houses, the architecture retains the feeling of the past. This area bustled with people when it was a government approved red-light district. With the full enforcement of the Anti-Prostitution Act in 1958, many red-light districts disappeared in Japan, though Tobita Shinchi still retains its original ambience.

At the edge of Tobita Shinchi, there is an old wooden house with a sign that reads “Masumi”.

During the time when prostitution was approved by the government, it was a lively place with a large number of prostitutes who provided fleeting pleasure to their numerous clients. Even after the enforcement of the Anti-Prostitution Act, Masumi continued operating as a brothel, though under the guise of a restaurant, as was a typical practice in Tobita Shinchi. Masumi finally closed down about 20 years ago and now lies abandoned and forgotten by time.

The building is now quite deteriorated after being exposed to rain and wind for many years.

Some of the roof tiles have come off, the interior is full of dust, and some wooden floor panels have become detached. Yet once you open the rusty shutters and enter, Masumi unveils a vivid remnant of the brothel era.

Next to the entrance facing the main street, there is a stylish room that looks like a dance floor.

Upon opening the drawers of the abandoned bar counter, you can still find some old menus and name tags of women who likely worked there. Each one of the small rooms on the second floor is outfitted with varying designs, such as a ceiling shaped like the bottom of a boat, or an alcove with a curved log in the shape of driftwood. One can also find a hallway with a red felted carpet, cobblestone alleys on each side, and windows and stairs with moon motifs. These designs come from a time — between the Taisho period (1912-1926) and the beginning of Showa period (1926-1989) when Western culture was considered modern and fashionable.

Tobita Shinchi lost a lot of its sumptuous wooden architecture during the air raids of World

War II and was neglected in the economic development after the war. There are only a few wooden brothels from that period remaining today. Although Masumi is now abandoned, it is still a treasure trove that provides a glimpse into the brothels that once thrived in this neighborhood. It is important to acknowledge that these brothels and red-light districts stood accused of numerous injustices, including human trafficking and the exploitation of women, and it may well be the same for Tobita Shinchi. Nevertheless, we believe that leaving a record of Masumi before it is demolished contributes to the social and architectural history of Japan. We hope you find this single journey through the country’s brothel culture of interest as it is fading fast from Japanese memory.

–Tadashi Shinohara

Our Team

Tadashi Shinohara (Editor and journalist)

After working for Nikkei Business publication as a reporter, editor-in-chief of Nikkei Business Cross Media, bureau chief of Nikkei Business New York, and deputy editor of Nikkei Business, Shinohara left the company in 2020 to become an independent journalist and writer. He is the author of several books.

Retsu Motoyoshi (Filmmaker and photographer)

Motoyoshi studied film making at the School of Visual Arts in New York City. After working as an editing assistant for feature length documentaries, he transitioned to working on freelance projects. Since then, he has worked in numerous short documentaries as a cameraman, editor, and director. “Reality of America” and “Reality of American borders” series for Nikkei Business, as well as VICE’s “Outliers” are amongst his works.

Sho Monma (Art director and Graphic designer)

After graduating from the Fashion Institute of Technology in New York City, Monma worked in a New York based design studio. He has been involved in the branding of several products, and in catalogs for exhibitions of famous artists, galleries, and museums both in Japan and overseas, including the world renowned Gagosian gallery. He now works independently, mainly in art, fashion, and culture in New York City and in Tokyo.

Masahiko Sugiura (Property manager of Masumi, representative of Summit Real Estate)

As a real estate operator, Sugiura has been involved in town planning in Nishinari-ku, Osaka, and manages the property of Masumi.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people are not able to contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share our pre-sale campaign on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram with your friends, family, and followers.

You can easily share our Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page!

We have an Instagram and website for this project, and our editor will post articles on Medium, so please stop by them if you are interested in more info.

Thank you so much for your support!

Retsu Motoyoshi
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello, I'm Retsu Motoyoshi, a filmmaker based in Brooklyn, and one of the members of this project, House of Desires. Currently I’m working on the photo book of an abandoned brothel in Osaka. I’m sure that many of you have visited well-known tourist areas such as Tokyo, Kyoto, and Mt. Fuji, but I doubt any of you have been to the old red-light districts.
Yukaku, the Japanese name for these red-light districts, existed from the first half of 17th century until the postwar period. A Yukaku was a neighborhood containing government-approved brothels which were surrounded by walls and moats. Yoshiwara Yukaku, in Edo (the old name for Tokyo), was one of the most famous examples. In fact, many manga and Japanese movies have stories set in brothels, including “Damon Slayer”, a box office hit in 2020, and the Japanese classic “Street of Shame” by Kenji Mizoguchi. That explains why many Japanese people are interested in Yukaku as a part of their history.

Left : Demon Slayer - Yukaku Hen (2021)           Right : Street of Shame (1956)
Nowadays, more and more foreigners have become interested in old Japanese brothels through these manga and movies, as well as through social media, when other tourists share photos of their visits to these now-shuttered brothels.
For this project, we decided to make a photo book of Masumi, a brothel built in 1929 and has been empty for the past 20 years, collecting the memories of brothels that remain in their abandoned state. Through this we can keep a record of the history of Japanese brothels, their architecture, and characteristics. Through what remains of Masumi, we can learn much about the culture and customs of historic brothels before it's demolished.

Without a doubt, we don’t justify prostitution. The brothel system that existed before women’s rights was a shameful part of our history. We cannot ignore that women who worked as prostitutes in brothels at that time were victims of human trafficking. And of course we agree with the criticisms of the brothel system, but we still believe that visualizing what is disappearing and showing its value is one of our roles as journalists. And, surely Masumi has that value. Part of the revenues of this book will be donated to an NGO that supports women working in the sex industry. Additionally, revenues will be used for repairing and maintaining the Masumi building, and for preserving the personal effects that were left behind.
 
What We Need & What You Get

The photo book is written in both Japanese and English. The book design has already been completed, and printing will start after sufficient funds have been raised to cover the book binding, shipping, design and other miscellaneous costs from the crowd funding. Regardless of the amount raised, all those who contributed will receive their designated package. So please join us in this unique project! Since the photo book will be shipped from Japan, it may take additional time to arrive, and the item arrival may be delayed depending on circumstance of the postal service on your address. We appreciate your understanding.
1. A copy of photo book + Zoom backgrounds
   JPY 7,000 ≒ US$ 65 (shipping included)
2. A copy of photo book + Zoom backgrounds + 3 postcards
   JPY 10,000 ≒ US$ 95 (shipping included)
3. A copy of photo book + Zoom backgrounds + 3 postcards + Donation
   JPY 30,000 ≒ US$ 275 (shipping included)
4. A copy of photo book + Zoom backgrounds + 3 postcards + Donation
   JPY 50,000 ≒ US$ 460 (shipping included)
144 pages, 320x220mm (12.6x8.7inch), soft cover, title stamped with gold leaf, full color offset printing and spot colors
Currently we do not have a plan to distribute the book on any EC sites or bookstores outside of Japan. As of now this Indiegogo campaign is the only way to purchase.

story:
Parsemé de photographies, de peintures, de montages, d'illustrations et de textes, ce livre de 232 pages exige de ses trois auteurs (Julie, Anne-Marie et Arsénio) un travail colossal. Notre approche aborde les gens, les lieux et les objets qui donnent à la Ville de L'Assomption ses couleurs si particulières.

 Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

 Notre objectif est de produire un superbe livre de style table à café. Le papier et la finition sont d'une grande importance. Et ça coûte cher...

 L'impact

Nous nous intéressons à l'agriculture, à la culture, à l'architecture, à l'insolite. Notre projet est une incursion dans ce que nous percevons de plus beau à L'Assomption. Nous souhaitons que notre livre laisse sa trace dans l'histoire de la Ville, même s'il ne s'agit pas d'un livre d'histoire.

Votre contribution nous permet de nous attarder à l'aspect créatif du projet et de ne pas nous inquiéter de l'aspect financier.

 D'autres façons d'aider

Suivez notre page Facebook et aimez-la. Nous y publions de fréquents avis de recherche et votre participation est d'un grand secours.

Achetez notre livre en prévente.

Partagez notre campagne de sociofinancement avec vos amis.

story:
Short Summary

I am the author of seven previous books: Mal Occhio: The Underside of Vision (North Point Press: 1981), Dream Streets:The Big Book of Italian American Culture (Harper & Row: 1989), and Una Storia Segreta: The Secret History of Italian American Evacuation and Internment During World War II (Heyday Books: 2001), with both Mal Occhio and the Big Book now reprinted under my own Sanniti Publications imprint. Also under the Sanniti imprint are: Esty: A Novel/Memoir (Sanniti: 2012); Branded: How Italian Immigrants Became ‘Enemies’ During WWII (Sanniti: 2016); Earth Breath: Selected Blogs, 2009-2016 (Sanniti: 2017) and Suspect Love: a novel set in WWII San Francisco when Italian Immigrants were 'enemy aliens' (Sanniti: 2018).  

As with my previous books, I am choosing to launch Family Matter  by starting with a crowd-funded campaign--this to finance the novel's debut under my own imprint, Sanniti Publications, and to help with publicity. After that, it's anybody's guess. 

By joining in this effort, donors can help to mitigate some of the risk (and publishing novels in today's climate is a decided risk), while acting as the book's primary readers and supporters.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

In days gone by, book publishers often relied on “angels,” wealthy donors who wanted to associate with the gentile world of publishing. Now each donor, as a lover of literature, can become a kind of “angel” for this book—helping to get Family Matter into print in order to reach the many readers who still value well-crafted fiction. 

   The book is designed and print-ready. For a modest initial print run, and a little attendant publicity, I've calculated that I need about $1500. to print a novel that runs to some 400 pages. 

   Here’s how you can help. For a donation of $50., you get an autographed copy of the book. For $100., you get two autographed copies (give them as gifts). Donors who give $150. will receive the two copies and be mentioned in print as Sponsors on the Acknowledgments page. Beyond that, a $200 donor will be acknowledged in print as a Patron, and for $300 and up, you will be noted as an Angel. Please understand that to be acknowledged in the printed volume, the donation must be received before we go to press on or about May 22. If there should be a second or third printing, we should be able to acknowledge donors who miss this initial deadline. 

The Impact

The satisfying element here is cooperation. Mainstream publishing, now as cutthroat as Wall Street, is devoted mainly to finding the next blockbuster, while serious fiction has become an endangered species. It is for this reason that I started my own imprint in the first place, and that I am now venturing into publishing another novel.

By joining me in this effort, everyone can be a part of bringing this story--of a son coming upon the secret of his father's origins in Italy, and much more--to a reading public that has been trained to expect sensationalism of a specific kind from such stories. Cooperating to expand the range of what's expected in print may not bring instant change, but it does offer the chance to have an impact on what's to come.  

Risks & Challenges

As noted above, publishing as an independent represents substantial risks, especially in the areas of publicity and distribution. As an established author, with dozens of years of contacts in the Italian American community, I have a kind of network to help with both strands. But it would be foolish to underestimate the risks. That is why use of print-on-demand--which I have used in two previous books--helps. It provides both distribution networks and the chance to publish in small-enough quantities to avoid costly print overruns and inventory warehousing. Together with my networks built over the years, I'm hopeful that Family Matter will prove to be a secure investment. And one never knows when a novel like this will catch fire. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute monetarily, you can still help get the word out. Indiegogo offers tools that allow you to spread the word on the web via social media. As an individual, you can tell your friends both about the book, and about this campaign. Suggest Family Matter as a great gift book. Every effort, no matter its size or reach, will contribute to the whole, and be greatly appreciated.

story:
Help us finish the 2019 Hanging Lantern Review 7th annual print issue, preorder a copy, and reserve a spot at our Spring Reading + Release Party!

READING + RELEASE PARTY: 
Tuesday, May 21, 2019 (6:30 pm - Doors at 6) 
Santa Margarita Ranch Barn
Santa Margarita, CA

ISSUE RELEASE DATE: MAY 21, 2019

We're Hanging Lantern Review, San Luis Obispo's only literary journal made for and by Central Coast teens! We publish high quality middle school and high school fiction, nonfiction, poetry, and art, and we're ready to release our 7th annual Issue! Every pledge gets us closer to our goal, and ensures that we will continue to be able to invest in our local literary culture for years to come. 

Who are we? Our staff is made up of high school students from San Luis Obispo Classical Academy. We work all year to solicit quality work from our peers, curate, design, and publish our beautiful journal, coordinate a website, and host writing-inspired events. 

In 2013, we launched an IndieGoGo campaign, and with your help, we raised over $2500! That got us started. Since then, we have had an amazing seven seasons in print, and we want to keep going! Since we began, we have curated, printed, and sold hundreds of issues, purchased a new Mac computer for our designers, and funded a subscription for Adobe software. We have published work from high schoolers and middle schoolers from more than 10 local schools, trained and prepared dozens of teenage staff members for the business of publishing, and we've held two Summer Workshops for aspiring writers. Many of our former staff members and contributors have gone on to write and publish their work in college. 

Now, heading into another busy release season, we need just a little bit of money up front to get these journals out on time and allow us to throw an awesome Spring Reading & Release Party to celebrate what we've been able to accomplish together.

What We Need + What You Get

We'll need around $700 to cover the up front costs of printing and shipping the journal. We are an entirely self-funded school club. We raise and manage all of our own money. Therefore, every contribution makes a powerful impact!

Here are a few of our popular preorder + perk options: 

Preorder the 2019 Hanging Lantern Review Print Issue -- SHIP ($10)

Reserve a ticket to our Spring Reading and Release Party ($10) 

Print Issue + Release Party Ticket Bundle ($15) *Best Value

2 Release Party Tickets + 2 Print Issues ($30.00) *Best Value 

Note: if there is a perk you would like us to design for you, such as a specified number of release party tickets or journals, please email msshotwell@sloclassical.org and she will help design a reward for you and your family!  Or, if you just want to make a donation to the journal, we would be honored to have your help!

Risks + Challenges

This is a flexible funding campaign, which means we are opting to accept any and all donations, even if we don't meet our minimum goal. This is because the issue is on its way -- even if we don't meet the goal this spring, we will still get the issue out, and every dollar will help us to do that! Having the funds come early through our preorder eliminates strain on our budget, and allows us to get a head start for next year! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't pledge or won't be able to attend the release party, we would love help spreading the word through Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter!
story_txt: Help us finish the 2019 Hanging Lantern Review 7th annual print issue, preorder a copy, and reserve a spot at our Spring Reading + Release Party!READING + RELEASE PARTY: Tuesday, May 21, 2019 (6:30 pm - Doors at 6) Santa Margarita Ranch BarnSanta Margarita, CAISSUE RELEASE DATE: MAY 21, 2019We're Hanging Lantern Review, San Luis Obispo's only literary journal made for and by Central Coast teens! We publish high quality middle school and high school fiction, nonfiction, poetry, and art, and we're ready to release our 7th annual Issue! Every pledge gets us closer to our goal, and ensures that we will continue to be able to invest in our local literary culture for years to come. Who are we? Our staff is made up of high school students from San Luis Obispo Classical Academy. We work all year to solicit quality work from our peers, curate, design, and publish our beautiful journal, coordinate a website, and host writing-inspired events. In 2013, we launched an IndieGoGo campaign, and with your help, we raised over $2500! That got us started. Since then, we have had an amazing seven seasons in print, and we want to keep going! Since we began, we have curated, printed, and sold hundreds of issues, purchased a new Mac computer for our designers, and funded a subscription for Adobe software. We have published work from high schoolers and middle schoolers from more than 10 local schools, trained and prepared dozens of teenage staff members for the business of publishing, and we've held two Summer Workshops for aspiring writers. Many of our former staff members and contributors have gone on to write and publish their work in college. Now, heading into another busy release season, we need just a little bit of money up front to get these journals out on time and allow us to throw an awesome Spring Reading & Release Party to celebrate what we've been able to accomplish together.What We Need + What You GetWe'll need around $700 to cover the up front costs of printing and shipping the journal. We are an entirely self-funded school club. We raise and manage all of our own money. Therefore, every contribution makes a powerful impact!Here are a few of our popular preorder + perk options: Preorder the 2019 Hanging Lantern Review Print Issue -- SHIP ($10)Reserve a ticket to our Spring Reading and Release Party ($10) Print Issue + Release Party Ticket Bundle ($15) *Best Value2 Release Party Tickets + 2 Print Issues ($30.00) *Best Value Note: if there is a perk you would like us to design for you, such as a specified number of release party tickets or journals, please email msshotwell@sloclassical.org and she will help design a reward for you and your family!  Or, if you just want to make a donation to the journal, we would be honored to have your help!Risks + ChallengesThis is a flexible funding campaign, which means we are opting to accept any and all donations, even if we don't meet our minimum goal. This is because the issue is on its way -- even if we don't meet the goal this spring, we will still get the issue out, and every dollar will help us to do that! Having the funds come early through our preorder eliminates strain on our budget, and allows us to get a head start for next year! Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't pledge or won't be able to attend the release party, we would love help spreading the word through Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter!

story:
Summary

My name is Maddox Marie, and I am the author of Indimite. 

I'm writing this book because I love stories about ordinary people with extraordinary abilities. In every story, those with superpowers are feared, hated or loved, but they are always special. The phrase 'if everyone's special, no-one is' came to mind, and I wondered how true that was. 

What if everyone was special? What if there was a world where everyone had a superpower?

 

My goal with this series is to entertain and to build a rich and diverse world that provides a place to escape to and that inspires others to write their own stories. 

With Indimite, I want to explore themes such as redemption, asking if anyone ever reaches a point where they are beyond saving. I want to explore how a friendship between two characters that are, in many ways, each other's opposites can ignite change.

 

These characters are; Shay and Celeste.

Shay used to be a superhero. She saved the day from Indimites (those who use their powers to kill others). However, before the story has even begun, Shay was fired. Because of that, she struggles with depression and a sense of purposelessness.

Celeste grew up in a community that cut itself off from the rest of the world, and that forbids the use of powers. She is told over and over that powers are the work of the devil and that everyone outside her community is evil. After she loses control of her powers and causes the sacred songbird to escape, she is shunned. Determined to set things right, Celeste leaves the safety of her community and ventures into the outside world.

 

From the moment they meet their lives are entangled, and Shay has to teach Celeste to control her power. If she fails, it's both of their lives that are at stake.

 

Can Shay help Celeste in time, and stop her from becoming an Indimite?

 

 

For those who like...

Superpowers, the fantasy genre, redemption stories or unlikely friendships.

 

 

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021

  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in the summer of 2021

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will be able to publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. And when I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook!!!! 


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

  • Art of the story in the form of a poster, sticker or bookmark.

  • And much more!

 

 

About the Author

Maddox Marie is a biology student from Amsterdam. She balances her studies with work and writing. Her goal with writing is very simple: to entertain. She wants to create a rich world that speaks to the imagination and inspires more stories. 

Aside from writting Maddox loves to be creative in whatever way she can, from painting, writing, and making crafts. Her other passion is nature. She adores her two rabbits and strives to give them the best life she can. Her dream life would be to become a full-time author, rescue a bunch animals, fill her home with plants, and spend her free time learning new languages, learning to play an instrument and helping aspiring writers.  

For more information, you can connect with Maddox on: 

  • Twitter: @MaddoxxMarie

  • Instagram: @Maybe_Maddox

  • YouTube: Maddox Marie

  • Facebook: @MaddoxxMarie

 

Custom Preorders

Don't see the perk you want? Send me a private message, and we might be able to work something out. However, I can't guarantee that the perk you have in mind is one I can offer. 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Indimite and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

- Maddox

story:
Story of My Book

Feel Something is all about the importance of empathy in marketing. The book highlights why empathy is a vital part of your strategy and gives you clear tactics to implement Empathy Marketing throughout the entire buyer journey.

My name is Pat Timmons, and I am the author of Feel Something. I wrote this book because I have found success implementing empathy in my work across industries. At the end of the day, how can you market to someone if you don’t know how they feel?

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that Empathy Marketing is a practice and can be learned by anyone. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for Empathy Marketing. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you create more meaningful buyer experiences.

In this book, you'll learn about the history of empathy and how it relates to each phase of the buyer journey. You'll read stories from incredible marketing/sales leaders such as...

Daniel Pink and his advice on empathy and influence.

How Velveeta Cheese implements empathy into their social presence.

How Google’s social lab listens to the world’s emotions and acts with empathy.

You will love this book if you are a marketer, social media manager, product marketer, or CMO that wants to deepen connections with your audience and create meaningful work.

Feel Something is a nonfiction book that speaks to marketing practitioners and leaders who want to look at traditional marketing and audience growth in a new way.
 

The Book - Feel Something

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction history and science of decision making and empathy.

Part 2 contains chapters for each phase of the buyer journey, how empathy plays a role in that phase, and how you can implement Empathy Marketing at each phase.

Part 3 contains the conclusion, which highlights how empathy will get more important for marketers will see as time goes on.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer 2021.


When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • A chance to win an Empathy Care Package for 10 people every time I reach a 10th of my goal. (When I hit 500, 1000, 1500, etc.)
    • A limited edition set of Feel Something Crewneck and Sweatpants
    • A free Mental Health class from Coa
    • A pack of CBD Stress Gummies from House of Wise
    • Access to Audiense
  • And much more!
 

About the Author


Pat Timmons is a social media marketer with experience in tech, music business, advertising, and PR. His journey in marketing began at Emerson College with his major in marketing communications and entrepreneurial studies. Since starting and finishing at Emerson, Pat has had roles in all forms of marketing and is a “swiss-army knife” in the discipline.

While marketing is a strong passion for Pat, so is getting to know people and understand why people do things. Ever since he could remember, he has been constantly curious and relentlessly empathetic.

When Pat is not writing a book or a Tweet, he can be found hanging out with his nieces, family, or friends, going to a concert (when we aren’t in a pandemic), or making a homemade Caesar salad with a fresh homemade meal.

For more information, you can connect with Pat Timmons by texting him at 617-855-0404 and or following him at @pattimmons_.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FeelSomething and #EmpathyMarketing and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Pat Timmons
