story:
**I'll write up an EIGHTH original sexpunk story if it reaches $300!**

REACHED>>>**If this campaign reaches $200, I'll write up a SEVENTH original sexpunk story!**

**"This campaign will receive all funds raised even if it does not reach its goal." Everyone who contributes WILL receive a copy of the ebook!**

**Please see Update section on anonymous donating/pseudonyms**

The short and sweet - A LIMITED-TIME PRE-SALE PRICE

This is a LIMITED-TIME PRICE on an anthology of explicitly adult-themed science fiction short stories (what I like to call 'sexpunk' or 'sex-fi) with transhuman or posthuman characters.

After the 60 days, the work will go on Amazon, Smashwords and eManga. Pricing will be different. Not drastically so, but there will be a difference.

Transhumans / Posthumans

With respect to transgender folk, this is not an anthology of transgender work; it is a anthology of transhumans (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transhuman) and posthumans (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Posthuman).

In short, heavily modified humans (transhumans like cyborgs) and beings who have the outward appearance of humans but may be less like humans today (telepaths or hidden technology within the body).

Samples of my writing style

While Indiegogo will NOT allow me to post material of a sexual nature (or even links), you could check the "Click to look inside" section of my novella BUKKAKE BRAWL (US site: http://www.amazon.com/dp/B004FPYPOS/) on any Amazon to catch a good several pages of my style. And I'm going to post a short (non-erotic) portion of a story from PARALLACTIC O in the "UPDATED" section.

Story titles and descriptions

In "Heavenly Kiss, Earthly Treasure", a couple traveling in the New Orient are at a traditional Japanese hotel where they are invited to taste the 'kiss' of a mysterious woman.

In "Jizzemboweler", a clever murderer who disembowels his victims from the inside-out stalks the neon red-light ladies in the Floating World.

In "Blowad Bow Shock", a casual sexual tryst on the dying shell fragment that was once Earth turns into a battle for domination between two transhumans.

In "Back Orifice 2300", a freelance 'facker' uses his social skills to get himself into the skyrise apartment of a hacking target, only to discover the sentient android computer interface is ready to fight back against his advances. (Features both straight and yaoi versions of the story, in complete.)

In "Slug Orgy", a young college student has a bizarre encounter with warring gods who desire her earthly flesh.

Yet untitled story to be added! Will NOT be available in other versions of this anthology!

What contributors get

A copy of the ebook in PDF, mobi or epub versions (your choice). Your name in the "Special thanks to" section of the ebook.

How far along is the book?

The fiction has been written and edited, and the cover finished. Aside from a few aesthetic decisions and conversion into the three formats, it is ready.

Is there a print version?

With apologies, no.

So, why Indiegogo?

Several reasons: 1) Indiegogo allows me to get the book out directly to readers, 2) Indiegogo allows me to communicate with readers, thereby creating stronger ties for those who enjoy such things, 3) Indiegogo allows me to do things my way. 4) An Indiegogo campaign also helps me to spread the word.

A quick note on the title of the campaign

According to Indiegogo rules (which I am MORE THAN HAPPY to respect), campaigns must be family-friendly. The "O" in the title is the first letter in a 6-letter word that many sexually-active adults enjoy.

A copy of the ebook in PDF, mobi or epub versions (your choice). Your name in the "Special thanks to" section of the ebook.


How far along is the book?
The fiction has been written and edited, and the cover finished. Aside from a few aesthetic decisions and conversion into the three formats, it is ready.

Is there a print version?
With apologies, no.

So, why Indiegogo?Several reasons: 1) Indiegogo allows me to get the book out directly to readers, 2) Indiegogo allows me to communicate with readers, thereby creating stronger ties for those who enjoy such things, 3) Indiegogo allows me to do things my way. 4) An Indiegogo campaign also helps me to spread the word.
A quick note on the title of the campaign

According to Indiegogo rules (which I am MORE THAN HAPPY to respect), campaigns must be family-friendly. The "O" in the title is the first letter in a 6-letter word that many sexually-active adults enjoy.

story:
Short Summary: 

I began writing poetry and creating one act plays in seventh grade. My first published play, "Dover Escapade" was adopted by the school system as its "must perform" junior high school play for about ten years. With that, I became an author. My newest collection of poems,  MY LIFE REVEALED: FIFTEEN TO SIXTY FIVE" is my collection of poems reflective of each year of my formative adult life. The catalyst to publish was THE WREN. Read about it in one of the poems. Each is focused on the universal experiences of life, death, birth, joy and sorrow.  As I wrote I realized that it is also a coming out journey from that first girl crush to where my journey took me to my wife. 


"Jan's ability to share her life through poetry is at times gut wrenchingly honest. As I read her poems I felt like I went on the journey of her life with her. She candidly and expertly puts into prose the moments of her life that helped shape who she is today. A true Renaissancewoman's journey through life that will inspire any reader and lover of poetry."

                                 Leeanne Matusek, President, B.L.T.N Productions, LLC
                                 Executive Director of Fittin' it In, Inc.

                                 A Non Profit Wellness Organization

_________________________________________________________________

What you Will Receive and the Impact It Will Make

Your contribution will enable me to print the first 250 copies of my bound collection and distribute it.  Each person contributing $25 or more will receive a signed copy of "FIFTEEN to SIXTY FIVE" and an invitation to the San Francisco premiere of the movie utilizing the poems now in workshop planning. 

Life is long and filled with incredible experiences. Emotions run high and low as one meanders through the challenges of aging. Each person has a unique story to tell. Mine includes sleeping with Janis Joplin to nearly losing my son to SIDS. It includes numerous relationships- both male and female. It includes those fabulous "ah-ha" moments and those "I wish I could die" moments. It is a life from which the reader gleans his resonance. Laugh with me and cry with me. Most important learn.

Other Ways You Can Help

Let people know that this is an important book of poems and its words will profoundly affect people. If you cannot contribute now, support my efforts with talking about it on your Facebook page. Mention it over coffee in the morning. A gentle whisper about it at church or after making love! It all helps. Thank you

story:
What is The Country Grind Quarterly? 

The Country Quarterly is a smokin’ new quarterly magazine specifically for those folks who have ran away from the cities in search of a simpler, saner, and more fulfilling life. All content is written by fellow rural punks and is intended for a rural punk audience. On grid or off, a vegan gardener or a hunter/trapper, lone wolf or married with kids, in small towns, deep in the bush, tucked away in the mountains, or on a farm in the prairies...this magazine was invented for all kinds of punks* to share skills, ideas, projects we're working on, and what's important.

The Country Grind is published quarterly, around the solstices & equinoxes, and is free to all punks with rural addresses. The Grind is totally created by volunteers--no one's getting paid for this; we're in it cause it's important.

Here's a taste of what's in Issue One:

  • a home birth story, 
  • an article on sheet mulching, 
  • DIY oil lamps, 
  • Diesel Engine care in the winter, 
  • some cute and awesome stories, 
  • a herbalism column, 
  • tanning hides, 
  • growing garlic, 
  • classified section, 
  • forest restoration, 
  • a kids section,
  • and of course, the first of many of "Haybale's Get Rich Quick Schemes."

*Our definition of punk isn't very strict. As far as this magazine is concerned, if you are living your life in a D.I.Y. way, are battling the status quo, and have some level of disdain for authority you're a fucking punk. (Of course, wearing mostly black and listening to loud aggressive music doesn't hurt.)

The first issue was paid for how?!?!

Here's the deal: if you help us reach this goal, the Country Grind Quarterly will be able to bring out two hot new issues - Spring Equinox & Summer Solstice 2014 and keep it free for rural subscribers. Your contributions will go directly to printing & shipping the Country Grind and building networks among rural punx and urban subscribers who might not otherwise know about how to care for your diesel engine in the winter....etc. And your support will help give us the headstart to make this magazine a more sustainable venture, so we're not paying for it in student loans.

And for full transparency, if we don't reach our goal, all the money we raise will STILL go to publishing Country Grind...and if we raise more than $2500, you'll be guaranteed an issue at the Fall Equinox and beyond!

Approximate Costs: Issue 1 (printed in December, 2013) cost about $1000 in printing and shipping, so here's our breakdown: Issue 2 (Spring), printing & shipping: $1000 + Issue 3 (Summer), printing & shipping: $1000 + Indiegogo fees & shipping for super dreamy perks: $500 = Total: $2500


Thanks for supporting the Country Grind Quarterly! We couldn't do it without ya.


Wanna subscribe?

You can! http://www.countrygrind.net/p/subscribe.html

Want to submit to the Country Grind?

Want to send us some photography, writing, or drawings? We're stoked on submissions for Issue 2 from rural punx*! Check out our page for info on submission guidelines and how to submit. http://www.countrygrind.net/p/submissions.html

How to donate directly, and ads in CG

Here's another way you can help...buy ad space! We will only accept ads from rad folks selling/promoting shit that is in line with DIY punk ethics. More details here: http://www.countrygrind.net/p/advertising.html. 

Also, if you'd prefer, you can donate directly by using this Paypal link on our "Donations" page: http://www.countrygrind.net/p/donate.html or sending cash/cheque/money order directly to 

Gretchen Bonegardener (CG founder/editor)
Box 266
Ochre River, Manitoba
R0L 1K0
Canada

story:
Tools to Change Yourself and the World


Hi, I'm Justin Charles Beck. My spiritual journey began in 1997 when my partner and wife of 13 years died of non-hodgkins lymphoma/cancer. As a full time caregiver and true believer in her recovery, I was tossed into a world of loss and uncertainty when she passed. Rediscovering myself became a full time occupation and creating a meaningful life became my focus. Through the continuous study of kabbalah, the ancient spiritual wisdom, with masters in the US and Israel, I implemented practical tools to restructure and give greater meaning to my my life. I have now entered the phase of sharing the gift of this useful knowledge to students in Fairfield Ct in a weekly course with all proceeds going to a charitable nonprofit organization.

A main understanding of kabbalah is to receive with intent to share. By taking this proactive step and creating this manual for living, with your help, we can share with those who seek a fuller more connected life.

My total focus during the process of writing this book will be how the reader can most quickly and effectively absorb the information and put it to practical use in their lives. Unlike other books on this subject I will delve immediately into the features and benefits and practical applications. For those that require historical proofs and foundational groundwork, I will refer them to great existing texts or websites, of which there are many.

Readers will be engrossed and empowered through my ability to articulate concepts onto the written page that connect with their intellect and emotion as a bi-product of my previous professional business plan, screenplay writing experience, worldly travels and spiritual experiences. All referenced sources are established and credible.

I am passionate about helping others help themselves.

We live in a physical reality understood through the prism of cause and effect. Through the act of free will each of us has the ability to not only directly alter our own our path but indirectly alter the course of the future of all mankind and creation. Every thought, spoken word, and action creates a reality. This book will assist in choosing them wisely. As the saying goes: "chop your own wood and it will warm you twice" - as does your participation in creating this reality.

The money I raise through this campaign will cover the costs of design, editing, production and printing, distribution, and 10% will be donated to a charity/non-profit.

Thank you so much for your support.

I thank your for your contribution to this project. The immediate practical application of this ancient wisdom will be available to all who seek it. Your contribution has positive benefits to you in this lifetime, previous, and future, and creates a positive ripple effect which reverberates throughout.

In addition to the benefits listed above, for your support you will be the first to receive a copy of this life changing book. I am also offering extra perks for greater participation.

I want to thank all my teachers, guides, study partners and mentors who with humility and love have shared their knowledge and abilities to help bring me to this place.They primarily include Rabbi Reuven Wolf, Rabbi Mordecai Finley, Rabbi Yitzchak Schwartz, Rabbi Danny Yiftach, Rabbi Gedalia Fleer, Rabbi Avraham Sutton, Rabbi Avraham Greenbaum, Rabbi Avraham Trugman, Rabbi Naomi Levy, Rabbi Yitzchok Adlerstein, Rabbi Ozer Bergman, Rabbi Shalom Brodt, Rabbi Eyal Rav-Noy, Rabbi Shlame Landa, Yedidya Blanton, Avi Schira, David Saks, Jonathan Omer-Man, Nahar Shalom Yeshiva, Simchat Shlomo Yeshiva, Chabad, Aish Hatorah, and Kabbalah Center Los Angeles. Most of all I want to thank G-d for this life and the opportunity to transform physicality into spirituality.

Feel free to use your free will and get the word out about this campaign through Indiegogo share tools.

All the best...

Justin C.Beck

aka: Yitzchak


We are all in this life together.

http://www.kabnow.net
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J8caJaz26Ks

story:
The money is going to promote the first book in this series, Phoenix Element Normality Twisted. This book has been available since December 5th of 2013 and published by an independent publisher called Black Rose Writing. Since I am not with a big name publisher, I only get one copy of my book. In order to get the word out, I want to be able to give away signed copies, have book signings and attend local book fairs. I need to promote Phoenix Element to make it a success. I've already done two interviews (with a third in February) and during my free time I get the word out via Twitter, Facebook and other social media outlets. This is why I need help. I work a full time job to cover my bills. I do not have much room to help fund promoting my book. I would use the money to purchase a bulk amount of my first book, Normality Twisted. I would also be able to afford websites that work to market new authors and their books.

Phoenix Element Normality Twisted on Amazon

Phoenix Element official site

Phoenix Element on Facebook

Black Rose Writing

story:
Thank you so much for your generosity and support in helping us reach our original $2,500 goal. We are now hoping to reach $3,500 to give our programs the extra boost they deserve!

 

Receipts for donations will be provided upon request. Check out our nonprofit status on the UNCW GSA website (scroll to the bottom of the linked page). 

Our Story

The UNCW CRWGSA (how's that for an acronymn?) is a student organization at University of North Carolina Wilmington that provides channels for its Creative Writing MFA students to share their work, connect with other writers, and assist in the fostering of new writers through multiple outreach programs.

The CRWGSA funds The Reading Series, an annual calendar of public readings put on by our students. We also bring acclaimed writers to Wilmington for public readings through programs such as the AWP Benefit Reading Series. By hosting as many as eight readings per year, we strive to encourage culture and literacy in the community.

One of the CRWGSA's most important responsibilities is sending our students to the AWP Conference, where they and thousands of other writers attend readings, craft lectures, and teaching panels. By providing our students the opportunity to attend AWP through travel reimbursement, we provide enrichment and an opportunity to engage in the global writing community.

This year, we are also reinvigorating our involvement with the UNCW Creative Writing Department's various Outreach Programs. We would like to fund at least one scholarship for a high school writer to attend the Young Writers Workshop in Summer 2013 (and with your help, would love to fund many more).

We also aim to contribute to Writers in Action, a program that sends our MFA students to nearby public schools to teach creative writing to students who might otherwise not be exposed to it, and Teens Out Loud, a writing workshop our students offer to local teens diagnosed with HIV and AIDS. By supporting a new generation of writers, we hope not only to encourage literature but also encourage literacy in a state where more than one in ten people struggle with reading and writing.

This holiday season, we ask that you donate a little (or a lot) to help send our writers into the local and the global writing communities, to share the word about literature and literacy.

 

The Impact

Budget cuts across the board at state schools such as ours mean that our resources have been drained. Without your help, the CRWGSA will not be able to fund many of its programs this year. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

At least $2500, which (after IndieGoGo fees and incentive costs have been subtracted) will be used to fund our various programs. If we meet our goal:

  • $500 will go to a Young Writers Workshop scholarship

  • $1200 will help send 20-30 students to AWP 2013 in Boston

  • $200 will fund Reading Series events for the 2012-2013 school year

  • $100 will go toward bringing in an AWP Benefit Reader

The remaining money will go toward increasing resources for Writers in Action and Teens Out Loud. As we exceed our goal, we will continue to fund these programs at approximately the same percentages. 

What you get:

Literary goodies!

Our team of students are working hard on designing bookmarks, broadsides, stickers, and t-shirts for you at low donation levels.

One free issue of Ecotone, a Chautauqua bundle, and copies of Edith Pearlman's award-winning Binocular Vision from Lookout Books are up for grabs.

Signed books from our alumni, including Carmen Rodrigues and Daniel Nathan Terry.

Signed books and bundles from our illustrious faculty are available for donations starting at $100.


MFA Alumna Rebecca Petruck's manuscript critique has been claimed! Thank you so much for your generosity and thank you so much to Rebecca for volunteering her services!

Donors of $600 and up will have a Young Writers Workshop scholarship created in their name, as well as a personal letter from the student whose attendance was made possible by the scholarship. 


We are proud to say that at least one young writer will be recieving a full need and merit based scholarship for the 2013 session! Another youth will recieve a partial scholarship for 2014 right now, but if we reach our new goal of $3,500 we can fully fund that student as well!

 


More incentives will be added throughout the campaign so keep checking back!

ALL donations will come with our profound thanks, and a continued commitment to the written word in North Carolina and beyond.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the Word! Let your friends know about our fundraiser. Even if you can't contribute financially, a link on your Facebook page could make a huge difference!

More incentives will be added throughout the campaign so keep checking back!
ALL donations will come with our profound thanks, and a continued commitment to the written word in North Carolina and beyond.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Share the Word! Let your friends know about our fundraiser. Even if you can't contribute financially, a link on your Facebook page could make a huge difference!

story:
Short Summary

A Girl In The World is a series of children's books.

Created to encourage children and adults to share thoughts and feelings, to nourish philosophical and spiritual communication and to foster emotional connection.

Each book will be made in Australia with full environmental considerations and certification, so that it may sit in the hands of children and adults not having cost the earth. Raising awareness for sustainable printing and eco friendly trade and practices will empower children and parents to be part of the solution.

We aim to raise awareness and support for Orphfund, a life saving and life changing organisation that champions children's wellbeing and welfare throughout the world.

My own childhood left a lot to be desired, lacking in the care and protection that was needed to keep me safe from harm is very much a part of my own life story. I know what it means to grow up feeling vulnerable and alone, empty of inspiration and afraid. This is the sad reality for so many children in our world. I believe that A Girl in The World can and will make a positive difference, enriching connections through storytelling, creativity and inspiring and helping others. 

Finding and providing opportunities that encourage and allow children to connect, understand and express themselves is vital to their mental and emotional wellbeing and spiritual health and growth. This helps children to believe in and understanding that thoughts and feelings are valued. 

Helping build confidence and resilience in children, and develop a healthy sense of themselves, is of the greatest importance. It clears a path for them to develop a strong belief in who they are and their ability to make positive choices. One of the greatest gifts we can offer our children is the knowledge that they have choices, that they can choose to respond or react to the world around them. Empowering children through choice.

Our children deserve to live and thrive in a world that cares for, inspires and nourishes them. Offering them every possibility to follow their dreams. Our children and our environment are precious, they are a gift and deserve to be treated as such.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help. We need to raise enough money for the first print run of 1000 books. This will cost $15,000. This amount represents the cost involved in having the book produced with full environmental considerations and certification in Australia.

You will recieve a beautiful eco friendly,hard cover, top quality children's book that makes a positive difference, not only in your world but in the world of children elsewhere.

It dosen't cost the earth and raises awareness about the why and how of sustainability, helping our children understand the importance of respecting and caring for themselves, each other and the environment.

By creating children’s books with purpose, that are eco friendly and sustainable with transparency and information as to the printing and production of these books, we open up the world of possibility to explore and communicate with children about the environment and our need to protect it. To talk with children about sustainability and it's importance. 

Opening up conversations with children, and sharing the vast number of creative ways we can do that, will help them to become pro-active and equip them to make decisions and choices regarding the future of our planet and the use of it’s resources. 

Technically speaking...the books will be produced using 100% recycled content, carbon neutral and to FSC standards, vegetable / soy based inks with low VOC content to FSC standards. No petroleum-based inks. Process and materials to meet ISO Environment standard 140001 and have FSC / PFC / CoC certification.

If we do not reach our goal, all funds will still go into the printing of the books and we will continue to look for funding support to bring A Girl Into The World...into the world.

If we reach our goal and go beyond we will be doing cartwheels and will be eternally grateful, it will enable us to get more books printed and out into the world.

The Impact

We believe that the beauty of A Girl In The World is in its purpose. To create a series of children's books that help make the world a better place. Sharing stories that inspire children and bring people closer together. Books that don't cost the earth and raise awareness and funds for Orphfund along the way. Inspiring children to help children and take care of the environment. Inside each and every cover of the books you will see the following information about Orphfund and the work they do.

A Girl In The World supports Orphfund.

Orphfund is a volunteer based organization helping abandoned, orphaned and vulnerable children around the world, regardless of race or religion.

They run grass root, self-sustaining, community projects, that provide shelter, nutrition, health care, support, education and training, ensuring all children have a happy and bright future.

Orphfund are purely volunteer based and they are proud to ensure that 100% of any donation will reach children living in poverty.

To find out more about them, the work that they do and how you can help, please visit

http://www.orphfund.org/drupal/

A Girl In The World will be donating a percentage from every book sale to Orphfund. This as part of an ongoing vision to pay it forward, helping parents and children help children less than fortunate around the world.

Our long term goal in Australia is to build A Girl In The World Cottage that provides a safe place, support and shelter for girls and women in need.

So when you purchase a copy of A Girl In the World you are a part of that journey and we thank you' 

Other Ways You Can Help

We truly appreciate any and all sharing, caring and donation. If you are unable to help financiaily, perhaps you can pass it on to someone who can, your goodwill is a gift. Helping us get the word out is a wonderful thing and we would be ever grateful for that.

Use all the social media tools you can and the old fashioned word of mouth.

Maybe you know somebody who can help...

Like A Girl in the World says, "Maybe I can't save the world, but maybe I can save somebody who does." Thanks again for your time.

story:
My Story

I want to further my writing career by building on the success of my horror book series, Dark Bites.  The fours books in the series (and the collection), have done well as my first foray into the self publishing ebook and print-on-demand market.  I'm trying to expand my efforts to market my latest book "Dead Woman's Curve" as well as multiple projects in the pipeline ("The Vengeance" to be published March 2012).  My iMac G5 (circa 2004) is old and has now died.  I desperately need to replace it and purchase Office and Photoshop Essentials.  If I raise enough I need to replace my digital camera as well with one that can also take HD movies (for trailers/short horror films).


Should you want to find out more about my work or me, you can always visit my Amazon Author Central page (http://www.amazon.com/-/e/B004FRP8CY) or Smashwords.com (http://www.smashwords.com/profile/view/robertropars), friend me on Facebook (robertropars), or even follow me on Twitter (twitter.com/robertropars). I'm am doing this for real.  I'm a down-to-earth, indie self-published horror author writer who is struggling to get his writing going to a bigger market.

The Impact

A new voice in fiction (horror genre specifically) looking to promote positive central female characters and return classic horror creatures to their roots.  Having money to get the right tools and marketing will let expand quickly and capitalize on the initial buzz.  As you can see from the reviews, they've so far been overwhelmingly positive:

http://www.amazon.com/dp/B006L15OP8

What We Need & What You Get

I'm looking to raise $4,000 in order to replace my computer, get a new desk, camera, printer, and purchase marketing/promotion for my works (Google Ad words campaign(s), horror magazine ads, radio ad(s), printed marketing material, enough copies of the paperback version to do book signings and send to reviewers).


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me promote my book and campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Paulette Kouffman Sherman is a breast cancer survivor who is a psychologist, life coach and author.  She was told the day before her 41st birthday that her cancer had a 25% chance of coming back and she just completed a year-long treatment of surgery, chemotherapy and radiation.  This experience brought many lessons including clarity about her soul's mission to write a Legacy Project of 22 books, including a 4-book Cancer Path series that would help women with breast cancer to view it as a spiritual path.

Dr. Paulette Kouffman Sherman is a psychologist, life coach and the author of 9 books (by March 2013).  She has helped many people with challenges concerning illness, career goals, anxiety, depression and relationship issues during her career.

This campaign is important because getting a diagnosis of breast cancer is scary and the treatment grueling, so women going through this experience need hope, guidance and a powerful context.

Dr. Sherman funded the first 4 books in her Legacy Project herself and now she wants funding partners for this four-book series. Even when being very careful with expenses, each book costs at least $1500 to produce.  In addition, she wants to donate free books to at least 25 cancer libraries so that women going through breast cancer treatment have access to this series for free for years to come.

Thousands of omen can benefit from your generosity and so can you.

What We Need & What You Get

Here are 10 packages and ways you can help so that this Cancer Path series gets published and disseminated.  See the Perks described on the side.

The 4 book Cancer Path series consists of 4 books.  This is how this series came about and what each book coverst:
 

Going through breast cancer was one of the hardest years of my life.  I wouldn't wish it on anyone, yet I have found that a lot of growth came from it. I love to write, so I wrote about my experience and came through it with a book that was more than 300 pages.  It was part memoir, part self-help, as well as a photographic account of how I got through everything, including losng my hair.  Writing was my lifeline and I hoped that in sharing this, it would help other women walk this path.

I thought it unlikely that women struggling with cancer would want to read such a lengthy book, so one day while I was walking the beach I had a revelation that it was meant to be a 4-volume series called The Cancer Path, which could embrace women at different points along their journey. This is the 4 book series:

 Volume 1- The Quick Essential Guide to Breast Cancer: Diagnosis, Surgery, Chemo & Radiation is a slim guide that you could slip into your purse and flip through for easy tips and references about how to get through your 8 months of standard treatment.  Even if you don’t have cancer, this could be that first cancer gift book that could connect you to someone else who had this experience.  And if you are facing your own cancer diagnosis, this book provides an overview and some practical tips about how to get through surgery, chemo, or radiation.  Some women might prefer just to read these tips, get through conventional treatment, put cancer behind them, and stop there.

Volume 2- The Cancer Path: A Spiritual Journey Through Healing, Wholeness & Love approaches cancer on a level deeper, as a spiritual initiation.  It allows you to heal cancer from the inside-out by giving you tools to address healing your mind, body, emotions, and Spirit as you go through your traditional treatment.  If you are like me, you may not want to be a passive recipient of healing.  You may want to take action and create a year of treatment that leads to greater wholeness and health on all levels.  I read over 60 books so that I could address these four levels of healing for you, with many sub-headings, as well as to explore many discrepant issues like diet, how your immune system affects cancer, whether your emotions, thoughts and stress affect cancer, and so forth.  This book is for the cancer patient who wants to do serious inner work and learn spiritual lessons along this path.

Volume 3- My Date With Cancer: 21 Spiritual Lessons is a gift book that explores 21 spiritual lessons from Volume 2, without the more intensive research, explanation, and exercises.  It has pictures and brief spiritual lessons that a cancer patient can flip through while in the hospital.  It's intended to provide love and hope, and to point out some spiritual lessons that can help patients grow and be positive while on their cancer path.

Volume 4 - Create Your Own Cancer Path Workbook is a workbook to help cancer patients keep track of their personal experience and story.  It is a journal/workbook with ideas, springboards and exercises so that they can remember and record how they got through chemotherapy, what and who inspired them, the lessons they learned, and other memorable moments.  In the end, they can use this workbook as a template for writing and publishing their own story, if they wish.  Its can be a journal, a place to vent and cope, and a legacy for their children, grandchildren, and great-grand children to learn from their story.  Research shows that there are many benefits to cancer patients from journaling and leaving a legacy behind.

Don't forget to tell people about your perks and get them excited!

All funds collected will go towards completing this 4 book Cancer Path series even if we don’t reach the entire 22 book goal here.

The Impact

The Cancer Path  examines healing on all four levels, examining controversial questions related to cancer treatment, addressing coping strategies, healing resources and providing many practical tips along the way.  Dr. Sherman references over sixty books as milestones along The Cancer Path but realizes that each woman's journey is unique.  She knows that these books will help many survivors.

The Cancer Path will help them:

  • Feel less alone on this startling & challenging journey
  • Develop a Healing Team that supports you
  • Explore ways to process your emotions
  • Find Spiritual meaning in your illness
  • Choose positive thoughts and a powerful context about your cancer
  • Explore the research on controversial issues related to your cancer treatment
  • Examine diet, movement and alternative therapies for your body
  • Consider the role of meditation and prayer
  • Reflect upon the spiritual lessons you receive on your cancer path
  • Marry healing on all four levels for optimal holistic growth

...And so much more!

 

Dr. Sherman felt that her cancer path brought her spiritual purpose into focus and she wants the same for others going through this!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Get the word out and tell friends about this campaign.

Thank you so much for your support, ahead of time!

The Cancer Path will help them:

Feel less alone on this startling & challenging journey
Develop a Healing Team that supports you 
Explore ways to process your emotions
Find Spiritual meaning in your illness
Choose positive thoughts and a powerful context about your cancer 
Explore the research on controversial issues related to your cancer treatment
Examine diet, movement and alternative therapies for your body
Consider the role of meditation and prayer
Reflect upon the spiritual lessons you receive on your cancer path
Marry healing on all four levels for optimal holistic growth

...And so much more!
 
Dr. Sherman felt that her cancer path brought her spiritual purpose into focus and she wants the same for others going through this!


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Get the word out and tell friends about this campaign.
Thank you so much for your support, ahead of time!

story:
About Spilt Infinitive Magazine

Spilt Infinitive is a new online literary magazine brought to you by the good folks at Hubris Press, an independent press in Portland, OR.  We were previously known as Present Tense, which published two print folios in 2012.  Since then, we've decided to relaunch and rebrand.  Our aim is to publish an online issue quarterly, starting in April of 2013, and to print an anthology of the year's best work annually. 
 
In short, Spilt Infinitive's goal is to be a literary magazine without the pretentiousness that tends to come with said magazines.  We want to publish work by new and emerging writers, pieces that are gritty, honest, and true.  Our editors are all graduates of the Pacific University MFA writing program who have donated their time to the cause.  We seek to create a platform that promotes good literature while helping to build a community of writers.

What We Need (and What You'll Get!)

Our current goal is $3500, which will cover the costs of having a new, sleek website designed to showcase our quarterly online magazine.  In addition, the money will cover the cost and shipping of your rewards, paying Indiegogo and PayPal fees.  The more money we raise, the more viable our publication is, so don't stop donating if you see we've exceeded our goal.  Any additional funds will go toward future Spilt Infinitive and Hubris Press print anthologies, promotional costs, and perhaps even to buy our editors a cup of coffee from Starbucks.

Here's a list of the super cool things you will get if you help fund us, brought to you uniquely by Spilt Infinitive magazine:

  • Digital download: A digital download of our first issue to read on your mobile reader. $5
  • Spilt Infinitive stickers: Show off your support for us with these cool stickers - put them in your car window or on your laptop or wherever you want to spread the word. $10
  • Present Tense Folio #2: Since we know you already love literature, enjoy a print copy of our last folio. $20
  • Spilt Infinitive t-shirt: What better way to show your support than by wearing our name across your chest?  We don't know what they'll look like yet, but with the talent on our staff, they're bound to be stupendous. $30
  • Rough Men Stand Ready anthology: Enjoy a copy of the latest anthology out from our publisher, Hubris Press.  Rough Men Stand Ready, a collection of writing from veterans from World War II through the Afghanistan War.  These are the voices of the soldiers who fought, the family members that stood behind them, the family members and civilians who tried to understand, the memories of the veterans.  It's an amazing collection, and something we at Spilt Infinitive are proud to be associated with. $50
  • Untitled Sean Davis memoir: One of our founder, Sean Davis, has a memoir coming out next year from Portland's Ooligan Press.  Get a copy signed by Davis as soon as he has copies in his hot little hands. $50
  • Prints by the Brothers Davis: One thing we pride ourselves on at Spilt Infinitive is the ridiculous amount of creativity among our editors.  In addition to being a talented writer, Sean Davis is also an incredible artist.  He and his brother's art (which you can see here) will soon be featured in several McMenamin's pubs around Portland.  Get an 11x17 print of their original artwork. $75
  • Grab bag: If you just love literature and want to show substantial support, donate now and receive three of the above rewards. $100
  • Your name in print: Always wanted to see your name on the front of a book?  Well, now you can.  As a perk of being our most generous funder, our first print antholohy will show as "published by Hubris Press and YOUR NAME."  (You'll also get a copy of the anthology, of course!) $500

Other Ways You Can Help

So you want to help, but you're broke?  No problem!  Do us a favor and help us tell everyone you know about our project so they can help!  Share a Facebook post, share our link on Twitter.  We'll take all the help we can get.  Think of karma - someday it'll all come back on you in a good way!
 

About our Editors

Sean Davis – Editor – Sean has a BA in English from Portland State University and a MFA in Fiction from Pacific University. He is also a consulting editor at the Silk Road Review. His stories have appeared in The Willamette Week, The Good Men Project and his memoir of his time in Iraq and Hurrican Katrina clean up will be out next year published by Ooligan Press.  You can view his website here.
 
Kase Johnstun – Fiction Editor – Kase holds a BA in English from Weber State University, an MA in English from Kansas State University, and an MFA in Nonfiction from Pacific University. He teaches Written Communications at Kansas State University and is working on a creative nonfiction book about the epidemiology, medical history, and affected lives of Craniosynostosis (McFarland 2014).

Tabitha Blankenbiller  – Creative Nonfiction Editor – Tabitha is a graduate of the Pacific University MFA creative nonfiction program. She works as the Senior Nonfiction Editor at Silk Road Review and as a staff contributor for Spectrum Culture. Her personal essays have been published in journals including Owl Eye Review, Sliver of Stone and Brevity. Her memoir manuscript, Paper Bag is in development.  View her entertaining food blog here.
 
Tiffany Hauck  – Creative Nonfiction Editor – Tiffany holds a BA in English from University of Texas Arlington and will soon obtain an MFA in Creative Nonfiction from the Pacific University MFA program.  She has been published in Hippocampus and Split Lip Magazines, and currently teaches at community colleges in the Denver area.  She is also working on a book length memoir entitled Rough Cut about depression, addiction, and questionable relationships that is set against the backdrop of Hollywood.  Her website can be viewed here. 
 
Brandi Katherine Herrera – Poetry Editor – Brandi Katherine Herrera is a Portland-based poet, journalist and editor who holds an MFA in Poetry from Pacific University. Her stories, reviews and Pushcart Prize nominated poems have appeared in The Oregonian, VoiceCatcher, Charlotte, Written River, Fish Bones Poetry Review and others. She is the co-editor of The Lake Rises, a forthcoming WITNESS POST Series anthology (Stockport Flats, 2013).

About Spilt Infinitive Magazine
Spilt Infinitive is a new online literary magazine brought to you by the good folks at Hubris Press, an independent press in Portland, OR.  We were previously known as Present Tense, which published two print folios in 2012.  Since then, we've decided to relaunch and rebrand.  Our aim is to publish an online issue quarterly, starting in April of 2013, and to print an anthology of the year's best work annually. 
 
In short, Spilt Infinitive's goal is to be a literary magazine without the pretentiousness that tends to come with said magazines.  We want to publish work by new and emerging writers, pieces that are gritty, honest, and true.  Our editors are all graduates of the Pacific University MFA writing program who have donated their time to the cause.  We seek to create a platform that promotes good literature while helping to build a community of writers.

What We Need (and What You'll Get!)
Our current goal is $3500, which will cover the costs of having a new, sleek website designed to showcase our quarterly online magazine.  In addition, the money will cover the cost and shipping of your rewards, paying Indiegogo and PayPal fees.  The more money we raise, the more viable our publication is, so don't stop donating if you see we've exceeded our goal.  Any additional funds will go toward future Spilt Infinitive and Hubris Press print anthologies, promotional costs, and perhaps even to buy our editors a cup of coffee from Starbucks.
Here's a list of the super cool things you will get if you help fund us, brought to you uniquely by Spilt Infinitive magazine:


Digital download: A digital download of our first issue to read on your mobile reader. $5


Spilt Infinitive stickers: Show off your support for us with these cool stickers - put them in your car window or on your laptop or wherever you want to spread the word. $10


Present Tense Folio #2: Since we know you already love literature, enjoy a print copy of our last folio. $20


Spilt Infinitive t-shirt: What better way to show your support than by wearing our name across your chest?  We don't know what they'll look like yet, but with the talent on our staff, they're bound to be stupendous. $30


Rough Men Stand Ready anthology: Enjoy a copy of the latest anthology out from our publisher, Hubris Press.  Rough Men Stand Ready, a collection of writing from veterans from World War II through the Afghanistan War.  These are the voices of the soldiers who fought, the family members that stood behind them, the family members and civilians who tried to understand, the memories of the veterans.  It's an amazing collection, and something we at Spilt Infinitive are proud to be associated with. $50


Untitled Sean Davis memoir: One of our founder, Sean Davis, has a memoir coming out next year from Portland's Ooligan Press.  Get a copy signed by Davis as soon as he has copies in his hot little hands. $50


Prints by the Brothers Davis: One thing we pride ourselves on at Spilt Infinitive is the ridiculous amount of creativity among our editors.  In addition to being a talented writer, Sean Davis is also an incredible artist.  He and his brother's art (which you can see here) will soon be featured in several McMenamin's pubs around Portland.  Get an 11x17 print of their original artwork. $75


Grab bag: If you just love literature and want to show substantial support, donate now and receive three of the above rewards. $100 


Your name in print: Always wanted to see your name on the front of a book?  Well, now you can.  As a perk of being our most generous funder, our first print antholohy will show as "published by Hubris Press and YOUR NAME."  (You'll also get a copy of the anthology, of course!) $500




Other Ways You Can Help
So you want to help, but you're broke?  No problem!  Do us a favor and help us tell everyone you know about our project so they can help!  Share a Facebook post, share our link on Twitter.  We'll take all the help we can get.  Think of karma - someday it'll all come back on you in a good way!
 
About our Editors

Sean Davis – Editor – Sean has a BA in English from Portland State University and a MFA in Fiction from Pacific University. He is also a consulting editor at the Silk Road Review. His stories have appeared in The Willamette Week, The Good Men Project and his memoir of his time in Iraq and Hurrican Katrina clean up will be out next year published by Ooligan Press.  You can view his website here.
 

Kase Johnstun – Fiction Editor – Kase holds a BA in English from Weber State University, an MA in English from Kansas State University, and an MFA in Nonfiction from Pacific University. He teaches Written Communications at Kansas State University and is working on a creative nonfiction book about the epidemiology, medical history, and affected lives of Craniosynostosis (McFarland 2014).

Tabitha Blankenbiller  – Creative Nonfiction Editor – Tabitha is a graduate of the Pacific University MFA creative nonfiction program. She works as the Senior Nonfiction Editor at Silk Road Review and as a staff contributor for Spectrum Culture. Her personal essays have been published in journals including Owl Eye Review, Sliver of Stone and Brevity. Her memoir manuscript, Paper Bag is in development.  View her entertaining food blog here.
 

Tiffany Hauck  – Creative Nonfiction Editor – Tiffany holds a BA in English from University of Texas Arlington and will soon obtain an MFA in Creative Nonfiction from the Pacific University MFA program.  She has been published in Hippocampus and Split Lip Magazines, and currently teaches at community colleges in the Denver area.  She is also working on a book length memoir entitled Rough Cut about depression, addiction, and questionable relationships that is set against the backdrop of Hollywood.  Her website can be viewed here. 
 

Brandi Katherine Herrera – Poetry Editor – Brandi Katherine Herrera is a Portland-based poet, journalist and editor who holds an MFA in Poetry from Pacific University. Her stories, reviews and Pushcart Prize nominated poems have appeared in The Oregonian, VoiceCatcher, Charlotte, Written River, Fish Bones Poetry Review and others. She is the co-editor of The Lake Rises, a forthcoming WITNESS POST Series anthology (Stockport Flats, 2013).

story:
Short Summary

Hi. My name is Donna Fontenot and I've been a blogger since 2004, back in the early days when blogging was just starting to become known. I've also been a prominent member of the online marketing world for even longer, as well as a web developer. In short, blogging and everything involved with having a presence online has been my forte for many years. And yet, none of that would have been possible without my interest and abilities as a writer. Without the ability to  create great content, success online would have been short-lived.

I've finally decided to bring this all together into a novel that incorporates my experiences as a blogger with that of my fascination with the deviant criminal mind. Just for fun and interest, I've also rolled my heritage into the novel as well. I'm a little Cajun gal from the Louisiana bayous, and frankly, there's no better setting I can imagine for a good mystery / suspense / thriller novel.

I believe the story of The Grave Blogger is one that will intrigue readers and capture their attention. The book is nearly finished and it will be time to publish it soon. I know I am a good writer, but I also know that even the greatest writers need help to create a commercially successful book. That's where you come in. With your generous help, I can turn a great book into one that gets the attention it will need to succeed.  You can see the book's website and video trailer at TheGraveBlogger.com .

Even small contributions are welcome and will earn my sincere gratitude. One thing you can count on - I will remember you, and that may come in handy some day - you never know!

What I Need

I need funds to hire a good editor, primarily. Even if I don't meet the complete funding goal here to accomplish all that I need, hiring a good editor is an absolute must, so any partial funding I receive will be applied to that need first. All other funding will cover getting a professional book cover and book interior designed, purchasing a block of ISBN numbers, ordering enough books to give out as review copies, and running promotional campaigns, which will include press releases and social networking promotions.

What You Get

Besides my undying gratitude, you get the sorts of goodies I've listed in the perks to the right.

  • Every contribution gets a mention either in the book itself or on my blog.
  • Of course, many contributors will receive a free copy of the book either in digital or paper form.
  • Some of you can even get a character in the book created with your name! Really, how cool is that? :)
  • There's even a level which entitles the most generous of contributors to enjoy a stay at one of Louisiana's most intriguing places, including a bayou tour that will put you right into the setting of the novel!

The Impact

I don't promise that my novel will change the world. It won't. It won't feed starving children, or bring peace on Earth. But it will make a huge difference in my life, because I will have accomplished my lifelong dream. As we grow older, we begin to look back on the things we wished we'd done. We all end up with a bucket list at some point in our lives. My bucket list is rather small, as I'm content with the choices I've made. But one item has been rattling around in that bucket for a lifetime. I not only want to write a novel, I want to write a novel that readers love. I believe I can do that with your help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you can't contribute right now. Times are hard. I really will appreciate even small amounts, but if that is more than you can or want to give right now, there are other ways you can help me. I would very much appreciate your help in spreading the word about this campaign of mine. It's easy to do. Just tell people about it. Near the top of this page are some social network buttons. Click the Facebook Like button, or the Tweet button, or the Google Plus button. Blog about it, email people, or spread the word any way you choose. I would very much appreciate it!

story:
12/25 update: The book is now published and available on Amazon!

Don't miss my article on the Matador Network: How to crowdfund your next travel adventure.

Travel can change your life. But travel can be expensive. 

So what's the answer for the young, broke, and travel-hungry?

The Unschool Adventures Guide to Online Travel Fundraising is an e-book that will explain how to creatively raise money for a life-changing travel experience. Whether you want to backpack across Europe for two months, take a full-blown gap year, or simply attend summer camp on the other side of the country, this book will help you get there.

Who I Am & Why You Should Fund This Book

I’m Blake Boles, the author of two books about giving yourself an adventurous, nontraditional education: College Without High School and Better Than College.

I’m also the founder and director of the travel company Unschool Adventures, through which I lead international trips, writing retreats, and other programs for self-directed teens.

A huge number of young adults (and their parents) have asked me how they can afford a big international trip. In response, this May I wrote a blog post about raising money for travels, projects, and education using the crowdfunding websites Kickstarter and IndieGoGo. The post was based on two of my own successful fundraising campaigns: Zero Tuition College ($2370) and Better Than College ($9200).

The response to my post was overwhelming! Young people started writing and asking me for campaign-building advice—specifically for their travel goals—which I took on as a fun challenge. Soon, they were asking for more guidance than I could provide. What resulted were multiple successful travel fundraising campaigns, including:

  • McKinley to summer camp, $1200 (raised in only 30 hours!)
  • George to New Zealand, $3505
  • Sage to summer camp, $1850
  • Tessa to Brazil, $4800

With The Unschool Adventures Guide to Online Travel Fundraising I plan to further serve the community of travel-hungry young people by expanding my original article into a compact e-book with new research, stories, and concrete advice. I'll explain the fundamental concepts behind crowdfunding, walk you through building a campaign on IndieGoGo, and add a new section on minimizing travel costs. I'm adding a new section on classic money-earning techniques, as well as lots of guidance for  creating truly valuable perks—not just postcards and thank-you notes. Most importantly, I'll explain how to fulfill your travel dreams by approaching fundraising with a true sense of entrepreneurship, rather than asking for handouts. (For example, by raising a significant amount of your goal on your own first, then using crowdfunding to bridge the gap. Also by learning how to ethically harness social media to broadcast your campaign.)

This book won't just be useful for travel fundraising. If you're interested in earning money from a creative project (e.g. film, book, craft), raising money for a cause, or launching a tiny business, The Unschool Adventures Guide to Online Travel Fundraising will give you the inspiration and mindset necessary to get started.

What I Need & What You Get

I’m publishing this book in two e-book formats: PDF and Kindle. In order to do this, I'm spending money on:

  • Editing & proofreading
  • Cover design by Vincent Perez of Everlovin' Press (completed already; see right)
  • Design and conversion services for the Kindle e-book
  • Design services for the PDF e-book
  • IndieGoGo and PayPal fees

In total, I need approximately $1500 to produce this book. I'm writing the book between October 15th and November 15th—while directing the Unschool Adventures Writing Retreat 2012, in fact! (It's my self-assigned writing challenge.)

By donating to my campaign, you get the chance to pre-order the book, get your name included in the credits, and receive one-on-one campaign-building advice and travel mentorship. You might even design the Unschool Adventures April Fools trip: a fake trip that will be announced on April 1st. (Think: Skinny Dipping in Alaska, or The Diamond Theft Adventure!) Update: the April Fools perk has been taken!

There's no risk when you donate: If I don't reach my fundraising goal, I'll still write and publish the book and you'll still receive the perks. The final product will be delivered before Christmas.

Please note that you don’t need to own a Kindle device to read this book's Kindle file; you can read it on any smartphone, tablet, computer, or through a web browser.

The Point of It All

Travel has positively transformed my life many times over, whether through my first solo international homestay in Chile at age 14, backpacking across Europe at 19, meandering through South America at 23, or discovering India at 28 (pictured above, with cobra). I feel truly fortunate to have enjoyed so many travel opportunities.

With this book as a tool, I hope that more people—especially the young—will be able to transform their lives through travel. A little bit of money shouldn't stand between you and your dreams. That’s what this project is all about.

If you can’t donate, please share this web page with your friends and family. Use the IndieGoGo tools at the top to recommend this page via e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, or Google+.

story:
Our beautiful weekend!

We laughed and challenged; read and listened; inquired and empathized; hugged, sold books, signed them.

Nearly one hundred people attended the first Festival of Women Writers on Sept. 6, 7, 8 of 2013 in Hobart, New York, the Book Village of the Catskills, cited by Green Door Magazine as “the reading capital of New York State.”   A tiny Village of 400 residents tucked away in an inspiring Western Catskills Valley, in 2013, Hobart, NY welcomed nineteen distinguished women writers who shared their ideas and insights with each other, other writers, readers, and book lovers in each of the villages's six independent bookstores, amidst the glorious Catskill backdrop, AND had the opportunity to sell their books.  We want to build upon this glorious beginning. We want to help the nineteen participating writers we've invited for this year's Festival to be able to set aside a weekend to celebrate their creative lives. We want to build a community of women and an opportnity for women to develop, promote and sell their books.

We need your help to provide food, lodging and honoraria to the participating writers. We're asking for your financial contribution to match the public funds we have received. 

 "Oh, yes, I will be back next year.  They won't be able to keep me away!" proclaimed Esther Cohen after last year's Festival. This was a pretty universal sentiment from those who performed readings and conducted writing workshops in 2013. Returning in 2014 are: Bertha Rogers, Marianela Medrano,  Lynn Domina, Cheryl Boyce Taylor, Mary Johnson, Dara Lurie, Esther Cohen, Sophfronia Scott, Alexis DeVeaux. Joining this stellar group will be: Stephanie Nikolopoulos, e.j. antonio, Tayari Jones, Mermer Blakeslee, Tara Betts, Ginnah Howard, Simona David, Remica L. Bingham-Risher, Dahlma Llanos-Figueroa, Kat Rosenfield,   Maria Mazziotti Gillan, 

Returning also will be Festival organizers, Cheryl L. Clarke, poet and Breena Clarke, novelist. 

HELP US DO IT AGAIN.

WE CAN USE ALL CONTRIBUTIONS.  ALL FUNDS WILL BE USED DIRECTLY TO SUPPORT THE FESTIVAL'S PARTICIPATING WRITERS.

PLEASE HELP US BY SPREADING THE WORD.

story:
Landscape magazine must stay

Are you one of the thousands of readers who've enjoyed Landscape Magazine for the last years? Then please help us continue making it! The current 'owners' sadly have no time left to make this awesome magazine for us anymore. But we don't want it to stop existing! Landscape is a free magazine made with passion for you bikers out there. So we went and have a talk with them and worked things out. We will continue the magazine for them!

What We Need & What You Get

Of course over the years there has been a lot of money invested in Landscape (website, iPad App, events, etc. etc.) and they want something in return: some cash! We believe they've earned it and Landscape Magazine should not be bought by a big publisher who will only use the contacts for their own magazines and let Landscape Magazine die. So help us raise the cash to continue Landscape Magazine the way it was and the way it should be in the future! And as a thank you we will send the first new issue to your door, together with some awesome stickers!

The bottom line

Landscape Magazine must continue! Help us do that and help yourself to more free Landscape Magazines in the years to come!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the cash to help us, then please tell your friends about it, maybe they can contribute.
